story:
We present to Your attention the project sandbox MMORPG-WillDeria

The game will reveal the whole romance of adventure and piracy.

The game is currently in development. We have made a lot of efforts to develop it! In the end we will release it!

 

Open world

 

Overview of location with elements of battle

 

• Game engine - Unreal Engine 4

• Direction of the game -Game sandbox mmorpg is a seamless open world that does not have loading levels. Territories live in realtime. WillDeria will take you to an era of travel, adventure and piracy.

Before you open the expanse of the world's ocean with islands and archipelagoes.

• Locations - The game will have different climatic zones and habitats of animals. The dream of every traveler to explore the harsh Arctic zones, impenetrable forests and tundra marshes, tropical thickets and hot sandy deserts. Tops of the highest mountains and intricate branches of karst caves.

Explore the open world

• Transport - Riding on a horse or in a wagon by land. By sea on a ship or boat. Different types of ships, from the rowing boat to the legendary Line ships, will make adventures even more fascinating!

• PVP \ PK system - Fully free with no restrictions and no secure zones. The only place where you can leave your character safe is the bedroom in the tavern. You can be killed at any moment whether it's a village or a capital. There will be a counter pvp \ pk. Your reputation will depend on it.

• The combat system on the Land is a non-target combat system. The system allows you to feel the character alive. One shot one corpse - this is possible. If you shoot with a musket on the bare man's torso, you will definitely kill him with 1 shot. If the armor is worn on the character, the damage from your weapon and the percentage of its protection are calculated. The difference can be large, so the bullet will not do any damage. But it can stun the enemy. Cold steel is the same, you can sneak up and inflict a fatal blow in the back to the enemy. Our game will make people unite in groups, because without help you are nobody. If you are killed and taken away all your inventory. Your body lies for a certain time, after it disappears. You can rob during this period. If you yourself accidentally died. You must get back to your body in order to take all your things from it otherwise you will lose everything.

• The combat system on the Sea is non-target. Every living person participates in the management of the ship and the better the crew is equipped with a live team, the stronger and faster it will be. Every man must control the gun. A weapon without a player will become useless. If there are no people on sails, then you will not sail. Your maneuvers depend on the coordinated actions of your team. The actions on the ship can be replaced by the NSA team, hired in the tavern, but their training level will be lower than for real players.

• Boarding - there are several options to stop an enemy ship - it's to break his masts, tear all the canvas, or have time to throw enough grappling hooks to pull the ships together. A ship is not your personal toy. You can not build it alone. (you will only build ships of class 5 alone). If you lost a ship, do not think that after appearing on the shore after death you will have it in inventory. You do not have a ship. You have to make one of the two, take it back or search for a ship at auctions in the port.

• Ship weapons - a large variety of cannons, smooth-bore cannons, mortars, falconets, harpoons, and by material, cast iron bronze, etc ... We abandoned the nuclei, the grapes, the bundles and the bombs, because it means the end of the piracy century. The wooden ship will be an easy target from the big damage! The century of linear sailboats ended at about the same time!

• Kraft system - Kraft system is - Found a recipe - learned - collected the necessary materials - create. You can buy a standard set of recipes for weapons or for a ready weapon in a shop. You need to go on a quest for more exclusive weapon models. One recipe is one weapon. Recipes will appear in random places around the world with a certain periodicity.

• Construction - You can build your house, your village and even your city and fort. Protect your home!

Fortress siege 

Mass battles 

• Weapons - Large selection of small arms, muskets and pistols. Bows and crossbows. A huge selection of melee weapons: knives, daggers, swords, axes, halberds and much more.

• Quest system - Quest starts a chain of tasks that tells you about the NPC and about his house, the village where he lives. Each chain has an interesting plot. There are presences of standard quests (bring, kill, collect, take cargo or kill other players) without it anywhere. The uniqueness of our quest in the system is that if you earned a bad reputation in a particular city, the Mayor can assign you a hunt, a quest for your capture (alive or dead) for a reward will appear! Tasks will be interesting and will cause conflicts between players!

Research of the ruins 

Dangerous adventure

Epic Monsters

• Relationship system - relations with the NPC of the game world and you as a Player depend directly on the reputation that you earned. If you are a robber, your reputation has a negative value. You will be treated like a pirate. Materials will become more expensive in the market. The guards will be careful with you. If the guards see a small conflict involving you or carrying a gun without a holster, they will have to send you to prison or to execution. You will be able to use all the privileges in the territory of pirates.

• Resources - All resources are extracted! Example: You need a tree, go and cut as much as you need, ore will have to be mined in mines or in mountainous areas.

• System of skills - what do you do and swing! The state of the character will depend on weather conditions, fatigue and hunger.

Contacts:

Website - http://willderia.com

youtobe

facebook  

vk - https://vk.com/willderia

Email - WillDeria@yandex.ru /  Zoomika@outlook.com

 

Help the WillDeria project!

For your help you will receive various PERKS: 
1. Exclusive in-game items. Pirate's chest, the chest of the traveler 1, 2 and 3 grade. Set of weapons 1, 2 and 3 rank. Pirate's GOLD set. Platinum pirate's set.


2. The key to the game. 

3. Free all updates!

4. Premium account.

5. The game on Blu-ray Disc.

6. Access to the alpha test.

7. Access to the beta test.

8. The layout of the ship.

9. A real battle axe and knife engraved with your name!

From the developer:

Hello, everyone! I am Alexey. I am one of the main developers of the project “Willderia”. We’ve been working on the project for more than half a year. There are 11 people in our team of developers. In addition to the core staff, we closely cooperate with users from other countries who are directly involved in the development of our project. At the moment we’ve spent about $ 35000 on the project. This amount includes the cost of purchasing essential equipment, the purchase of Content and support for our developers. As for the creation of the game, the idea appeared by chance while sitting over a beer with a friend. Having started talking about some pirate romance, how it would be cool to plunge into a modern game with stunning graphics and incredible adventures that could drag you into yourself. Based on colorful memories of my favorite game "Pirates of the Caribbean 2" we began to form a staff of employees who got mad when they hear the word pirates. There were not so few of them! Here it all started. Allocating tasks and roles, we immediately started creating a game! We put our souls into this project because it’s more than just a game. We check everything 10 times and until all the staff agrees, the content won’t be included in the game. The creation of the game has become one of the main components of life for us and takes at least 12 hours a day for development. Such a fast pace affects the family relationships and the main job which helps to keep the project afloat and compensate the enthusiasm of the Developers! We want to introduce our game to you and hope that you will like it. Depending on your support we will decide how quickly and efficiently the game will be launched. Involving funds we are looking forward to the release of the game in Steam in early access to the 3rd quarter of the 19th year. The game will be released in the format of buyToPlay and those users who support our project will be provided with various bonuses. (Silver / Gold / Platinum kits). You can read more on the site. Initially, the game will be multi-server type where each player can create his own server and invite friends there. There will also be official servers. In the future, the game will be completely transferred to the MMO RPG mode, where the server will live until the last person playing. 

It is based on ‘Unreal Engine 4’. Our Game will go through all stages of development. Alpha, Beta tests. The sandbox mmorpg game is a seamless open world. WillDeria will take you to an era of travel, adventure and piracy. The expanse of the world's ocean with islands and archipelagoes will open up before you. You’ll have the opportunity to touch the unique worlds with their own ecosystems, different climatic zones and the habitat of animals. The dream of every traveler is to explore the harsh Arctic zones, impenetrable forests and tundra marshes, tropical thickets and hot sandy deserts, tops of the highest mountains and intricate branches of karst caves. All these studies will not do without the private transport. Riding on a horseback or in a cart overland and by sea on a ship or a boat. Numerous types of ships, from the rowing boat to the legendary Manovars, will make adventures even more fascinating! The world of Willderia is a harsh and dangerous place which is not for weaklings. You will need protection things, and which ones you choose. There is a large variety of small arms, muskets and pistols, bows and crossbows. A huge selection of melee weapons: knives, daggers, swords, axes, halberds and more. Defend yourself with any facilities, whether it is a hammer or a stone. Any means are good in a dangerous situation! And you will have enough enemies. A wild animal or any other man, whether it’s a pirate or a nice guy, can harm you. The sea is no less dangerous place. Predatory inhabitants will not let you quietly admire the underwater beauties. People - that's the main enemy. Sea battles are an integral part of the journey around the world of WillDeria! You can’t do without navigation. Compass and map are the best companions for any traveler.

When going on a long trip or voyage, you need to take care of provisions. A variety of food will pacify the ardor of any gourmet, but do not dream of eating a restaurant dish in the middle of the desert! Hunting and fishing will save you from starvation. And an oasis or any other source of water will not let you go crazy with thirst. Traveling the world, you have found a beautiful place and want to stay there

forever?! The system of building houses and villages will give you this opportunity! You can build your little house by the river. Or together with other players you can establish a village, or even a city with a pier and a wall for protection. And believe me, the wall will come in handy! The system of free "PVP at any time in any place", you can be killed.

There will be no levels in the game. The system of skills is constructed in the following way – the things you do you get pumped. At any time, you can choose your type of activity and achieve mastery of a skill. Depending on the skill level, some certain "skills" will appear. For example, such as "skill fencing" which is responsible for the accuracy and strength of the impact. "Parrying" bias, block of impact. The skills of the gunner - "the speed of reloading the gun" "accuracy", etc.

Let’s sum up. Willderia is a various game. Everyone will find a place here, whether you are a warrior, a robber, a merchant or an artisan and even if you are a farmer – just get a cattle, plant vegetables and live peacefully on the continent! There is a place for everybody! But if you're a pirate, assemble a team as quickly as possible, build a ship and go forward to adventure! And now I want to conclude my statement. I hope you enjoyed it, thank you for your attention.

You can rob during this period. If you yourself accidentally died. You must get back to your body in order to take all your things from it otherwise you will lose everything.• The combat system on the Sea is non-target. Every living person participates in the management of the ship and the better the crew is equipped with a live team, the stronger and faster it will be. Every man must control the gun. A weapon without a player will become useless. If there are no people on sails, then you will not sail. Your maneuvers depend on the coordinated actions of your team. The actions on the ship can be replaced by the NSA team, hired in the tavern, but their training level will be lower than for real players.• Boarding - there are several options to stop an enemy ship - it's to break his masts, tear all the canvas, or have time to throw enough grappling hooks to pull the ships together. A ship is not your personal toy. You can not build it alone. (you will only build ships of class 5 alone). If you lost a ship, do not think that after appearing on the shore after death you will have it in inventory. You do not have a ship. You have to make one of the two, take it back or search for a ship at auctions in the port.• Ship weapons - a large variety of cannons, smooth-bore cannons, mortars, falconets, harpoons, and by material, cast iron bronze, etc ... We abandoned the nuclei, the grapes, the bundles and the bombs, because it means the end of the piracy century. The wooden ship will be an easy target from the big damage! The century of linear sailboats ended at about the same time!• Kraft system - Kraft system is - Found a recipe - learned - collected the necessary materials - create. You can buy a standard set of recipes for weapons or for a ready weapon in a shop. You need to go on a quest for more exclusive weapon models. One recipe is one weapon. Recipes will appear in random places around the world with a certain periodicity.• Construction - You can build your house, your village and even your city and fort. Protect your home!Fortress siege Mass battles • Weapons - Large selection of small arms, muskets and pistols. Bows and crossbows. A huge selection of melee weapons: knives, daggers, swords, axes, halberds and much more.• Quest system - Quest starts a chain of tasks that tells you about the NPC and about his house, the village where he lives. Each chain has an interesting plot. There are presences of standard quests (bring, kill, collect, take cargo or kill other players) without it anywhere. The uniqueness of our quest in the system is that if you earned a bad reputation in a particular city, the Mayor can assign you a hunt, a quest for your capture (alive or dead) for a reward will appear! Tasks will be interesting and will cause conflicts between players!Research of the ruins 
Dangerous adventureEpic Monsters• Relationship system - relations with the NPC of the game world and you as a Player depend directly on the reputation that you earned. If you are a robber, your reputation has a negative value. You will be treated like a pirate. Materials will become more expensive in the market. The guards will be careful with you. If the guards see a small conflict involving you or carrying a gun without a holster, they will have to send you to prison or to execution. story:
I’m offering you a dark fantasy story with secrets and details that are not always visible at first sight. The story will be written no matter you are involved in events or not. But you will have an opportunity to participate in it and bring it into your sight. The basic idea: you are not a super hero, who is able to change whole world, but you will have an opportunity to change the outcome of events. You are a cogwheel which will behave well or badly. Also you will have a wide set of battles - an important part of the game. So, move on.

small hint:  if you don't want to read the details about every part of the game, just scroll down page and look the screens. It will help you to understand the game briefly

The game format is an old book with illustrations. The second part of the game is the game board where you have to make measured steps. The board where the tactical part takes place. A chessboard-like type, to be more precise. 

Third part is playing cards. Yes, old paper playing cards with illustrations. 

Summing all these things up, we can have some picture. Yes, it’s unclear (yet). We will fix it soon.

We have a book with a story, we are free to move where we want (and we will have many opportunities there), we take parts in events (or don’t, everything will have an affect on the story). If we are involved in turmoil (fights), we will have deep interaction on a game (tactics) board with actions and game cards.  

 

Are you still intrigued? Do you want to understand what kind of the story are waiting for you and how it works? Let's talk about each thing in details.

 

Some global events that are the foundation of the story have ALREADY happened. The world is huge, but these events had an effect on massive territories and all aspects of life by it’s own kind. Some aspects significantly changed, some ones felt changes less. The main essence - the world has changed, and the inhabitants have adapted to it, some ones had not. The population significantly decreased. There are no inhabitants who passed consequences without a trace.

We are experiencing the world, where the Middle Ages live style is still a base of surviving and total atmosphere, similar to NoMans Lands and Wilds (hello, The Witcher 3!). Meanwhile, past events played a great role (which are related to the story and the plot of the game), which gave a rise for rudiments of the first discoveries (and in some places and not the first) such as mechanics, possibility to use the electricity and the first devices based on it, steam machines, and other stuff.

To clarify a bit what is waiting for you and leave some space to your mind, I will propose an example.

Imagine  “Fallout” world with all it’s technologies, made in past, or Morrowind world with the Dwemers, who have sunk in ages (past events in the game had been not so far ago). But all this story stuff moved to the Middle Ages. One of you might remember Arcanum with magic and technologies, but it will be far from the truth. By the story, there is no opposition between technology and magic. Technology is more like something, that has made an incredible leap and great discoveries. It has become impossible to move this line in the modern world where player take place. The knowledge is lost and there no help to wait from inside with new one. A kind of Post apocalypse in the Middle Ages. As all popular stories like, humanity had not been mutilated beyond recognition. But big changes have come (including weather). You have to find out what happened and choose your own way through this difficult world environment.

Many of you can say: Why do you just not tell the basic story? I have an answer – you have to find what is going on in this world and the main plot. Every detail will give you a spoiler of the key of the story moments.

 

This story is about the world and events, but not about specific heroes. Nevertheless, the game will have many unique picturesque characters with its dark stories. All of these individuals who found a place in this world has its own interests, and you have to act with them ... or not.

I can’t say for sure at this moment, but we have a plan to implement Afterword for each character you met (as in Fallout with settlements). The decision to make it will depend on the achieved goals of the Project.

All of us want to walk in an interesting world to look at spellbinding corners of the lands (whether it's the Huge Old Town with large half empty quarters and haunted interiors or it is ruins of an abandoned tower with its secrets, or the smoggy swamps, the Deep Forests where the light can barely break through).That was small spoiler for you. It’s your choice where you want to go.Every of this part will depend on several factors. First, your desire to explore the Lands (this possibility will be provided). Second, your advertency (as a player) will give you a chance to reveal hidden terrains (or set of character parameters will help you).


There will be many hidden actions in the game. If your character can't find them yet (not enough skills), you can do it by yourself using text input (as in Fallout 1 or Leisure Suit Larry).This is not a mandatory part of the gameplay. Therefore, by carefully reading the story, you will be rewarded with advanced features. These actions can lead you to hidden events, locations, valuable things, etc.

As a result, for example, there will be moments when you can see the Spot in the fields traveling at night, which can lead to a band of bandits ... either to discover a hidden path…or cave in a bush behind a bridge.., or climb onto a ledge that the Book basically does not offer you. Meanwhile, you have to understand, each of your actions can lead not just to a new path or location, but to a danger with the next series of events that you hastily decided to touch. You can’t say for sure where it brings you. Maybe you will end up in the beast den and become its dinner. Whether you have to climb over the ledge, and, if you are missing the appropriate items, you break a leg and remain as lame until the end of the game ... I am joking of course. Realism is good, but we are not interested to make you stumbling with the cane through the whole storyline.

So, your choices can lead you to Events, to New Territories, to Details of the story. Or you will get some type of experience in different forms ( Perks that can be used in other events). The basic idea - the book will give you some uncovered basic interaction mechanics, other part will depend on you and your character. So, the second part will lead you to facilitation of advancement on the story line path. If you want to go straight without exploring the details, at some point of the story you will start to understand: It was worthwhile to look into that draw-well, which you did not like and have to see what it would lead to. Perhaps your life will become even harder after that or… maybe you will get something valuable or learn something that will give you an access to new events and introduce new book characters.

Let admit small benefits about this part of the game. The game provides markers (hello, Witcher 3). If you have visited a key area in the book, the game will mark this place on your map, so that means you do not need to thumb half of the book to get to this place. The terrain is divided on three types of levels. Territories, Locations, and Sublocations. The Territory is a place on the global map (the Big area). Such territory has its own map (illustrated Page in the book) where Locations are marked (Locations that you discovered already). Every location has its own schematic map to give you an basic idea what you may discover here (Sublocations). Sublocations are the minimal main movement part where the player takes place.

In most cases, it will be an illustrated page with the terrain and your simple set of actions (moves) ... and additional details with hints such as sets of phrases (which can give you a completely new experience about this place). Or it can be explicit direct Actions (indicated by additional illustrations). They are leading to series of new events (a simple example, encounter with a traveler who is passing by on the road).

 

To get a better idea how it looks like, let's take another example: Territory: Eastern District near the City, Terrain: near the Weeping Forest, Sublocation: Road Fork.

Here our actions take place like our minimal unit of choice. Whether we want to go - to the village through the fields, or whether we should go straight down the tract towards the old farm, making our way to the city walls along the forest. Or we can notice a small detail: that the branches of the forest are strangely unnaturally moving… you are now getting involved in some new adventure and event proceeding to a remote forest, if you want to, of course.  Each such action has its own price of time.

Any movement takes some period. Walking a couple of hundred meters along the path to the next location will cost you a couple of minutes. For example, if you are making some active action, like talking with a traveler, you begin to understand that person is a hostile and will hit you next moment using knife, you should to make a choice…, or the choice will be made by the  book considering to situation. There will be actions in certain moments when you need to make a decision quickly. This is not a static story with the “Next” button, where you can go to take a cup of tea for 10 minutes and nothing will happen with your character like a random encounter on the road while you are just standing, or flock wolves passing through will not try to hunt on you.

There will be action scenes when your enemy will not wait until you make a choice.

Of course, in most of the moments you can safely hide in some abandoned building to have some rest or craft some sort of extract or just to study materials about a creature you have to fight with. All the actions are described in details; there will be no feeling like you "are teleported" from one location to another. If your path is laying from forest to village, the Book will give you a description how you should get there (besides the description of the location itself); if you are moving in the opposite direction, from village to the Forest, there will be absolutely new description of you path, because you see different objects on the way back. "I chose the action and it seems like something happened" - this is not about this Book. You will have enough description what is going on not to feel yourself "hollow" in the vastness of the story.

Since we are talking about time and it’s directly related to your actions, it worths mentioning some additional details. Real daytime will visually effect on the illumination of the Book for greater immersion in, is not just an aesthetic aspect. Time of day, weather (snow, rain, clear weather) – all of these can effect the world around us. As an example, you can see at night what you have not seen at daytime on the same path. Or you will not notice the path under your nose to the right, or walk along the familiar to you road under the cover of darkness, trying to get to the hut. The game will throw you in situation when you accidentally turn wrong way and find yourself in another place, where you would not ever get under any of other circumstances.

 

Let’s remember now that our character is an ordinary person and he has his needs like food, drink (don’t worry, eating and drinking will work automatically. Your character is not so stupid so you have to do everything for him, this stuff will work like in Mount & Blade. The main thing – character should have something to eat in his backpack). Fatigue is key parameter of you character (important in the skirmishes), cold and heat (it is a bad idea to wander in bad weather without a certain equipment). Eventually you may find out that you have pneumonia that will not pass by itself. All of these effect your character state, a possibility to fight in skirmishes and even in simple interactions (if you have a broken leg, this will not make your life easier in combat or in movement). That is a big cascade ecosystem of your character, which affect on your opportunities and will be available for you.

Oh yes, we forgot to add an important thing about exploring. Depending on your choice in the game and achieved project's goals, you will be able to explore the world with company. There will be characters in the game who will be able to join you, but you do not need to travel together. You can split your characters into parties and wander around the world. So, how it works.

If you have more than one party, you can play one party at once, at other parties you can do some stuff (moving to distant territories, craft some items, rest, etc. like in Jagged Alliance 2). Depending on your goals in the Project, you will have a possibility to give some extended job to your party (searching for simple resources, ingredients, hunting, etc.). So you will be able to switch between parties any time and proceed the story in another part of the game world. But you should remember that most of your actions take time and the time goes simultaneously for everyone for every party. You may encounter a situation when you have to choose where to go (intercept some character in different places) so that is an idea to separate party to check few places at once. Also there will be different situations where probably better to have all the characters or only one, as complex parameters can be used to achieve the goal (bigger one, lower one or medium). The game can give a challenge where you can suffer comprehensively; or there will be an action where some special Perk should be used and I will miss some opportunities because you will not have such a character in a current party. The choice is yours.

As a characters getting some perks during the game, one party will get them, the second one will not (although in certain moments that is for good). After all, some Perks can be useful and some can be harmful or just unwanted.

Let’s talk about the experience. There is no experience in the Book as it is usual for games. Each action can bring you something of its own. You can get hurt or disease, you can hint certain detail in the dialogue - you will get a Perk that will improve or reduce one of parameters of your character; also you can do something bad and the character will get a Perk that can play negative  role on some of events.

It’s worth to notice about one of the game key points - about the status of your characters. You will have a basic set of characteristics at the start and probably this will be the best state of your characters unlike the entire length of the game.

Of course these things can be different but the world is harsh and the ambient environment is not friendly to you.

The world will try to harm you during the story. Depending on the events, you will receive a lot of Effects that will obviously have a negatively effect on you. So it’s better to take care about it (although the choice is yours).

In addition, you will have the back side of the medal - learned skills and knowledge (as Perks, the direct parameter increase, knowledge of alchemy and craft, knowledge about strong and weak creatures’ sides, combat skills, enemy behavior). You will get all of these during the world exploration process. It will compensate negative aspects affected on you in the world. Both of these sides will be present simultaneously. Which side will grow faster depends on you.

 

Final key moment regarding to territory exploration is our favorite part in all of the games- items that you can be found. There will be no useless garbage in the Book - no forks, plates, caps furniture, etc. for sale (sorry, Skyrim). There will be useful items for some actions (ropes, shovels, hooks, winches, etc.), things needed for craft (like elixirs, salves, powders, other useful items and devices, armor and weapons, depending on stretch goals achieved in the Project), food, valuable stuff worth to be sold.

Item looting and searching also look like a set of actions, a kind of mini quests. That will depend on your skills needed for research or on your advertency (as a player).

For example, you have found an abandoned shack and you want to loot it. The book will give you the opportunity to loot all the stuff  with your naked eye (for example, the Old Shovel, standing in the corner of the shack). But you have to make a closer look with certain skills  to find something special…,or you should read the description of the shack carefully that will give a chance to find a closet or cellar which will lead to something hidden from prying eyes. Perhaps you will need the strength to move the cabinet and get into a hidden shelter with a useful object.

Thereby you will never be able to say for sure if you have learned everything at some place.  This will lead an opportunity to return here later after getting some information from a particular character or when you become more experienced in research.

Items price and about items themself.

Items will be expensive to buy (sorry, Witcher 3, no bags of gold). This part of the world is lack of supplies. There were better times, but not right now. Most of found items will be not in the best condition (some items will require additional actions before they can be used). To not get into spoilers, some of items will not have magical origin but they do not belong to the Middle Ages stuff. Meanwhile that does not mean that there's a place for high tech fiction items.

If you do not have an opportunity to buy something, you can always try to find it, but it will cost your time and, in addition, a danger related to search, there will be a risk of getting negative effects for the character (as I hinted before, not immediately reveals themselves).

Again, in order to not get into spoilers, I’ll give you a small hint - there will be no packs of Zombies like in Walking Dead TV series. There will be no deadly virus that struck humanity. I can say only one thing, that some events of the past has affected the emergence and spread all known large city medieval disease of (I think you know which one is).

This is not a key event and not a main issue of this world, but it has been already woven into the story and it has took place a bit earlier. So, let’s go back to item search. You will have a risk of getting some negative effects in some places (Disease or Mental effect in the form of depression after you have seen something).

This loot is cheap for your pocket, but perhaps you will have to pay for it by your health. You should deal with it anyway (as it was told before, the Book will not let you understand immediately that you got this effect; this is a kind of SaveLoad AntiCheat system. You will learn about what you get when the time passes. Many of the negative effects have "incubation time", so you'll be wondering where you got it). Of course, you can always kill someone. That is the favorite part. You think you have prepared for such actions? Now we are going directly to the combat system.

Perhaps some of the readers will find the Tactical and Combat Part a bit difficult. Let us say you are right. That is only at first sight. It becomes nice and clear when you will be dedicated to details.

All the moments are made to ensure that each player have a wide range of choice in combat.

So, let's speak about it more closely.

The game board is represented as a game table with sectors for cards. Each such sector, as like as a chessboard, is the place for the figure (the card in our case). Meaning figure we mean a character, creature or ordinary humanoid enemy. You are free to walk on any of these cells, approaching to or retiring from enemies.

In turn-based mode each unit has a certain number of action points and turns. These turns are movement on the board, Close Combat card use, inventory use, using an active item, or using Effect Cards (Mental Attacks, etc.). You can decide how you will spend your action points using the position of units on the board.

You may ask why the tactical part is important. Let's be more detailed:

 

Each unit has its own unique set of characteristics that affect its State and its danger (as in any game).

 

Each unit has body parts that have their own state, armor (different protection from slash, blunt and piercing damage, etc.). Armor has a state, either does the body part. All of these parameters affect their effectiveness.

Each unit (critters are exceptions, they have their own specifics) has its own set of weapons which affects the abilities of its combat like sets of Close Combat Cards. In addition, this has an effect on ability to conduct offensive and defensive combat depending on the type of unit weapons.

Each unit has a set of knowledge about these Close Combat Cards. This will have an effect on its defensive abilities too.

Depending on unit smartness, he can remember/forget the Close Combat cards used against him. This will give a chance to better repel of attack.

Depending on the character smartness, he will try to use the best card against you (no Random, the probabilities are calculated with the maximum damage against the enemy on the game board)

By the way, there are many ways to effect these mental abilities using Effect Cards, such as Intimidation, Confusion, Panic, or make a character frenzy and attacks everyone on a board. There will be many Effect Cards to learn by completing game events.

Some weapons can cause specific damage as well as Effect Cards.

To make a decision who you want to hit next, you can use any of the proposed choices. Just get a closer enemy to use max action points or you can be a bit smarter. You can use knowledge of Battle Almanac against a particular creature (the similarity of the Witcher Bestiary). You can use the View of the available details of your enemy (detailed information will be available depend on your skills, how good your knowledge is with certain enemy)  

 

Once you have determined your opponent, you are ready to choose Close Fight Card.

What is a Close Fight Card and how does it work.

A Close Fight Card is a set of punches for certain parts of the body. You should decide which parts of the body should be damaged first so that the enemy becomes weaker or more vulnerable, or stops the action which you do not need. Like W.A.T.S. system in Fallout but with sets of punches.

Each card has a basic version of the strike with certain hit belonged to one of the body parts (up to the 4th level of study).

Depending on the knowledge level of this card, you can use such card for one action. This action produce up to four hits to opponent (for certain body parts).

Depending on your skills (one-handed, two-handed, clubs, etc.), each hit will spend your total number of action points (restored to some level with each new move based on your fatigue and basic characteristics).

Looks difficult, isn’t it? Only At first glance!

Let's use an example to explain how this works.

You are attacked by an enemy with a sword. This is an experienced opponent and he knows some Close Fight Card used with sword. He have studied such card to a 3rd level. Accordingly to knowledge level, he is ready to perform 3 hits on body parts provided by this Fighting Card. But you do not know witch parts of the body enemy will try to hit. Now we are going to the most interesting part of the fight.

How do you protect yourself in this case? Forget about boring static card battles, about the QTE system like insane button push. It will be a short fight which lasts up to half a minute, but you’ll have to think fast.

Every hit scene divided to 3 stages.

First one, the opponent will throw you a card with the first hit flavored with a driving battle

music and attacking screams. The game has more than 600 combat sounds generated for each action set depending on the type of character and damage. You will not be bored to listen the same sounds every time.

If the Card is familiar to you (your character already learned this card), you will see a unique picture with an attack pose and a text symbolizing actions of this attack.

If you are well prepared for a battle, your associative logic (based on the visual perception of the picture and the unique text for each strike) will remember where the hit strikes. You can choose which part of the body should be protected by throwing your defend card.

You will see generated Unknown Special Card - you are unfamiliar with this hit and you will have to guess how to defend yourself. Of course, it will seem a bit difficult in the beginning.

The character needs to know this card, you should remember the picture and text related to a hit. But this is only at the first moments of the game. The more you play, the less hard it will be.

In addition, you have other possibilities to simplify the fight. For example, with having good advertency and reaction you will have more time to decide how you should defend yourself.  Or by using a Special Help Card that will guide you which side of attack you should wait . This will simplify your fight several times. Also, having a shield (depends on the size of the shield)  your choice can be simplified up to two or three choices like to block entire left side of the body or the entire right side.

You should keep in mind that the shields consume a lot of stamina and limited durability. Your action points are restored depending on stamina too. You will have to choose what is more important for you at the moment.

So, that was the second stage called SLO MO. During listening the sound of slow heartbeat you have to make a choice how to fend off an attack.  After the choice has been made, the game will change the rhythm of the music to series of attacks. Further, everything will depend on many parameters of the characters involved in close fight.

The third stage is a result of your choice. You will get Result Card based on your actions with general text which will describe what happened.

Not so difficult, right?

Such an action will be iterated as many times as knowledge level of Card attacker has (and…the action points spent to card, up to four).

After last hit lasts, you can calmly consider the details: the injuries received by each punch; perhaps even details like the enemy was more experienced in weapon skill, quicker or more agile. So you can make a conclusion which tactic to choose next time: change weapon style, etc.  Also you can read Almanac to find out how the opponent is capable of…. If you stay alive, of course. After that, you will return to the tactical board until you win (or lose) the fight.

In addition to the characteristics and skills of your character, player should have some skills too (symbiosis of the player's knowledge and his character). That is the main idea of the card game. You are using your character like an avatar with his own capabilities but your skills as a player is very important too. So the character is a killing machine and you are part of it. If you have played some fighting game, then you should know: each character has its own fight tactic: set of techniques to defend and attack. Every unit has weak and strong sides.

Of course you able to miss a couple of kicks if you have good armor or you are mighty kid with magnificent health. Such fight system provides many opportunities to play as a thief without armor or as a heavy tank. Everyone has its own bonuses like speed, critical hits and so on. So, flimsy thief can bring you notable damage (till you hit him a couple of times). All of these things work in the opposite situation too. Character characteristics, weapon weight, the Close Fight Cards, Effect Cards -  no sense to describe all the list of possibilities you will have. There will be a detailed manual for this part.

Few last extra details: you can use two-handed weapons as one-handed (if you have enough strength). Also there is no limit to have two-handed weapon in each of hand, but keep in mind – weapon weight affects endurance.

Knowledge and Learning.

Everything can be learned and every action has counteraction. If you have learned many Cards, you will have many rooms for fighting. If you have studied a certain group of creatures, then you know weak and strong enemy sides. You will gain an advantage on the battlefield. The Witcher game Bestiary could be more useful, because it has a great potential. We will fix this part of the game in our Book and will make it your best friend in surviving. If you are strong in crafting or brewing, you have wide space to protect yourself or improve your characteristics, or get rid of some effects. Some of knowledge you learn thanks to completing Events; some of knowledge you will learn during the battle, some of knowledge you can simply buy for money.

The book is initially aimed to the medical side. Such knowledge and visual art has a significant component as does an element of the game.  

If you are intrigued let's move to the goals and I will show you what you get

 

 

 

Goals

Most the game content, which has been already done, is related to the final goal. So we do not even think to cut something just because we won't be able to deliver it in the StoryLine

The project is huge and  nothing happens from the air(Alas!). So it takes time. Development period about 3 years(that is standart time for a huge game with huge content). 

In my opinion, better to wait a bit to get good game at the end unlike do not wait nothing at all,right?

story_txt:
I’m offering you a dark fantasy story with secrets and details that are not always visible at first sight. The story will be written no matter you are involved in events or not. But you will have an opportunity to participate in it and bring it into your sight. The basic idea: you are not a super hero, who is able to change whole world, but you will have an opportunity to change the outcome of events. You are a cogwheel which will behave well or badly. Also you will have a wide set of battles - an important part of the game. So, move on.
small hint:  if you don't want to read the details about every part of the game, just scroll down page and look the screens. It will help you to understand the game briefly
The game format is an old book with illustrations. The second part of the game is the game board where you have to make measured steps. The board where the tactical part takes place. A chessboard-like type, to be more precise. 
Third part is playing cards. Yes, old paper playing cards with illustrations. 
Summing all these things up, we can have some picture. Yes, it’s unclear (yet). We will fix it soon.
We have a book with a story, we are free to move where we want (and we will have many opportunities there), we take parts in events (or don’t, everything will have an affect on the story). If we are involved in turmoil (fights), we will have deep interaction on a game (tactics) board with actions and game cards.   Are you still intrigued? Do you want to understand what kind of the story are waiting for you and how it works? Let's talk about each thing in details. 
Some global events that are the foundation of the story have ALREADY happened. The world is huge, but these events had an effect on massive territories and all aspects of life by it’s own kind. Some aspects significantly changed, some ones felt changes less. The main essence - the world has changed, and the inhabitants have adapted to it, some ones had not. The population significantly decreased. There are no inhabitants who passed consequences without a trace.

We are experiencing the world, where the Middle Ages live style is still a base of surviving and total atmosphere, similar to NoMans Lands and Wilds (hello, The Witcher 3!). Meanwhile, past events played a great role (which are related to the story and the plot of the game), which gave a rise for rudiments of the first discoveries (and in some places and not the first) such as mechanics, possibility to use the electricity and the first devices based on it, steam machines, and other stuff.
To clarify a bit what is waiting for you and leave some space to your mind, I will propose an example.
Imagine  “Fallout” world with all it’s technologies, made in past, or Morrowind world with the Dwemers, who have sunk in ages (past events in the game had been not so far ago). But all this story stuff moved to the Middle Ages. One of you might remember Arcanum with magic and technologies, but it will be far from the truth. By the story, there is no opposition between technology and magic. Technology is more like something, that has made an incredible leap and great discoveries. It has become impossible to move this line in the modern world where player take place. The knowledge is lost and there no help to wait from inside with new one. A kind of Post apocalypse in the Middle Ages. As all popular stories like, humanity had not been mutilated beyond recognition. But big changes have come (including weather). You have to find out what happened and choose your own way through this difficult world environment.
Many of you can say: Why do you just not tell the basic story? I have an answer – you have to find what is going on in this world and the main plot. Every detail will give you a spoiler of the key of the story moments.
 
This story is about the world and events, but not about specific heroes. Nevertheless, the game will have many unique picturesque characters with its dark stories. All of these individuals who found a place in this world has its own interests, and you have to act with them ... or not.
I can’t say for sure at this moment, but we have a plan to implement Afterword for each character you met (as in Fallout with settlements). The decision to make it will depend on the achieved goals of the Project.


All of us want to walk in an interesting world to look at spellbinding corners of the lands (whether it's the Huge Old Town with large half empty quarters and haunted interiors or it is ruins of an abandoned tower with its secrets, or the smoggy swamps, the Deep Forests where the light can barely break through).That was small spoiler for you. It’s your choice where you want to go.Every of this part will depend on several factors. First, your desire to explore the Lands (this possibility will be provided). Second, your advertency (as a player) will give you a chance to reveal hidden terrains (or set of character parameters will help you).
There will be many hidden actions in the game. If your character can't find them yet (not enough skills), you can do it by yourself using text input (as in Fallout 1 or Leisure Suit Larry).This is not a mandatory part of the gameplay. Therefore, by carefully reading the story, you will be rewarded with advanced features. These actions can lead you to hidden events, locations, valuable things, etc.
As a result, for example, there will be moments when you can see the Spot in the fields traveling at night, which can lead to a band of bandits ... either to discover a hidden path…or cave in a bush behind a bridge.., or climb onto a ledge that the Book basically does not offer you. Meanwhile, you have to understand, each of your actions can lead not just to a new path or location, but to a danger with the next series of events that you hastily decided to touch. You can’t say for sure where it brings you. Maybe you will end up in the beast den and become its dinner. Whether you have to climb over the ledge, and, if you are missing the appropriate items, you break a leg and remain as lame until the end of the game ... I am joking of course. Realism is good, but we are not interested to make you stumbling with the cane through the whole storyline.
So, your choices can lead you to Events, to New Territories, to Details of the story. Or you will get some type of experience in different forms ( Perks that can be used in other events). The basic idea - the book will give you some uncovered basic interaction mechanics, other part will depend on you and your character. So, the second part will lead you to facilitation of advancement on the story line path. If you want to go straight without exploring the details, at some point of the story you will start to understand: It was worthwhile to look into that draw-well, which you did not like and have to see what it would lead to. Perhaps your life will become even harder after that or… maybe you will get something valuable or learn something that will give you an access to new events and introduce new book characters.
Let admit small benefits about this part of the game. The game provides markers (hello, Witcher 3). If you have visited a key area in the book, the game will mark this place on your map, so that means you do not need to thumb half of the book to get to this place. The terrain is divided on three types of levels. Territories, Locations, and Sublocations. The Territory is a place on the global map (the Big area). Such territory has its own map (illustrated Page in the book) where Locations are marked (Locations that you discovered already). Every location has its own schematic map to give you an basic idea what you may discover here (Sublocations). Sublocations are the minimal main movement part where the player takes place.

In most cases, it will be an illustrated page with the terrain and your simple set of actions (moves) ... and additional details with hints such as sets of phrases (which can give you a completely new experience about this place). Or it can be explicit direct Actions (indicated by additional illustrations). They are leading to series of new events (a simple example, encounter with a traveler who is passing by on the road).
 
To get a better idea how it looks like, let's take another example: Territory: Eastern District near the City, Terrain: near the Weeping Forest, Sublocation: Road Fork.
Here our actions take place like our minimal unit of choice. Whether we want to go - to the village through the fields, or whether we should go straight down the tract towards the old farm, making our way to the city walls along the forest. Or we can notice a small detail: that the branches of the forest are strangely unnaturally moving… you are now getting involved in some new adventure and event proceeding to a remote forest, if you want to, of course.  Each such action has its own price of time.
Any movement takes some period. Walking a couple of hundred meters along the path to the next location will cost you a couple of minutes. For example, if you are making some active action, like talking with a traveler, you begin to understand that person is a hostile and will hit you next moment using knife, you should to make a choice…, or the choice will be made by the  book considering to situation. There will be actions in certain moments when you need to make a decision quickly. This is not a static story with the “Next” button, where you can go to take a cup of tea for 10 minutes and nothing will happen with your character like a random encounter on the road while you are just standing, or flock wolves passing through will not try to hunt on you.
There will be action scenes when your enemy will not wait until you make a choice.
Of course, in most of the moments you can safely hide in some abandoned building to have some rest or craft some sort of extract or just to study materials about a creature you have to fight with. All the actions are described in details; there will be no feeling like you "are teleported" from one location to another. If your path is laying from forest to village, the Book will give you a description how you should get there (besides the description of the location itself); if you are moving in the opposite direction, from village to the Forest, there will be absolutely new description of you path, because you see different objects on the way back. "I chose the action and it seems like something happened" - this is not about this Book. You will have enough description what is going on not to feel yourself "hollow" in the vastness of the story.


Since we are talking about time and it’s directly related to your actions, it worths mentioning some additional details. Real daytime will visually effect on the illumination of the Book for greater immersion in, is not just an aesthetic aspect. Time of day, weather (snow, rain, clear weather) – all of these can effect the world around us. As an example, you can see at night what you have not seen at daytime on the same path. Or you will not notice the path under your nose to the right, or walk along the familiar to you road under the cover of darkness, trying to get to the hut. The game will throw you in situation when you accidentally turn wrong way and find yourself in another place, where you would not ever get under any of other circumstances.
 
Let’s remember now that our character is an ordinary person and he has his needs like food, drink (don’t worry, eating and drinking will work automatically. Your character is not so stupid so you have to do everything for him, this stuff will work like in Mount & Blade. The main thing – character should have something to eat in his backpack). Fatigue is key parameter of you character (important in the skirmishes), cold and heat (it is a bad idea to wander in bad weather without a certain equipment). Eventually you may find out that you have pneumonia that will not pass by itself. All of these effect your character state, a possibility to fight in skirmishes and even in simple interactions (if you have a broken leg, this will not make your life easier in combat or in movement). That is a big cascade ecosystem of your character, which affect on your opportunities and will be available for you.
Oh yes, we forgot to add an important thing about exploring. Depending on your choice in the game and achieved project's goals, you will be able to explore the world with company. There will be characters in the game who will be able to join you, but you do not need to travel together. You can split your characters into parties and wander around the world. So, how it works.
If you have more than one party, you can play one party at once, at other parties you can do some stuff (moving to distant territories, craft some items, rest, etc. like in Jagged Alliance 2). Depending on your goals in the Project, you will have a possibility to give some extended job to your party (searching for simple resources, ingredients, hunting, etc.). So you will be able to switch between parties any time and proceed the story in another part of the game world. But you should remember that most of your actions take time and the time goes simultaneously for everyone for every party. You may encounter a situation when you have to choose where to go (intercept some character in different places) so that is an idea to separate party to check few places at once. Also there will be different situations where probably better to have all the characters or only one, as complex parameters can be used to achieve the goal (bigger one, lower one or medium). The game can give a challenge where you can suffer comprehensively; or there will be an action where some special Perk should be used and I will miss some opportunities because you will not have such a character in a current party. The choice is yours.
As a characters getting some perks during the game, one party will get them, the second one will not (although in certain moments that is for good). After all, some Perks can be useful and some can be harmful or just unwanted.


Let’s talk about the experience. There is no experience in the Book as it is usual for games. Each action can bring you something of its own. You can get hurt or disease, you can hint certain detail in the dialogue - you will get a Perk that will improve or reduce one of parameters of your character; also you can do something bad and the character will get a Perk that can play negative  role on some of events.
It’s worth to notice about one of the game key points - about the status of your characters. You will have a basic set of characteristics at the start and probably this will be the best state of your characters unlike the entire length of the game.
Of course these things can be different but the world is harsh and the ambient environment is not friendly to you.
The world will try to harm you during the story. Depending on the events, you will receive a lot of Effects that will obviously have a negatively effect on you. So it’s better to take care about it (although the choice is yours).
In addition, you will have the back side of the medal - learned skills and knowledge (as Perks, the direct parameter increase, knowledge of alchemy and craft, knowledge about strong and weak creatures’ sides, combat skills, enemy behavior). You will get all of these during the world exploration process. It will compensate negative aspects affected on you in the world. Both of these sides will be present simultaneously. Which side will grow faster depends on you.
 

Final key moment regarding to territory exploration is our favorite part in all of the games- items that you can be found. There will be no useless garbage in the Book - no forks, plates, caps furniture, etc. for sale (sorry, Skyrim). There will be useful items for some actions (ropes, shovels, hooks, winches, etc.), things needed for craft (like elixirs, salves, powders, other useful items and devices, armor and weapons, depending on stretch goals achieved in the Project), food, valuable stuff worth to be sold.
Item looting and searching also look like a set of actions, a kind of mini quests. That will depend on your skills needed for research or on your advertency (as a player).
For example, you have found an abandoned shack and you want to loot it. The book will give you the opportunity to loot all the stuff  with your naked eye (for example, the Old Shovel, standing in the corner of the shack). But you have to make a closer look with certain skills  to find something special…,or you should read the description of the shack carefully that will give a chance to find a closet or cellar which will lead to something hidden from prying eyes. Perhaps you will need the strength to move the cabinet and get into a hidden shelter with a useful object.
Thereby you will never be able to say for sure if you have learned everything at some place.  This will lead an opportunity to return here later after getting some information from a particular character or when you become more experienced in research.
Items price and about items themself.

Items will be expensive to buy (sorry, Witcher 3, no bags of gold). This part of the world is lack of supplies. There were better times, but not right now. Most of found items will be not in the best condition (some items will require additional actions before they can be used). To not get into spoilers, some of items will not have magical origin but they do not belong to the Middle Ages stuff. Meanwhile that does not mean that there's a place for high tech fiction items.
If you do not have an opportunity to buy something, you can always try to find it, but it will cost your time and, in addition, a danger related to search, there will be a risk of getting negative effects for the character (as I hinted before, not immediately reveals themselves).
Again, in order to not get into spoilers, I’ll give you a small hint - there will be no packs of Zombies like in Walking Dead TV series. There will be no deadly virus that struck humanity. I can say only one thing, that some events of the past has affected the emergence and spread all known large city medieval disease of (I think you know which one is).
This is not a key event and not a main issue of this world, but it has been already woven into the story and it has took place a bit earlier. So, let’s go back to item search. You will have a risk of getting some negative effects in some places (Disease or Mental effect in the form of depression after you have seen something).
This loot is cheap for your pocket, but perhaps you will have to pay for it by your health. You should deal with it anyway (as it was told before, the Book will not let you understand immediately that you got this effect; this is a kind of SaveLoad AntiCheat system. You will learn about what you get when the time passes. Many of the negative effects have "incubation time", so you'll be wondering where you got it). Of course, you can always kill someone. That is the favorite part. You think you have prepared for such actions? Now we are going directly to the combat system.


Perhaps some of the readers will find the Tactical and Combat Part a bit difficult. Let us say you are right. That is only at first sight. It becomes nice and clear when you will be dedicated to details.
All the moments are made to ensure that each player have a wide range of choice in combat.
So, let's speak about it more closely.
The game board is represented as a game table with sectors for cards. Each such sector, as like as a chessboard, is the place for the figure (the card in our case). Meaning figure we mean a character, creature or ordinary humanoid enemy. You are free to walk on any of these cells, approaching to or retiring from enemies.
In turn-based mode each unit has a certain number of action points and turns. These turns are movement on the board, Close Combat card use, inventory use, using an active item, or using Effect Cards (Mental Attacks, etc.). You can decide how you will spend your action points using the position of units on the board.
You may ask why the tactical part is important. Let's be more detailed: Each unit has its own unique set of characteristics that affect its State and its danger (as in any game). Each unit has body parts that have their own state, armor (different protection from slash, blunt and piercing damage, etc.). Armor has a state, either does the body part. All of these parameters affect their effectiveness.
Each unit (critters are exceptions, they have their own specifics) has its own set of weapons which affects the abilities of its combat like sets of Close Combat Cards. In addition, this has an effect on ability to conduct offensive and defensive combat depending on the type of unit weapons.
Each unit has a set of knowledge about these Close Combat Cards. This will have an effect on its defensive abilities too.
Depending on unit smartness, he can remember/forget the Close Combat cards used against him. This will give a chance to better repel of attack.
Depending on the character smartness, he will try to use the best card against you (no Random, the probabilities are calculated with the maximum damage against the enemy on the game board)
By the way, there are many ways to effect these mental abilities using Effect Cards, such as Intimidation, Confusion, Panic, or make a character frenzy and attacks everyone on a board. There will be many Effect Cards to learn by completing game events.
Some weapons can cause specific damage as well as Effect Cards.
To make a decision who you want to hit next, you can use any of the proposed choices. Just get a closer enemy to use max action points or you can be a bit smarter. You can use knowledge of Battle Almanac against a particular creature (the similarity of the Witcher Bestiary). You can use the View of the available details of your enemy (detailed information will be available depend on your skills, how good your knowledge is with certain enemy)   Once you have determined your opponent, you are ready to choose Close Fight Card.

What is a Close Fight Card and how does it work.
A Close Fight Card is a set of punches for certain parts of the body. You should decide which parts of the body should be damaged first so that the enemy becomes weaker or more vulnerable, or stops the action which you do not need. Like W.A.T.S. system in Fallout but with sets of punches.

Each card has a basic version of the strike with certain hit belonged to one of the body parts (up to the 4th level of study).
Depending on the knowledge level of this card, you can use such card for one action. This action produce up to four hits to opponent (for certain body parts).
Depending on your skills (one-handed, two-handed, clubs, etc.), each hit will spend your total number of action points (restored to some level with each new move based on your fatigue and basic characteristics).
Looks difficult, isn’t it? Only At first glance!
Let's use an example to explain how this works.
You are attacked by an enemy with a sword. This is an experienced opponent and he knows some Close Fight Card used with sword. He have studied such card to a 3rd level. Accordingly to knowledge level, he is ready to perform 3 hits on body parts provided by this Fighting Card. But you do not know witch parts of the body enemy will try to hit. Now we are going to the most interesting part of the fight.
How do you protect yourself in this case? Forget about boring static card battles, about the QTE system like insane button push. It will be a short fight which lasts up to half a minute, but you’ll have to think fast.
Every hit scene divided to 3 stages.
First one, the opponent will throw you a card with the first hit flavored with a driving battle
music and attacking screams. The game has more than 600 combat sounds generated for each action set depending on the type of character and damage. You will not be bored to listen the same sounds every time.
If the Card is familiar to you (your character already learned this card), you will see a unique picture with an attack pose and a text symbolizing actions of this attack.
If you are well prepared for a battle, your associative logic (based on the visual perception of the picture and the unique text for each strike) will remember where the hit strikes. You can choose which part of the body should be protected by throwing your defend card.
You will see generated Unknown Special Card - you are unfamiliar with this hit and you will have to guess how to defend yourself. Of course, it will seem a bit difficult in the beginning.
The character needs to know this card, you should remember the picture and text related to a hit. But this is only at the first moments of the game. The more you play, the less hard it will be.
In addition, you have other possibilities to simplify the fight. For example, with having good advertency and reaction you will have more time to decide how you should defend yourself.  Or by using a Special Help Card that will guide you which side of attack you should wait . This will simplify your fight several times.
