story:
Stretch Goals

3,000$ - Full Campaign

5,000$ - Slavic Glory Kills

10,000$ - Custom Soundtrack

20,000 - ???

The Story

It has been 15 years since the Gods came back on Earth in search for the holy vodka. 15 years of terror for the humans. Humans work for the Gods, they do everything for them, simply they became slaves. If the Gods find the holy vodka then all humanity will go extinct because there simply won't be need for humans to search for the vodka. The legend says that the Russian hackers have the holy vodka, they are the ones who hid it from the world, they are the ones that want to protect us... but there's a catch, only the chosen one can use the vodka, that heals sicknesses, to cleanse the Gods from the face of Earth, anyone else who tries to touch the vodka simply... dies. After 15 years of terror you decide to search for the holy vodka, to see if you are the chosen one to save humanity. To achieve that you must find the Russian hackers, but to find them you have to pass cities, mountains and seas full of Slavic warriors and Gods. Whether you are the chosen one it's unknown, but what is known is that if you are the one after taking the vodka you'll have to fight the omnipotent Slavic God of the Universe... the mighty Rod, the creator of everything.

Who are we?

We are a team of two Slavs obsessed with Slavs. We are programming and design enthusiasts. If YOU donate on this project you will help us achieve our goal - THE MAKING OF A SLAVIC THEMED VIDEO GAME WITH ALL OF THE SLAVIC GLORY!

This project was the winner of an International Codefest Marathon/Hackathon

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will need 3000$ in order to buy some peripherals to finish the game and hire an animator to help us with the animation. By making 10,000$ we are making a custom soundtrack of the game
  • This will be a game injected with Slavic realities and Slavic mythology
  • By donating to our project you will get a game copy. You can also get Slavic merchandise by buying our Slavic Boxes.

The Impact

You want to have a good laugh on Slavic themed jokes? Well, you are on the right place! The merchandise packages we offer you will get the FULL SLAVIC EXPERIENCE right to your home with real life products!!

This game was a winner of a coding marathon as we stated above, therefore we want to make a full campaign. The script is already written.

Risks & Challenges

Of course like every other project on this planet and outside of it there are challenges accomplishing it. We can overcome these challenges by reaching our funding goal. We plan to hire an animator that will help us with this project of ours. Also we have contacts to a number of Slavic studies professors that are glad to help us with this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate to us, but you still want to help that is perfectly fine! You can help in a number of ways. This includes sharing our project on social media, sending us ideas on what you think it is cool to be included in the game or just by speaking about our project to people that might be interested in Slavic Beasts and just like you, they want to help!

Thank You

story:
You went downtown and tagged along with a crowd of protesters. You're not sure what they're protesting about, but you thought to yourself this might be fun, and it is always interesting to see a wall of police officers in anti-riot armor...  After a while of hanging in the back, you hear thump sounds and​ notice a few troublemakers at the front line have started throwing random objects at the police. Another group starts demolishing a nearby car. Just when you thought this might be a good time to leave, you hear shots get fired, and the crowd starts running away from the police, almost trampling you over. You look towards where a group of your friends is standing, when all of the sudden a stream of icy water from water cannon washes them away from your sight. You start looking for an escape route, but then a cloud of tear-gas smoke engulfs you and you begin to cough and stumble around half-blind...  You manage to leave the cloud, but then run straight into a police officer, who knocks you down with a baton and starts beating you on the ground. Next to you is another civilian, lying down unconscious with his hands cuffed behind his backs, his face covered in blood, is that the faith which awaits you as well? Suddenly, a molotov cocktail thrown out of nowhere hits the police officer's visor, setting him on fire, and he runs backwards, screaming while his colleges go after him with a fire extinguisher. You stand up and pick up a crowbar you found on the ground. Something begins to boil inside you, you are a citizen dammit, you know your rights and today you will fight for them. You think to yourself, this is either a dream, or the A.C.A.B. mod was finally released and you're playing it!

Summary

Mount&Blade engine is the best choice out there for any sort of conflict which involves melee, shields, thrown missiles and horseback fighting.  And modern day riots fit the description perfectly, yet the setting has not been explored enough, until now.

The more I played around with ideas and built prototypes, the more it became apparent that this mod setting has a huge potential in all of these areas: single player missions, multiplayer coop missions, multiplayer casual and role-play servers, regimental events.

 

How will it start?

My current focus is towards two aspects: regimental events and role-play servers. Reasons are, it is easier to get decent number of players on an event server rather than casual one, and role-play/jailbreak servers are most popular and a natural choice considering the setting. In design concepts section at bottom of this page there are more explanations on how both of these types of servers would work. To answer the question directly, the first step will be to release public Alpha version and organize a test event, as is usual.

A single player mission type game is also an option but it will come later, as I want it to be done well. It shouldn't be a simple invasion type thing where you bash endless waves of bots. But primary development focus for now is building a mod for regimental event play where up to 200 players can join the riot event as either a group of rioters or a police force squad.

Events themselves would have a little bit of role-play elements, as obviously the victory condition in this setting cannot be to kill everyone in the enemy team, nor should police be able to immediately attack any "enemy" on the spot. If you're left wondering how can this work or will it even be fun, please do read the design concepts at bottom of this page, which will explain more.

 

Why the Riot Mod Needs Your Help?

The mod, in it's current state, is already starting to achieve brilliance in gameplay, inventiveness, sound and atmosphere. But almost all the 3D models used for clothes and scene props are just place-holders, downloaded for free or made by me, to be replaced with quality models as I acquire them.

The problem is I am a coder, my modelling skills are limited, and all the good modelers I know will not produce quality models for free, especially for items as complex as clothing. And for a mob of civilians to look convincing, there needs to be a lot of different random clothing combinations. One section most lacking at the moment is head wear, as you can see on promo video, most civilians are still wearing centuries old Napoleonic Wars hats. Also, there are certain scene props which are  very much needed for the mod to be complete, but I wouldn't be able to make them myself, which is why acquiring models is a critical aspect, and to get quality results money needs to be payed to modelers, which is why I'm asking for your help.

I (and others who saw/tested it) firmly believe this is going to be an awesome mod, and it will be released whether this funding succeeds or fails. The difference is, it will work and look ten times more awesome if funding succeeds, and you will be able to pride yourself on the fact that you gave a contribution which made it all possible.

Also, it is not just about 3D models, if funding succeeds and the modeling part of the job is off my back, I will be able to spend more time coding features and making it a better game, so your contribution will help all the game aspects improve, not just visual.

Risks & Challenges

I'm not going to pretend everything is skimmed milk and honey, of course there may be some risks and challenges on the road. Since I personally know the mod will be fun to play, the only risk is whether a sufficient mass of players will come to realize this, and the challenge is in helping them make their mind, but if you believe in this mod then you can help with that as well, with some good word of your mouth, or at least by spreading links to this or other related pages. Of course, there is a competition with other multiplayer event based mods, but that is another reason why I am asking for donations - better quality models, combined with fun gameplay, will give this mod an edge.

Another risk is whether some wild feature will make server with lots of players crash or lag outstandingly. I will use all my experience as a developer and knowledge of M&B module system, combined with testing before publishing any release to prevent this from happening.

One more risk I can think of comes with the fact that this is a NW mod which means only owners of Napoleonic Wars can play it. However I don't see a problem with that, as a portion of people who quit NW out of boredom might come back to it just to play the riot mod.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I only need money to achieve the goal of having quality visuals, of course you can help in other ways. If you really like the mod idea that's a good start, you can help by talking about it and sharing links with your friends and enemies. If you are skilled modeler/texture artist/animator/sound engineer or are on your way to become one, you can help by doing some volunteer work. In return, apart from the pleasure of taking part in creation of this mod, you will get some work experience and things to add to your portfolio.

Q&A:

Q: Why are you asking for such a small amount?

My intention is not to become a hot-shot studio owner running on thousands of dollars of crowdfunded money, I just want to publish this awesome mod and make it look prettier and work better (and be published sooner) than it would without any funding. In my estimate, $500 is enough to achieve that. If we manage to gather more money, more improvements and a bigger content pool could be made, also game servers are not free, and the more money put into them the better. If we don't even reach the $500 goal, all backers will get their money back (campaign is set to fixed goal), and I will continue to work on the mod alone. This mod will be published eventually whether the funding works or not, though it will look worse and will take much more time until public release. In case of a low support (less than 50% of goal reached) I'll change focus from multiplayer to single player missions.

Q: Why are you making a new M&B mod now when Bannerlord is about to be released?

No one really knows when the Bannerlord will come out, but when it does, it certainly won't have anything like the riot mod. Also, this can be a sort of mod which extends the game's life, as some players who quit or would quit NW out of boredom might come back to it just to play the riot mod. Another point to make is, all the assets we acquire thanks to your donations can be used in remaking the mod for Bannerlord, when and if the time comes. But I will not be making any Bannerlord mods at it's very first release, as there will probably be a lot of game updates/patches before modding it becomes worthwhile. 

Q: Can you port A.C.A.B. to be Native mod instead of Napoleonic Wars mod?

In short, no. Using NW as basis has saved me a lot of development time. Though it might get ported into Bannerlord eventually. If and when that happens, all the backers will keep their perks in a new version, which makes sense as the port would be using a lot of assets which were payed with backers' money.

Q: Will anyone be able to host their own A.C.A.B. server?

Yes, server files will be released as well, though only official servers will have benefits of persistent database storage. Server owners will have tools in form of special scene props and extended admin menu which will allow them to create a unique type of server without actual modding.

Q: What about the system requirements for playing A.C.A.B. mod?

The mod will have more complex textures and models with higher polygon count than your usual Mount&Blade mod, so the requirements will probably be somewhere at North&South or Blood&Iron level but not above that. Fixing frame rate problems which may arise will be my constant focus.

Q: I noticed there are some perks which make unique skins/items available, how does that work?

 "Unique" means only you can spawn with those items. A portion of money you payed for the perk will go towards creation of that item, the rest goes towards mod budget. Developers keep the right to refuse an item creation if it is inappropriate, so it is best to contact me and check if your desired item kind is allowed before paying for the perk. 

 

Some Plans & Design Concepts

 

Here comes a lot of text, mainly bits and pieces from the design document, read it if you're very interested in how the game will work.

If you want to know, baton dynamics currently work like this:
-if you hit a guy with a baton, with higher damage you have much higher chance to knock him on the ground (typical knocked by blunt damage 3 seconds animation), unless the guy is holding unarmed block (unarmed block animation changed so the guy is bent down slightly and using arms to protect his whole head). Of course you do higher damage the usual M&B way - by holding the attack longer, aiming for the head, moving body with the swing, or just taking a bigger baton which does more damage.
-Once in knocked down animation, if you hit a guy again while on the ground, one of three things will happen depending on damage amount:
--Nothing, too low damage
--Medium damage, the guy falls on his back for several seconds, and while in this position, as he is instinctively using his arms and legs to protect himself, all damage dealt to him is reduced times /4, as you are mostly hitting his arms and legs and not the head or torso. This allows fun times where several policemen are beating one person on the ground without much fear of killing him.
--High damage, contused, with face down and won't wake up soon. Of course, hitting a guy further while in this state would mean you risk to kill him.

Pistols and how they work:

Depending on context it can scare them off, halt them, cuff them, all done by pressing X while holding a gun.
Pistols should have next to no part in multiplayer riot event, but are useful for making solo play as a cop vs bots a richer experience.
Sequence needs more polishing, for example they should drop wielded weapon properly before hands behind back animation. Also a cop should be locked in cuffing animation until a suspect is cuffed.

Molotovs and how they work:

Possibility to get ignited if close enough to source of open flame. Burn levels are accumulated per individual, lower burn level means person is just a little bit on fire and burn level will be decreasing in time which means fire will be put out by itself. Higher burn levels keep rising in time as person is more and more engulfed in flames, in which case only a fire extinguisher can reduce a burn level.
Note that regular sized molotovs cocktails are not meant to be OP area of damage weapon or anything like that, they are used for disturbing the lines, as dropping it bellow cop's feet will make them do the hop animation, and only in rare cases will they actually set people on fire, those will mostly be freak accidents.


Some of amusing features planned:
-Water cannon -usually only one per cop team, like NW cannon, but a continuous stream used to push people away or at least stun them.
-Radio - walkie-talkie however you want to call it, is what leaders of squads (officers) get. Can be used to:
1) identify individuals from enemy team, by aiming at someone and pressing a button you get to see his player name.
2) order arrest, which means put a beacon over someone who should be taken out, as name of the target has to be picked from the list of names, it would be good to use 1) identify people first.
3) report position, this would make beacon (visible by anyone in his team who has radio) flash over the radio user for few seconds so other unit commanders know his squad position.
4) communication with other squads, radio could have shortcuts for useful communication between squad leaders on events, anyone who has radio in inventory would pick up these messages, shortcuts to say stuff like "we're on position", "we're moving in", "requesting reinforcement" etc....
-Molotov cocktails, colored torches and other pyromaniac toys, I'd take special care to have decent fire dynamics. Molotovs are more a psychological tool to cause a hole in a line of cops, it wouldn't be easy to actually set a guy on fire but if it does happen, cop team should have someone who chose to carry fire extinguisher, hopefully they will remember to bring one of those.
-Scene props which would allow server owner to use map editing to do some custom stuff which were previously possible only by modding (writing code), its hard to explain really, but the point would be to allow more control over server rules, and allow creation of custom role-play environments thought up by server owner without doing the actual modding, by just editing a map and adding invisible scene props which decide on server rules. I think prison break type server has most potential here, which is why there will be prison guard and inmate classes, and some suitable scene props.
-Cuffing people, with police cuffs, obviously. If cuffing a target ordered by radio you get one point, and same like when capturing flag in siege nearby cops get a point.
-Undercover detectives, cop class dressed up in random civilian clothes, hard to distinguish from rioters, if player has some sneaking skills he can get himself into the crowd. The fact that he doesn't have a banner wouldn't give him away as friendly banners would be turned off by default (as sides are civilians and cops, easy to distinguish without banners), what can give him away is when a rioter looks at him from upclose and the name label doesn't show up ("who the hell is this guy?") but in a crowd that is hard to spot. Undercover is so far the only class which has choice to carry pistol with deadly ammo (currently glock17), other choices are tiny baton or pepper spray, and a mandatory badge (left hand shield item, so you can extend it towards the crowd as you hold the pistol in weapon hand, ofc the badge has only 1hp and will be beaten out of your hand if someone strikes at you).
-Classes which are there for fun and roleplay, on cop team rp would be chief of police, CEO/businessman type, politician, news crew loyal to the regime, all are there only to have their asses kicked really. On rioter side RP classes would be demonstrators with transparents (though they can become formidable force), angry factory workers, homeless folk, adolescents who are there just to skip classes, independent TV crew, again, all there just to have their asses kicked. Actual fighting classes on riot side would be decided based on their weapon type or groups they belong to.
-Destructable scene props, apart from spawning with some fun improvised weapons, rioters would have ways to get some more op weapons by destroying the environment, so some scene props like trash bin can be picked up and used as slow but OP missile/melee, if the crowd destroys a street sign it could be used as pole weapon, bench would give planks, some heavier weapons like street light poles would require a crowd to hit at a street light for some time until it breaks off, and police can prevent them from doing that. Weapon the size of a street light pole would be very slow but effective against line formations as it would break through shields.

-Several real-world locations and classes, though this largely depends on success of crowdfunding campaign.

-Uh, bunch of other stuff.

How would an event work?
That is yet to be decided in practice but, the way I see it, typical default event would go like this - anti-riot team forms lines at desired position, preferably somewhere narrow, and watches what the rioters will do. Rioters can either walk up straight to police lines, or go destroy some props to get more dangerous weapons (in which case a squad may do an intervention against vandals), or just mess about. Obviously it would be for the best if least disciplined regiments get to be rioters.

In different scenarios rioters would fortify in a building or lay siege to police station. That search and destroy game type from native could be used for this mod, so rioters would have to destroy several objects on the scene and cops would have to prevent them, that would give some actual objectives, but a simple battle can work as well. In case of not enough interest for big events, a players vs bots mode could work, but I would rather not go with bots as in typical riot both teams should be inventive with their approach. For example one possible weapon for rioters is a folding ladder, which if uneqipped becomes a ladder scene prop, which can be used to get to high places or just stick out of the crowd, you won't see a bot doing that.

The police team is not allowed to use violence until they are given good reason, like if an individual tries to push through their line. So at the beginning rioters may decide to just throw taunts and insults and small harmless projectiles and pose next to cops, increasing the tension, but they shouldn't be attacked for that. Cops should use this time to look tough, hold the line and identify main suspects. Chief of police is using megaphone item to call the crowd to disperse, just for fun. In case larger objects are thrown at them, the police can start returning with tear gas. Squad leaders can start ordering arrests of spotted troublemakers. But to actually make that arrest, one whole squad will probably have to push forward, isolate the guy when they reach him and beat into submission+handcuff then drag him back behind lines. Once deadly weapons are used against the police or someone from police team gets knocked out, all violence is allowed.

Though even with full violence mode on, it would be tactically wrong for all cops to just start charging everyone as police team is supposed to have less players than riot team (10:7), so they would probably want to hold the lines and wear the crowd out with any means available (for example a few tear gas canisters well landed could completely prevent attack from one area), sending a squad to charge out only where a weakness is noticed, or one particularly dangerous rioter needs to be taken down, for example that guy supplying rioters with molotovs. If riot cavalry is available they would stand behind lines and at some point push beyond their line and make a turn like a horse figure in chess does, to isolate one group nearest to frontline enabling their capture or just breaking them, though foot units could do that move as well. Horses are very OP and almost as big as irl, though not as fast and manoeuvrable as in NW, and their rider is still fragile but safe from most short weapons. So horse is not a 1vs10 unit like in NW but a tactical addition, though in general you will want to stay away from a horse, which will be easy as they are slow and few.

For a round of battle to be won not everyone from the enemy team has to die, if everyone who are alive are either contused, surrendering or cuffed the round will end.
 

Future plans: persistent servers.

In case the mod gets a good amount of players, I will try to realize this idea of two interdependent server: Persistent Riot and Persistent Prison. In those servers there are no rounds, just two persistent worlds. You would get to play one same persistent character in both servers, though if you're playing as civilian character, you can join Persistent Prison only if you got arrested in Persistent Riot, and other way around, you can join Persistent Riot only if you get released or escape from Persistent Prison. The benefit of being an inmate in Persistent Prison is you can boost your stats by training while you're inside, and on the outside you can make money in criminal ways. It should be other way around for cops, they earn money while on prison guard duty, and on the outside they get +exp and stat boosts as they stalk the streets for crime-committing civilians. But of course there should be tons of other stuff you can do on those servers. And that is all I can say so far without spilling too many beans.
story_txt: You went downtown and tagged along with a crowd of protesters. You're not sure what they're protesting about, but you thought to yourself this might be fun, and it is always interesting to see a wall of police officers in anti-riot armor...  After a while of hanging in the back, you hear thump sounds and​ notice a few troublemakers at the front line have started throwing random objects at the police. Another group starts demolishing a nearby car. Just when you thought this might be a good time to leave, you hear shots get fired, and the crowd starts running away from the police, almost trampling you over. You look towards where a group of your friends is standing, when all of the sudden a stream of icy water from water cannon washes them away from your sight. You start looking for an escape route, but then a cloud of tear-gas smoke engulfs you and you begin to cough and stumble around half-blind...  You manage to leave the cloud, but then run straight into a police officer, who knocks you down with a baton and starts beating you on the ground. Next to you is another civilian, lying down unconscious with his hands cuffed behind his backs, his face covered in blood, is that the faith which awaits you as well? Suddenly, a molotov cocktail thrown out of nowhere hits the police officer's visor, setting him on fire, and he runs backwards, screaming while his colleges go after him with a fire extinguisher. You stand up and pick up a crowbar you found on the ground. Something begins to boil inside you, you are a citizen dammit, you know your rights and today you will fight for them. You think to yourself, this is either a dream, or the A.C.A.B. mod was finally released and you're playing it!SummaryMount&Blade engine is the best choice out there for any sort of conflict which involves melee, shields, thrown missiles and horseback fighting.  And modern day riots fit the description perfectly, yet the setting has not been explored enough, until now.The more I played around with ideas and built prototypes, the more it became apparent that this mod setting has a huge potential in all of these areas: single player missions, multiplayer coop missions, multiplayer casual and role-play servers, regimental events. How will it start?My current focus is towards two aspects: regimental events and role-play servers. Reasons are, it is easier to get decent number of players on an event server rather than casual one, and role-play/jailbreak servers are most popular and a natural choice considering the setting. In design concepts section at bottom of this page there are more explanations on how both of these types of servers would work. To answer the question directly, the first step will be to release public Alpha version and organize a test event, as is usual.A single player mission type game is also an option but it will come later, as I want it to be done well. It shouldn't be a simple invasion type thing where you bash endless waves of bots. But primary development focus for now is building a mod for regimental event play where up to 200 players can join the riot event as either a group of rioters or a police force squad.Events themselves would have a little bit of role-play elements, as obviously the victory condition in this setting cannot be to kill everyone in the enemy team, nor should police be able to immediately attack any "enemy" on the spot. If you're left wondering how can this work or will it even be fun, please do read the design concepts at bottom of this page, which will explain more. Why the Riot Mod Needs Your Help?The mod, in it's current state, is already starting to achieve brilliance in gameplay, inventiveness, sound and atmosphere. But almost all the 3D models used for clothes and scene props are just place-holders, downloaded for free or made by me, to be replaced with quality models as I acquire them.The problem is I am a coder, my modelling skills are limited, and all the good modelers I know will not produce quality models for free, especially for items as complex as clothing. And for a mob of civilians to look convincing, there needs to be a lot of different random clothing combinations. One section most lacking at the moment is head wear, as you can see on promo video, most civilians are still wearing centuries old Napoleonic Wars hats. Also, there are certain scene props which are  very much needed for the mod to be complete, but I wouldn't be able to make them myself, which is why acquiring models is a critical aspect, and to get quality results money needs to be payed to modelers, which is why I'm asking for your help.I (and others who saw/tested it) firmly believe this is going to be an awesome mod, and it will be released whether this funding succeeds or fails. The difference is, it will work and look ten times more awesome if funding succeeds, and you will be able to pride yourself on the fact that you gave a contribution which made it all possible.Also, it is not just about 3D models, if funding succeeds and the modeling part of the job is off my back, I will be able to spend more time coding features and making it a better game, so your contribution will help all the game aspects improve, not just visual.Risks & ChallengesI'm not going to pretend everything is skimmed milk and honey, of course there may be some risks and challenges on the road. Since I personally know the mod will be fun to play, the only risk is whether a sufficient mass of players will come to realize this, and the challenge is in helping them make their mind, but if you believe in this mod then you can help with that as well, with some good word of your mouth, or at least by spreading links to this or other related pages. Of course, there is a competition with other multiplayer event based mods, but that is another reason why I am asking for donations - better quality models, combined with fun gameplay, will give this mod an edge.Another risk is whether some wild feature will make server with lots of players crash or lag outstandingly. I will use all my experience as a developer and knowledge of M&B module system, combined with testing before publishing any release to prevent this from happening.One more risk I can think of comes with the fact that this is a NW mod which means only owners of Napoleonic Wars can play it. However I don't see a problem with that, as a portion of people who quit NW out of boredom might come back to it just to play the riot mod. Other Ways You Can HelpI only need money to achieve the goal of having quality visuals, of course you can help in other ways. If you really like the mod idea that's a good start, you can help by talking about it and sharing links with your friends and enemies. If you are skilled modeler/texture artist/animator/sound engineer or are on your way to become one, you can help by doing some volunteer work. In return, apart from the pleasure of taking part in creation of this mod, you will get some work experience and things to add to your portfolio.Q&A:Q: Why are you asking for such a small amount?My intention is not to become a hot-shot studio owner running on thousands of dollars of crowdfunded money, I just want to publish this awesome mod and make it look prettier and work better (and be published sooner) than it would without any funding. In my estimate, $500 is enough to achieve that. If we manage to gather more money, more improvements and a bigger content pool could be made, also game servers are not free, and the more money put into them the better. If we don't even reach the $500 goal, all backers will get their money back (campaign is set to fixed goal), and I will continue to work on the mod alone. This mod will be published eventually whether the funding works or not, though it will look worse and will take much more time until public release. In case of a low support (less than 50% of goal reached) I'll change focus from multiplayer to single player missions.Q: Why are you making a new M&B mod now when Bannerlord is about to be released?No one really knows when the Bannerlord will come out, but when it does, it certainly won't have anything like the riot mod. Also, this can be a sort of mod which extends the game's life, as some players who quit or would quit NW out of boredom might come back to it just to play the riot mod. Another point to make is, all the assets we acquire thanks to your donations can be used in remaking the mod for Bannerlord, when and if the time comes. But I will not be making any Bannerlord mods at it's very first release, as there will probably be a lot of game updates/patches before modding it becomes worthwhile. Q: Can you port A.C.A.B. to be Native mod instead of Napoleonic Wars mod?In short, no. Using NW as basis has saved me a lot of development time. Though it might get ported into Bannerlord eventually. If and when that happens, all the backers will keep their perks in a new version, which makes sense as the port would be using a lot of assets which were payed with backers' money.Q: Will anyone be able to host their own A.C.A.B. server?Yes, server files will be released as well, though only official servers will have benefits of persistent database storage. Server owners will have tools in form of special scene props and extended admin menu which will allow them to create a unique type of server without actual modding.Q: What about the system requirements for playing A.C.A.B. mod?The mod will have more complex textures and models with higher polygon count than your usual Mount&Blade mod, so the requirements will probably be somewhere at North&South or Blood&Iron level but not above that. Fixing frame rate problems which may arise will be my constant focus.Q: I noticed there are some perks which make unique skins/items available, how does that work? "Unique" means only you can spawn with those items. A portion of money you payed for the perk will go towards creation of that item, the rest goes towards mod budget. Developers keep the right to refuse an item creation if it is inappropriate, so it is best to contact me and check if your desired item kind is allowed before paying for the perk.  Some Plans & Design Concepts Here comes a lot of text, mainly bits and pieces from the design document, read it if you're very interested in how the game will work.If you want to know, baton dynamics currently work like this:-if you hit a guy with a baton, with higher damage you have much higher chance to knock him on the ground (typical knocked by blunt damage 3 seconds animation), unless the guy is holding unarmed block (unarmed block animation changed so the guy is bent down slightly and using arms to protect his whole head). Of course you do higher damage the usual M&B way - by holding the attack longer, aiming for the head, moving body with the swing, or just taking a bigger baton which does more damage.-Once in knocked down animation, if you hit a guy again while on the ground, one of three things will happen depending on damage amount:--Nothing, too low damage--Medium damage, the guy falls on his back for several seconds, and while in this position, as he is instinctively using his arms and legs to protect himself, all damage dealt to him is reduced times /4, as you are mostly hitting his arms and legs and not the head or torso. This allows fun times where several policemen are beating one person on the ground without much fear of killing him.--High damage, contused, with face down and won't wake up soon. Of course, hitting a guy further while in this state would mean you risk to kill him.Pistols and how they work:Depending on context it can scare them off, halt them, cuff them, all done by pressing X while holding a gun.Pistols should have next to no part in multiplayer riot event, but are useful for making solo play as a cop vs bots a richer experience.Sequence needs more polishing, for example they should drop wielded weapon properly before hands behind back animation. Also a cop should be locked in cuffing animation until a suspect is cuffed.Molotovs and how they work:Possibility to get ignited if close enough to source of open flame. Burn levels are accumulated per individual, lower burn level means person is just a little bit on fire and burn level will be decreasing in time which means fire will be put out by itself. Higher burn levels keep rising in time as person is more and more engulfed in flames, in which case only a fire extinguisher can reduce a burn level.Note that regular sized molotovs cocktails are not meant to be OP area of damage weapon or anything like that, they are used for disturbing the lines, as dropping it bellow cop's feet will make them do the hop animation, and only in rare cases will they actually set people on fire, those will mostly be freak accidents.Some of amusing features planned:-Water cannon -usually only one per cop team, like NW cannon, but a continuous stream used to push people away or at least stun them.-Radio - walkie-talkie however you want to call it, is what leaders of squads (officers) get. Can be used to:1) identify individuals from enemy team, by aiming at someone and pressing a button you get to see his player name.2) order arrest, which means put a beacon over someone who should be taken out, as name of the target has to be picked from the list of names, it would be good to use 1) identify people first.3) report position, this would make beacon (visible by anyone in his team who has radio) flash over the radio user for few seconds so other unit commanders know his squad position.4) communication with other squads, radio could have shortcuts for useful communication between squad leaders on events, anyone who has radio in inventory would pick up these messages, shortcuts to say stuff like "we're on position", "we're moving in", "requesting reinforcement" etc....-Molotov cocktails, colored torches and other pyromaniac toys, I'd take special care to have decent fire dynamics. Molotovs are more a psychological tool to cause a hole in a line of cops, it wouldn't be easy to actually set a guy on fire but if it does happen, cop team should have someone who chose to carry fire extinguisher, hopefully they will remember to bring one of those.-Scene props which would allow server owner to use map editing to do some custom stuff which were previously possible only by modding (writing code), its hard to explain really, but the point would be to allow more control over server rules, and allow creation of custom role-play environments thought up by server owner without doing the actual modding, by just editing a map and adding invisible scene props which decide on server rules. story:
Keatz -The Lonely Bird is a 2D side-scrolling platform action game which is based on the story of the lonely bird who have been abandoned by the society. The Government of Heavens, a country where all kinds of birds lives, suddenly and unexpectedly came up with a decision of eliminating all the flightless birds from Heavens country by any means necessary because they were deemed to be useless for the country.

The purpose of this campaign is to bring this project back to life and introduce all the intended features into the game including more enemies, new levels, boss fights, secrets and much more.  For this, I need financial support to pay the bills, upgrade specs of my PC for better performance, buying some new equipment and keep working on the game for the rest six months before the deadline. The rest of the money will be used to improve the game. Any support is greatly appreciated and will help me finish the games with all the features mentioned above.

Download The Alpha Demo(V0.0.9): http://www.mediafire.com/file/cuoyzulid2y87cm/Keatz_The_Lonely_Bird_Alpha_Demo_v0.0.9.zip

[Please note that, this is an early demo of the game. Some features might not work in the current version as intended.]

Keatz has been abandoned by the society because of his inability to fly like other birds can. Not only that, the Government of the bird country "Heavens" decided to eliminate all the flightless birds residing there. Keatz, himself, decided to start a journey against the corruptions and social evils and also against the dumb decisions made by the Heavens Government. He wanted to make a room for himself when everything was falling apart. One day, he came across another flightless bird who soon became his friend and a part of his life. His life changed for a few days until they were attacked again by Heavens's soldiers and the peace did not last long, unfortunately.  

"Will Keatz be able to protect all the flightless bird? Will he be able to protect his best friend who became the part of his life and with whom he promised of never leaving her side?"

It is a mystery which still remained unsolved....

I have developed this game to some extent on my own with my money. As I am currently running out of money while developing the project I am in urgent need of some financial support so that I can finish this game project and to keep up with the development like fixing bugs, adding extra features etc. I would like to show some of the progress I made in the last 8 months of development. It is expected to take another 6 months for adding the planned features to the game if the campaign goes well.

The Boss Battle:

 

 

The animated image shown above presents the first boss fight of Keatz The Lonely Bird game. More boss battle levels are planned for future which will be quite different from the boss fight shown above and there will be some special items which the player will receive for future use.

The Cave Level:

This is one of those levels where the player needs to hack through the security system. More new features are planned for this level to make it even better.

Press

The Concept of the Real World and the Dream World:

 

The animated image shown above demonstrates "The Real World". Real world is where most of the incidents and battle takes place. But the dream world is a bit different from the concept of the real world.

 

 The animated image shown above demonstrates the Dream world level. Dream world is visually different from the real world. Those changes which occur in the Dream world will also reflect the Real world. Suppose, the player receives the weapons from the Dream world and when he wakes up in the real world he finds himself holding exactly the same weapon which he had collected in the dream world. Both the worlds are interconnected somehow. Moreover, the player will be given a fixed time limit within which the player must complete the mission only in Dream world.

There are definitely risks associated with the Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign. There are two things which might happen while the campaign is live.
1. If the Indiegogo funding fails to reach its goal.
2. If the Funding reaches at 100%.
 
For the first case, I will still work on this game with an aim to finish the game project but some features may or may not be available in the final version of the game due to the lack of funding.  Since, this is a Flexible funding, all the funds will be collected even if it fails to reach the goal. However, those who contributed to the campaign will receive the rewards at an appropriate time based on the rewards chosen.
 
For the latter, I will introduce all the planned features into the game as soon as the game project reaches its deadline. I will make sure all the players who have supported me throughout the campaign will receive the rewards at an appropriate time based on the perks selected by backers.
 
If you are really interested in this project and want to see it happen you can choose the perks as you wish. You can also help me out by sharing the link of this campaign with your Facebook friends, or on your personal Twitter account even if you can't financially contribute. Each and every share counts and would be extremely helpful.
 

The Team:

I, Anamik Majumdar, am a solo developer(One-man team) working on this project for about 8 months. One day, I had a plan to make a game based on two different worlds which will be interlinked with each other somehow but will be a platform action game. So, I worked on it keeping that in mind and this is how it looks at the moment.

I have 6 years experience in game development and I have already released my first indie game called NightmareZ on Steam. You can take a look here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/509930/NightmareZ/

However, I am currently running out of money and urgently in need of some financial support from the interested players to continue working on this project and get it out to the world as soon as possible.

1. Why do you need the funding?

  • First of all, I am running out of money right now and I have tried my best to come this far myself.
  • Sometimes, it becomes a daunting task to record the gameplay at a stable frame rate. That is why I need to upgrade the specs of my PC for better performance.
  • I need to buy some equipment which are also required in the development of this game.
  • Pay bills including Internet, Electricity and other payments so as to continue with the development of the game as almost six months of work is left which might not be possible otherwise.

2. When will I get access to the game?

As soon as the game is released on Steam, you will get access to my game on Steam if you choose any one of $3, $5, $10, $20 and $50 tier.

3. When will the game release on Steam?

The release date of Keatz The Lonely Bird game has not been decided yet but if it is fully funded, I will try my best to release this game by December, 2017.

4. I am interested in your creative work. Where can I follow you?

That's a good news! You can follow me on:

Twitter , Facebook and Website
story_txt:
Keatz -The Lonely Bird is a 2D side-scrolling platform action game which is based on the story of the lonely bird who have been abandoned by the society. The Government of Heavens, a country where all kinds of birds lives, suddenly and unexpectedly came up with a decision of eliminating all the flightless birds from Heavens country by any means necessary because they were deemed to be useless for the country.
The purpose of this campaign is to bring this project back to life and introduce all the intended features into the game including more enemies, new levels, boss fights, secrets and much more.  For this, I need financial support to pay the bills, upgrade specs of my PC for better performance, buying some new equipment and keep working on the game for the rest six months before the deadline. The rest of the money will be used to improve the game. Any support is greatly appreciated and will help me finish the games with all the features mentioned above.

Download The Alpha Demo(V0.0.9): http://www.mediafire.com/file/cuoyzulid2y87cm/Keatz_The_Lonely_Bird_Alpha_Demo_v0.0.9.zip
[Please note that, this is an early demo of the game. Some features might not work in the current version as intended.]

Keatz has been abandoned by the society because of his inability to fly like other birds can. Not only that, the Government of the bird country "Heavens" decided to eliminate all the flightless birds residing there. Keatz, himself, decided to start a journey against the corruptions and social evils and also against the dumb decisions made by the Heavens Government. He wanted to make a room for himself when everything was falling apart. One day, he came across another flightless bird who soon became his friend and a part of his life. His life changed for a few days until they were attacked again by Heavens's soldiers and the peace did not last long, unfortunately.  
"Will Keatz be able to protect all the flightless bird? Will he be able to protect his best friend who became the part of his life and with whom he promised of never leaving her side?"
It is a mystery which still remained unsolved....

I have developed this game to some extent on my own with my money. As I am currently running out of money while developing the project I am in urgent need of some financial support so that I can finish this game project and to keep up with the development like fixing bugs, adding extra features etc. I would like to show some of the progress I made in the last 8 months of development. It is expected to take another 6 months for adding the planned features to the game if the campaign goes well.
The Boss Battle: 
 
 
The animated image shown above presents the first boss fight of Keatz The Lonely Bird game. More boss battle levels are planned for future which will be quite different from the boss fight shown above and there will be some special items which the player will receive for future use.
The Cave Level:

This is one of those levels where the player needs to hack through the security system. More new features are planned for this level to make it even better.
Press



The Concept of the Real World and the Dream World:
 
The animated image shown above demonstrates "The Real World". Real world is where most of the incidents and battle takes place. But the dream world is a bit different from the concept of the real world.
 
 The animated image shown above demonstrates the Dream world level. Dream world is visually different from the real world. Those changes which occur in the Dream world will also reflect the Real world. Suppose, the player receives the weapons from the Dream world and when he wakes up in the real world he finds himself holding exactly the same weapon which he had collected in the dream world. Both the worlds are interconnected somehow. Moreover, the player will be given a fixed time limit within which the player must complete the mission only in Dream world.











There are definitely risks associated with the Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign. There are two things which might happen while the campaign is live.1. If the Indiegogo funding fails to reach its goal.2. If the Funding reaches at 100%. For the first case, I will still work on this game with an aim to finish the game project but some features may or may not be available in the final version of the game due to the lack of funding.  Since, this is a Flexible funding, all the funds will be collected even if it fails to reach the goal. However, those who contributed to the campaign will receive the rewards at an appropriate time based on the rewards chosen.
 For the latter, I will introduce all the planned features into the game as soon as the game project reaches its deadline. I will make sure all the players who have supported me throughout the campaign will receive the rewards at an appropriate time based on the perks selected by backers. If you are really interested in this project and want to see it happen you can choose the perks as you wish. You can also help me out by sharing the link of this campaign with your Facebook friends, or on your personal Twitter account even if you can't financially contribute. Each and every share counts and would be extremely helpful. The Team:I, Anamik Majumdar, am a solo developer(One-man team) working on this project for about 8 months. One day, I had a plan to make a game based on two different worlds which will be interlinked with each other somehow but will be a platform action game. So, I worked on it keeping that in mind and this is how it looks at the moment.I have 6 years experience in game development and I have already released my first indie game called NightmareZ on Steam. You can take a look here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/509930/NightmareZ/However, I am currently running out of money and urgently in need of some financial support from the interested players to continue working on this project and get it out to the world as soon as possible.1. Why do you need the funding?
First of all, I am running out of money right now and I have tried my best to come this far myself.
Sometimes, it becomes a daunting task to record the gameplay at a stable frame rate. That is why I need to upgrade the specs of my PC for better performance.
I need to buy some equipment which are also required in the development of this game.
Pay bills including Internet, Electricity and other payments so as to continue with the development of the game as almost six months of work is left which might not be possible otherwise.
2. When will I get access to the game?As soon as the game is released on Steam, you will get access to my game on Steam if you choose any one of $3, $5, $10, $20 and $50 tier.3. When will the game release on Steam?The release date of Keatz The Lonely Bird game has not been decided yet but if it is fully funded, I will try my best to release this game by December, 2017.4. story:
Astro Legends is a Space Shooter MMO RPG game set in a sci-fi universe.

It's an original game combining the combat action of classic arcade games with the free movement and customization of modern MMO RPG games.

Explore the galaxy, discover distant worlds, collect precious resources, trade goods, complete missions, buy new ships of different classes, customize them with different weapons and equipment, and personalize their visual look!

Expect having hundreds or thousands of hours online playing the campaign missions or simply exploring the far regions of the galaxy. Complete missions with friends or other players or fight them in PvP mode!

Take part in epic battles with lots of players! Show your skills and become a Legend!

 

Why Crowdfunding?

We started this crowdfunding to help us make the game as good as it can be. The raised funds will help us hire more staff to work on the project and cover other costs.

 

Backer Rewards

By backing the game, not only will you help improving it, but you can also get great rewards, like having the opportunity to play the closed Alpha and Beta version!

Some perks are limited. Hurry up and get them now!

The Deluxe Pack includes extra ship skins and extra decals for use on your ships customization.

The Premium Pack includes all of the Deluxe Pack, plus extra gear for your avatar customization and also an alternative starting ship.

All backers will get an in-game Founder Badge on their game profile page.

Below you can see the estimated timeline for the several game releases stages.

 

Stretch Goals

If the game gets crowdfunded beyond the initial goal, it will allow us to further improve it with more features/content.

Our first stretch goal is to add a new game faction, with additional playable ships and new campaign missions.

Stay tuned for updates!

As every online game depends on its community, we really appreciate if you share this campaign with your friends and game mates and help us reach the goals! You will need them to protect the galaxy!

 

System Requirements

Astro Legends will be available for Windows PC. The hardware requirements have not been determined yet, but our target is to ensure that the game runs on the widest range of PC's as possible, while still taking advantage of more capable machines.

Concept Art

Business Model

To complement game sales we plan to have micro-transactions for some features, like ships customization and some items that can also be obtained playing the game.

Concept Art

Screenshots

Some game screenshots (Pre-Alpha stage).

 

Risks and challenges

We aim to release the game as soon as possible and under the estimate dates. But unexpected events or difficulties can delay the release dates or cause us to limit features in the initial game version.

 

F.A.Q.

Can you pilot the larger ships?

You can only pilot smaller units like fighters or bombers. The combat is played in fast action where you have to dodge fire from other units.

How many players can be on a single battle?

We are designing the system to support a large number of players at a single battle, but at this moment we don't know the limits yet.

How does the name a NPC character or name a star system works?

We will contact you to get your picked suggestion and see how to fit it in-game, for example you can give your name to an in-game NPC Fleet Admiral or give your name to a ruler of some independent world, the same for naming a star system, like giving a name resembling of your city. The names must fit the game and not look displaced, we will work with you for adjustments if necessary or ask you to suggest new ones.

Why should I back this project?

If you love space games, MMOs and shooters, Astro Legends fits all those themes that we also love! Adventure yourself alone or with friends and explore a vast galaxy, visiting different types of planets and space stations. Show your skills in a fast combat game, fight along your squadron against other players and large enemy bosses. It’s a game like no other. Backing it now will help us improve the game and add more features. All bakers will receive a digital copy of the game, early access and a in-game founder badge. For those who can help us a little more we appreciate the help by giving you more rewards, please check the rewards list. This is the best moment to contribute and reserve your rewards!

Is there any relation with your game Astro Empires?

They are completely different game types, still we are using part of the Astro Empires lore. If you are playing Astro Empires or have played it before you will recognize some elements.

Will the game be available for mobile devices?

We don't have plans to make a mobile version of the game at the moment. The current version was developed in terms of playability and interface for larger screens.

What game engine are you using to make this game​?

We built our own custom-made game engine, developed from a few open source projects.

Why am I asked for a shipping address at checkout?

Although the rewards are in digital format, we still need your address in special your country for accounting/billing reasons, as the VAT depends on the country. Note: The prices already include the VAT value when applicable.

Download and Play the prototype v0.1 (Windows): https://goo.gl/fh6myE

 

We need your $ and your support, you get a sweet game.

We started this crowdfunding to help us make the game as good as it can be. The raised funds will help us hire more staff to work on the project and cover other costs.

With your help we can overcome the barriers to make this a full commercial game.

  • The first goal is to make a single player mode, where you can complete missions in different sceneries, difficulties and more.
  • The next goal is to make a multiplayer mode.

 

What You Get

First and foremost you get our appreciation!

By backing the game, not only will you help improving it, but you can also get great rewards, like having the opportunity to play the closed Beta version!

Some perks are limited. Hurry up and get them now!

 

System Requirements

Headshot will be available for Windows PC for now, but we hope to deploy for other systems. The hardware requirements have not been determined yet, but our target is to ensure that the game runs on the widest range of PC's as possible, while still taking advantage of more capable machines.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to contribute at this time, you can help us greatly by getting the word out, and sharing our page on social media. We appreciate it lots. 

Just be a wonderful person and lend a helping hand to someone in need.

 

Thank you all for your attention.
We hope you like the game!

story:
We're offering the chance for you to be a part of Brass Town Wrestling! Now that the game has been released on Steam, we're offering contributors a chance to chip in to its development, with a variety of perks to suit different budgets! With the money raised, we're aiming to add 5 free expansions to this already fun and distinctive wrestling role playing game for PC.

 

  • Brass Town Wrestling allows you to rise from Rookie to Hall of Famer, in a 5 year open world career.
  • Once funded, all contributors of £9 or more are guaranteed a copy of the game. All game owners will get the funded expansions for free.
  • You can be a part of the game in a variety of ways through add on perks tailored to each expansion!
  • Try our demo to see why people who play the game say they love it.

 

 

 

Backyard Brawl

Just west of the farm, you may have seen a strange wrestling ring sized area cleared in the long grass. The blood on the floor is a bit of a clue that on an evening once a week not all is at it seems! In this free expansion, you will get to see how tough you really are when all the rules are thrown out of the window!

The theme of this expansion will be legitimate tough guys and the Brawl for All tournament. Think Brock Lesnar types to get an idea of what you may come up against here!

Add on perks include;

Design an Illegal Move - Tell us the move's name, how it is performed, and what body part it should damage. When the move is performed the commentators will describe your move as it's performed!

Design an Illegal Weapon - Outside of the ring anything goes, including weapons! Tell us what the weapon is, what it's sprite should look like, and what body part it will damage! Weapons will have their own custom 24px x 24px image in the player's inventory.

 

Spirited Squad

Anyone who has been playing Brass Town and visited the church will notice a restless spirit has been wandering the church. With this free expansion players will get to wrestle against restless spirits to uncover the truth about the history between The Rev and Spivey! 

The theme of this expansion will be skeletons in the closet, and bad wrestling gimmicks. Think "The Shock Master" and you will be pretty close to the types of spirits you will be wrestling!

Add on perks include;

Design an Awful Gimmick! Tell us all about the awful gimmick that the player will be able to use. We intend to add a whole new branch of "Awful" gimmicks that the player can develop using ideas they earn in the library. Gimmicks in Brass Town Wrestling take up the slot usually reserved for weapons in traditional JRPGs and give the player various bonuses.

 

Size Matters

The bigger they are the harder they fall! Bringing the weight system into focus, this expansion shines the spotlight on the importance of weight classes. Wanna be the best cruiserweight in town, or a not so gentle giant? This planned expansion aims to make size matter as you unlock special events depending on your weight class.

This expansion is intended to integrate into the special event matches when you don't have a title match or personal feud. There will be weight class specific tournaments and special stipulation fights for the player to battle through to etch their name in Brass Town history.

Add on perks include;

Design a Trophy - This add on allows you to name and design the trophy the player wins as the ultimate super-heavyweight/cruiserweight. Above are examples of the type of trophy you can design.

 

Fashion Cops

This planned expansion focuses on a major graphical update. The goal is to have your ring attire match what you see when you walk to and get into the ring. We also plan to add more customised entrance music, pyro and entrance graphics.

This is a fairly big expansion in terms of graphics and programming, and possibly less exciting at first glance than the other expansions. We think it's definitely worth pushing for if there is enough interest in the game!

Add on perks include;

Design Attire - Your player will change into their attire during the ring entrance. Design and name your own ring attire that will cover the players body!

Design a Mask - If the player has any headgear equipped, this will show up during the ring entrance. You can design and name your own mask/hat to be included in the game!

 

The Far East

What lies east of town? At the moment you are unable to move off the east map, but that is all set to change with this expansion! This is an ambitious expansion that aims to add a whole new area loaded with references to Japanese wrestling. Battle your way to become the greatest wrestler the far east has ever seen!  

Think of legends such as Antonio Inoki to imagine the type of opponent you will face here. This being a whole new area, will take a huge amount of work, but I hope you all agree that it'll be worth it!

Add on perks include;

Design a Statue - The Far East will be it's own zone, and will need some decoration. You can design your own sprite of a statue to feature in the game, with a plaque crediting you!

 

Brass Town Wrestling was a solo project that started 6 years ago. The goal has always been to create a deep wrestling RPG that's easy to play, but challenging to master. 

The gameplay received great feedback from players for it's strategic fight simulation and replayability. In 2018, a Kickstarter campaign was launched to get some custom graphics to make things a little easier on the eye. Following the Kickstarter campaign, Emma came on board as a graphic artist. As you can see, the final release went above and beyond all the promises made in the campaign.

When the game released in 2020, we really hoped that the sales would help fund the planned expansions. Unfortunately, despite consistently positive feedback from players, it seems to be an uphill battle for a new indie game to stand out from the crowd.

We really believe in this game, so we've come to Indiegogo in the hope that we can get at least some of the planned expansions added. The game has incredible depth, as the world gradually opens up and reveals more and more depth of gameplay and hilarious wrestling references mixed with touching stories. The expansions will allow the game to explore some really fun aspects of professional wrestling that will hugely enhance the player experience. Let's face it, who doesn't want to dive into the rich world of Japanese Strong Style, Cruiserweights, Hardcore Wrestling or just plain ridiculous gimmicks!?

The money we are raising will pay to keep Emma on board for the new graphics, and Rob for any additional chip tune music. If you don't have the funds to back the project right now, even just downloading the demo and adding the game to your Steam wishlist can help show your support.

We try to always listen to our community, so if you have any feedback or suggestions please get in touch. 

 

 

 

Above: Previous Kickstarter sprites

 

Above: Previous Kickstarter champions

 

Our FREE demo allows you to experience the first 15 - 45 minutes of Brass Town Wrestling - more than enough time to decide whether it's for you! Rest assured that there is plenty more to discover, as the game begins to open up as the demo finishes! 

 

 

  • The base game was already successfully funded and released, so in the worst case scenario you will receive a full game and t-shirt (if you ordered one).
  • The funds raised will pay for the graphics and additional music.
  • I give my time for all the programming without any expectation of making money. Unless something awful happens to me, then the funded expansions will happen eventually.
