story:
*Starts at 7:15
 


*Level 2 - Exit zone

Spheres of Evil it's a tough top-down, action/RPG, puzzle, maze game. You'll have to release souls and destroy Demons from a huge dungeon, while trying to scape all kind of traps and obstacles in your way to the next level's exit zone. It will be also necessary getting the missing pages of an ancient book in order to revert a conjuring.

Die over and over again in this game, all the way through 3 worlds and 30 different levels.

Download Spheres of Evil v0.7 (Demo) from Game Jolt
https://gamejolt.com/games/SpheresofEvil/315599
*Extract ZIP file contents into a folder in your Desktop.

The game idea is born somewhere during 2015, after watching the final scene from a Stephen King movie, "The Shining", where the main character, Jack, pursues the mother and her son accross a maze, in the snow. Contrary to what some people think, Spheres of Evil isn't based in any classic 80s, 90s game. At the beginning, it was going to be a much more minimalist game, with simple design and mechanics; it's only several months later that the idea of giving it a darker ambience came up, and with it, all the action-RPG elements, and the added complexity.

First of all, sorry if our English is not perfect, we do the best we can. Spanish is our native language. Spheres of Evil was going to be initially a game about demonology, in fact, that's why you see demonic symbology (seals) everywhere in the videos, so it was basically all about releasing demons across the mazes to receive powers. Then, we thought a more interesting twist. There's a saying that goes "Don't deal with the Devil", you surely know it. And that's precisely the story of our unnamed sphere-based character. Attracted by the dark side and occultism, and after disobeying the deals with the demons he worked with, the soul of our sorcerer is then locked inside a Crystal ball and condemned to roll eternally.

To make it worse, he was a powerful magician, so his activities opened the gates of an underworld and hundreds of demons passed through that portal, possessing the souls of men and women. In an act of repentance and in his desperate attempt to recover his human shape and be free and to save the world from this malice, our wizard-sphere has to release these souls by means of exorcisms, which wiill make him grow stronger in power, acquire new skills and get necessary tips to solve the puzzles that will be present in every level. Tips are reveled only when a soul is released from the torment.

But it won't be enough. His knowledge about magic and demons won't allow him to recover his human shape unless he picks the missing pages of a very ancient book. And there are many. The last page, the very last and most important page from the book is obtained in the last level only.

  • Release souls in order to receive great powers and important information/tips. Most levels will have one or more from a total of nearly a hundred you have to release.

  • You'll need to find the missing pages of a book, which will revert the spell the demons put on you. This is the first item in the Inventory, you will be able to see its contents as long as you start getting pages.

  • There are other objects that may be required as well to exit each level.

  • Escaping each maze (there will be a total of 30 different levels).

  • It will be necessary to level-up your powers in order to be able to face the demons you'll find in the different stages in the game. They are tough bastards.


*Level 2 - Fire ball power-up

Apart from what has been said, Spheres of Evil is a very addictive game, with a high level of replayability, with several hours of granted gameplay. We can't say an specific number at this point, but there have been people playing it for hours in a row just to get past Level 4. The game was thought since its inception, as a very difficult game, with a special emphasis in a balanced level design. Our main objective was always that you wanted to return to it and continue from where you left, and that you always had fun and granted difficulty. Our focus was always aimed at the gameplay, it had to felt extremely good, it had to be smooth, with tight input/control response. Even since its prototype phase, in 2015, most of it it's there.

The extremely zoomed-in camera view makes you have not clear vision where you are nor where the next trap or enemy will appear, so you will need to somewhat memorize the paths in the mazes and the mazes themselves, and even by doing so, enemies will take you by surprise countless times (see gameplay footage/streams below). The Map object (it's in the Inventory), will be your best allied, but you have limited uses of it, so needs to be used at discretion.

There are some check points in each level (not yet implemented), which could ease things up a little. These saved-points are kept only as long as you are in the current level and will vanish when you try to play the same level again from the level selection screen, or the next time you continue the game. It's possible coming from a level ahead to one you played earlier, maybe to pick up some item of interest, to increase your available shootings, amongst other reasons. It's possible doing it. That's what we was talking about the replayability value. We don't want you pass the levels one after another just to get to the exit zones. We want you to explore every corner of the mazes. We like the completionist type of gamer. There will always be a hidden surprise. (i.e. secret rooms, interdimensional portals, etc.)

*Levels 1-3 - Gameplay footage - 2
*Levels 1-3 - Gameplay footage - 1

 

Gameplay footage/Streams

*v0.7 Demo- Gameplay footage - UrRandomGamer *Starts at 7:15

*Please note the framerate and the scroll in the game is far smoother than what you can see in these videos. It's an issue of the video-capturing software that have been used, it's capturing at 30fps instead of 60.
 

You will be able to select every resolution your graphic card is capable of, enable/disable VSync, windowed or border-less screen modes, setting the FPS Rate of your choice (60, 72, 75, 85 up to 144), and even typing your own FPS rate value. Game progress is saved as long as you play, it allows several game data files saved in the same device/machine, just as usual in every game. You will be able to choose latest saved game from the menu, chronologicaly, or choose any other saved game through Load Game option.

There are 3 worlds in Spheres of Evil, with 10 levels each, depicting different scenarios. First one has a more abstract aesthetic, with stones/walls of different, pale flat colours, asphalt-like floors, sand, grass, crumbling walls and wiring and other textures. The second world is more of a desert-like theme. There are also secret rooms, which in the first world refers to a sort of street drainage system. The ambience/scenary for the remaining 3rd. world is not yet defined. We would love you suggest your ideas on this regard, this campaign is also meant for this. See "Community" section below.


The enemies won't follow you, they go fixed paths, sometimes from origin to destination, back and forth, sometimes more of a closed circuit path. From Marquises and onwards, they have ability to shoot if you come across their line of fire. Enemies have energy bars and can be effectively be killed. Bear in mind they will revive everytime you die, when the level restarts or when you later revisit the level.

Not only the souls you release will give you powers, you will find power-ups in different spots in the dungeons, the Ice Ball, the Fire Ball, the Electric Ray, the Power of Wind and the Dagger. The powers we receive are the powers from the demons we exorcise.

*Some magic symbols/seals

These Seals are important as reference spots in the maps, there will be over a hundred different symbols. Sometimes, by reaching certain places or getting close to some objects, it will be indicated getting close to certain symbol, as a tip of something important that needs to be picked up or some sort of geographical orientation. So it's important you memorize these symbols position, and somewhat, their names or you will be going around in circles. You have to step over them for a pop-up text to be displayed, which will reveal the name, type and properties of the symbol. Some of them will also allow you get through interdimensional portals, allowing you to teleport to other zones in the map. Some zones will be completely inaccessible and this is the only way to get access to them.


*Some items

There are several items in the game, the Pentagram, the Chaos Symbol, the Clavicula Nox, the Leviathan Symbol, amongst others, each one with its colors and properties. Some objects won't do anything by itself, nor go to the inventory, but will give you a related object when a series of these items are picked up. i.e. You may receive a power-up or increase your available shootings percent, damage level or damage factor (in case you already have it), by picking 5 Green Leviathan objects. The amount of items to pick up, by its type is indicated at the beginning of the level.

There also exists the treasure chest, the map, the invisibility ball, the question mark, amongst others. It's important getting all the objects so to increase your powers, level up and acquire magic. You are going to fight against demons, so you will have to use their own elements and symbols in order to have a chance. You are a sorcerer after all.


*Inventory system

Not all the items collected go into the inventory, so to not flood it and making it hard to explore. So, everytime the same object is picked up, the amount of available uses is displayed in the top-left corner of the item, instead of being added twice. This doesn't apply to keys as they could be used multiple times in the same door of the same level. They don't have any sort of available uses limitation. There are 20 different types of keys. The first item refers to the Book, which will have the missing pages required to beat the game, reverting the conjuring. It has unlimited uses, you can see the book as many times as you want, you will see how the missing pages start appearing as long as you find them. If you know how to read Aramaic language it will have some interesting stuff to read, about magic. It could be an interesting research work by itself, trying to decipher the contents of this book. In fact we added "The Book" item as the highest reward, the last one of the Perks/Tiers, the Sorcerer Perk.

The book is a key element of the game, since it will allow you revert the conjuring that trapped you inside the sphere. To do so, you will need to find the missing pages. It's possible reading it, page by page through the inventory as explained above. It's written in Aramaic language, it contains drawing, symbols, reference tables, descriptions and diverse instructions for the exorcism to be made. The page number will be mentioned everytime you pick up a page so you can go check the Inventory and read it.

The book is a compilation of texts and fragments from an anonymous Grimoire from XVII Century. Which at the same time, is based in really ancient scriptures from XIV or XV centuries, supposedly attributed to a Monk, according to the legend.


*The Book - Graphics *We are working in the texts, diagrams, charts, illustrations and contents of the book at this moment.

When reaching the last level from the last World, it might be necessary revisiting earlier worlds/levels in case of having missing pages.

There exists 4 Magics in the game, that can be accessed through the Inventory. Each one can only have certain amount of uses. Magic 1 produces less damage than 4th, and therefore, less than 2nd. and 3rd. You have to use them with care, they are of limited usage. Ideally, you have to use them when the place is crowded by enemies, for example in Level 5.

The dashboard will be always visible, as soon as you obtain the first power-up. As you can see in the above picture, the dashboard shows the selected power-up, the available shootings percent, the damage level (+2 a +6), the damage factor (x2 a x6), amount of picked-up keys for the current level and the amount of pages you've picked up so far. Alt Key or Button Y in the Gamepad, will allow you alternate powers. We are working right now in an additional row in the dashboard that could display the other items (those referred above) and its quantities.

You will find many doors in the game, that will require a specific switch so to be opened. The grey doors can't be initially opened, contrary to blue and green doors. There are doors of other colors as well. A green switch doesn't mean that will open all the green doors in a level, but one. Oftenly, the door that gets opened by activating a switch, it's far from the switch. You will listen the sound of a heavy door that slides in the floor, as an indication.

 

Only blades have been implemented as a trap, so far, but there will be more, such as the lava holes and the nails. The blades open and close at different time intervals, so you will have to learn the specific timings of each one. These have been a serious problem for everyone that played this game. :)


*Level 3 -Secret room 1


The secret rooms are small areas you can access from different, hidden points in the maps. Did we really say hidden? Full of traps and enemies, they contain great rewards and items.

We are working in some special effects as well, as the fog, lightnings, rain, camera shake at certain events such as dying, amongst others. So when using magics, for example a rain of balls in fire, in case of using the Hathopnasael Magic, an avalanch of rocks in case of Msarahiel Magic, and others.

Spheres of Evil is entirely developed in Visual Studio in C#, using Monogame framework as the graphic library. We didn't want to use Unity nor Unreal nor other game engines, but to develop our own engine. This wasn't a capricious decision, we already had a good amount of Classes and methods, code and propietary libraries that made the creation of the engine a little easier.  It's been in development for about 1 year, we started in June 2017, from a 2016 prototype.

There should be many technical aspects to discuss in this section, but it would be very boring. Some of them have been already discussed above, so generally speaking, we could mention:

We wanted a minimal UI, with a small, transparent dashboard in the top-left. Scoring and world-level indicators are placed at the center and right-top screen areas, respectively.

We didn't want a heavy dashboard, that occupied much of the game area. So for the mobile version, when and if we do it, we thought of a very lightweight semi-transparent interface, regarding input/controls, placed at the bottom part.

The in-game tutorial will give you some tips as text pop-ups, sometimes placed over the player some other times centered in the screen as far as you reach certain progress in the maps.

Similar to the tutorial, text pop-up indications will be given when receiving certain items, or when touching/accessing certain objects. It's important you read it all. The text is shown by means of standing over an object or in proximity to it, and it dissapears as long as you step out. You can advance every page in the text with the Space Bar/Enter or Button A in the Gamepad.

Movement: Arrow keys

Roll faster: Hold Shift Key+Arrow keys
Action: Space Bar
Shooting: Ctrl Key
Inventory: I Key
Power-up selection: Alt Key
Cancel/Menu: Esc
Exit to Windows: Alt+X
*Gamepad/DPad  support is not yet implemented.
**Menu is not yet implemented

All levels are first designed in paper, then carefuly replicated using Tiled software and designed/textured by our graphic designer. Then, they are printed. The addition of objects/items, doors, switches, traps, enemy paths amongst other things, complete the level design process and it's entirely made in paper. Only when it's finished, it's passed back to the software using our own level editor, which exports all the level data as an encrypted text file.

*Level design draft, on paper

Updates in the game are free, we are never going to charge an update nor a DLC. Updates are managed by the stores themselves, Steam, Gamejolt, itch.io, Windows Store, through their own client software. Same applies for those that get the game directly from us, as a stand-alone version, which will have a FTP update module, indicating there's an available update and asking for confirmation to proceed to update. In any case, there's no chance of loosing game progress, inventory items, power-ups, score, nor current world/level position.

2D/2.5D, no-pixel art aesthetics. We wanted to give it, at the beginning, a much more minimalist appearence, but it became something much more realistic as time went by. We think it's looking better. The game already went through 3 complete graphic revamping, regarding maps, textures and floors. This 3rd. re-design process was a real major change. It included more textures, more realism, wall crumblings, textures over the walls and top part, improvements in the shadows, and countless other things. We don't discard other modifications in other aspects, if required.

Here's a glympse of how the new map is looking like for World 2. We are still working on it, this is not by any means anything final.

The music goes along the lines of dark classical orchestral music, darkwave, ambient genres. It's composed by Ioann Udartsev, an excellent musician from Russia, with whom we will have a license agreement to use his music in the game, in case the game gets to be released. You can refer to his work here  https://soundcloud.com/ioann-udartsev - Ioann it's a great composer, a great guy and his music fits incredibly well the dark aesthetic of the game, even when it wasn't specifically designed for it.

Regarding sounds, we work mainly with free resources.

As said before, Spheres of Evil OST, averages 1 hour duration, being a compilation of Ioann's music. We will be probably uploading Spheres of Evil OST to youtube once the game is finished.

We've been working with several beta testers and collaborators along all of this time, and their help have been invaluable to fix bugs on time. Also youtubers and streamers, they've all put their 50 cents in order to report bugs and feedback to improve Spheres of Evil. If you want to help beta test the game in this final stage, you are more than welcomed to do it. You can download a demo of the game as detailed in the Download section, way down below and get in touch with us. We will need you make use of any video capturing software of your choice, so you can make footage of your gameplay so you can send it to us, detailing the exact minute/second where you found a bug.

During October and November and until reaching the PC/Windows Early Access version, we are working at:

  • More/new traps (i.e. lava holes, nails)
  • More enemies
  • Improving player feedback during shooting/attacks
  • Menu system
  • Visual effects (rain, fog, lighting)
  • Levels 6 to 10 (4 and 5 are already completed), it will be total 30 levels in the game
  • Gamepad/DPad support
  • Intro/Final scenes & level summary screens
  • Book browsing through the inventory
  • Optimization/Code refactoring
  • Others

We always listen to the feedback of our players and testers, as long as it's constructive criticism. Something we are working on at this very moment refers to the improvement of player feedback, adding more into that matter, specially during combat/shooting situations. i.e. we will be adding more enemies from earlier levels, with little defenses so you can kill them more easily. At the same time, it will add some extra difficulty as they are enemies, just a new type. Also, the current 6 types of enemies are extremely tough to die, we will lower this down a bit. Right now, you can generally kill them if you are leveled-up, something like +4 or x2, which is not that easy to get at first levels. Besides this, more visual effects and yet more player feedback, more camera shaking, more tension overall basically, rewarding the player a little more. More suggestions? You are open to come up with some ideas. Be involved.

The game will be available for PC/Windows in October/November 2018 on Steam, Gamejolt, itch.io and other stores and soon after that, for Windows 10 and Xbox One (UWP version).

Depending on the success of the campaign, it will be ported for Nintendo Switch as well, hopefuly. Following that, Android and iOs versions are also planned.

We came up this long, after 2 years of development, with countless efforts and sacrifices, both personal and economic. I personally was making corporate-based Software and some Web design for businesses for about 2 decades, both as an employee and freelancing. Is not only until 2015 when I came up with the decision that I wanted to make a turn in the career and get back to videogames, something I was doing back in the 90s as a hobby, as a kid, which was always my passion. A change that has been insanely challenging, to say the least. First, because I had to continue working to be able to keep up with life and family expenses, making this game during nights/free time and weekends. Because I also had to also learn many new things. And because I had to invest own savings to outsource graphic design and other costs, for example two new machines.

Professionaly, I have over 2 decades in programming experience (I am not bragging about it, I am telling you where I come from). Personally, I am a dad of two wonderful kids, 2 and 4 years respectively, which they are adorable, but they also bring an insane amount of distraction, so I have to also take care of working when they were sleeping or not at home. This whole 2-year journey has been beyond stress to say the least (those who are dad can really know what I am talking about). I work from home, so as the previous designer and also Giordano, the guy I work with now. I lost count the last time I went to a doctor, for example. There are weeks I don't see the light of the sun. I suffer from anxiety attacks, so it's not easy. None of this project is easy, and the anxiety is just making it all worse some days/weeks.

A contract with the company I work for, for which I was hired to produce and maintain some corporate software, ended up my contract, so I have the need for this proyect to be economically successful, somewhat. I am not making Spheres of Evil to become rich, but to keep improving it, making new versions of it and to also continue making games and stablish ourselves as a small Game studio that is able to survive making games. To achieve this, we only need one thing: your help to help us complete this game in time, in little more than a month and a half. At least the Early Access version. I believe in this game, I believe in its potential. And so all the youtubers, streamers, and press that have been talking and believed always in it, through all these past months. But it's not enough, I need you believe in it as well.

Part of the fundings will be used to cover the rest of development costs as well as graphic design costs, to come up with the PC/Windows Early Access version in early November with 10 levels.

As a supporter, you will be able to come up with ideas to Spheres of Evil, new elements, and as far as possible and within the deadline we have, we could implement them and put your name in the credits. You can leave ideas in the Comments tab.

Reaching a minimum of $1500, PC/Windows Early Access version gets finished. By reaching $4000, the game goes from 10 levels to 30. It takes more than a month and a half, maybe 2, thinking/sketching them, both graphically and level-design wise, then integrating it into the game. That would be the 2nd. important goal to achieve.

story_txt:
*Starts at 7:15
 
*Level 2 - Exit zone
Spheres of Evil it's a tough top-down, action/RPG, puzzle, maze game. You'll have to release souls and destroy Demons from a huge dungeon, while trying to scape all kind of traps and obstacles in your way to the next level's exit zone. It will be also necessary getting the missing pages of an ancient book in order to revert a conjuring.Die over and over again in this game, all the way through 3 worlds and 30 different levels.
Download Spheres of Evil v0.7 (Demo) from Game Jolthttps://gamejolt.com/games/SpheresofEvil/315599*Extract ZIP file contents into a folder in your Desktop.

The game idea is born somewhere during 2015, after watching the final scene from a Stephen King movie, "The Shining", where the main character, Jack, pursues the mother and her son accross a maze, in the snow. Contrary to what some people think, Spheres of Evil isn't based in any classic 80s, 90s game. At the beginning, it was going to be a much more minimalist game, with simple design and mechanics; it's only several months later that the idea of giving it a darker ambience came up, and with it, all the action-RPG elements, and the added complexity.

First of all, sorry if our English is not perfect, we do the best we can. Spanish is our native language. Spheres of Evil was going to be initially a game about demonology, in fact, that's why you see demonic symbology (seals) everywhere in the videos, so it was basically all about releasing demons across the mazes to receive powers. Then, we thought a more interesting twist. There's a saying that goes "Don't deal with the Devil", you surely know it. And that's precisely the story of our unnamed sphere-based character. Attracted by the dark side and occultism, and after disobeying the deals with the demons he worked with, the soul of our sorcerer is then locked inside a Crystal ball and condemned to roll eternally.
To make it worse, he was a powerful magician, so his activities opened the gates of an underworld and hundreds of demons passed through that portal, possessing the souls of men and women. In an act of repentance and in his desperate attempt to recover his human shape and be free and to save the world from this malice, our wizard-sphere has to release these souls by means of exorcisms, which wiill make him grow stronger in power, acquire new skills and get necessary tips to solve the puzzles that will be present in every level. Tips are reveled only when a soul is released from the torment.
But it won't be enough. His knowledge about magic and demons won't allow him to recover his human shape unless he picks the missing pages of a very ancient book. And there are many. The last page, the very last and most important page from the book is obtained in the last level only.


Release souls in order to receive great powers and important information/tips. Most levels will have one or more from a total of nearly a hundred you have to release.
You'll need to find the missing pages of a book, which will revert the spell the demons put on you. This is the first item in the Inventory, you will be able to see its contents as long as you start getting pages.
There are other objects that may be required as well to exit each level.
Escaping each maze (there will be a total of 30 different levels).
It will be necessary to level-up your powers in order to be able to face the demons you'll find in the different stages in the game. They are tough bastards.


*Level 2 - Fire ball power-up
Apart from what has been said, Spheres of Evil is a very addictive game, with a high level of replayability, with several hours of granted gameplay. We can't say an specific number at this point, but there have been people playing it for hours in a row just to get past Level 4. The game was thought since its inception, as a very difficult game, with a special emphasis in a balanced level design. Our main objective was always that you wanted to return to it and continue from where you left, and that you always had fun and granted difficulty. Our focus was always aimed at the gameplay, it had to felt extremely good, it had to be smooth, with tight input/control response. Even since its prototype phase, in 2015, most of it it's there.
The extremely zoomed-in camera view makes you have not clear vision where you are nor where the next trap or enemy will appear, so you will need to somewhat memorize the paths in the mazes and the mazes themselves, and even by doing so, enemies will take you by surprise countless times (see gameplay footage/streams below). The Map object (it's in the Inventory), will be your best allied, but you have limited uses of it, so needs to be used at discretion.
There are some check points in each level (not yet implemented), which could ease things up a little. These saved-points are kept only as long as you are in the current level and will vanish when you try to play the same level again from the level selection screen, or the next time you continue the game. It's possible coming from a level ahead to one you played earlier, maybe to pick up some item of interest, to increase your available shootings, amongst other reasons. It's possible doing it. That's what we was talking about the replayability value. We don't want you pass the levels one after another just to get to the exit zones. We want you to explore every corner of the mazes. We like the completionist type of gamer. There will always be a hidden surprise. (i.e. secret rooms, interdimensional portals, etc.)

Gameplay footage/Streams


*v0.7 Demo- Gameplay footage - UrRandomGamer *Starts at 7:15

*Please note the framerate and the scroll in the game is far smoother than what you can see in these videos. It's an issue of the video-capturing software that have been used, it's capturing at 30fps instead of 60.

 

You will be able to select every resolution your graphic card is capable of, enable/disable VSync, windowed or border-less screen modes, setting the FPS Rate of your choice (60, 72, 75, 85 up to 144), and even typing your own FPS rate value. Game progress is saved as long as you play, it allows several game data files saved in the same device/machine, just as usual in every game. You will be able to choose latest saved game from the menu, chronologicaly, or choose any other saved game through Load Game option.

There are 3 worlds in Spheres of Evil, with 10 levels each, depicting different scenarios. First one has a more abstract aesthetic, with stones/walls of different, pale flat colours, asphalt-like floors, sand, grass, crumbling walls and wiring and other textures. The second world is more of a desert-like theme. There are also secret rooms, which in the first world refers to a sort of street drainage system. The ambience/scenary for the remaining 3rd. world is not yet defined. We would love you suggest your ideas on this regard, this campaign is also meant for this. See "Community" section below.

The enemies won't follow you, they go fixed paths, sometimes from origin to destination, back and forth, sometimes more of a closed circuit path. From Marquises and onwards, they have ability to shoot if you come across their line of fire. Enemies have energy bars and can be effectively be killed. Bear in mind they will revive everytime you die, when the level restarts or when you later revisit the level.
Not only the souls you release will give you powers, you will find power-ups in different spots in the dungeons, the Ice Ball, the Fire Ball, the Electric Ray, the Power of Wind and the Dagger. The powers we receive are the powers from the demons we exorcise. *Some magic symbols/sealsThese Seals are important as reference spots in the maps, there will be over a hundred different symbols. Sometimes, by reaching certain places or getting close to some objects, it will be indicated getting close to certain symbol, as a tip of something important that needs to be picked up or some sort of geographical orientation. So it's important you memorize these symbols position, and somewhat, their names or you will be going around in circles. You have to step over them for a pop-up text to be displayed, which will reveal the name, type and properties of the symbol. Some of them will also allow you get through interdimensional portals, allowing you to teleport to other zones in the map. Some zones will be completely inaccessible and this is the only way to get access to them.

*Some items
There are several items in the game, the Pentagram, the Chaos Symbol, the Clavicula Nox, the Leviathan Symbol, amongst others, each one with its colors and properties. Some objects won't do anything by itself, nor go to the inventory, but will give you a related object when a series of these items are picked up. i.e. You may receive a power-up or increase your available shootings percent, damage level or damage factor (in case you already have it), by picking 5 Green Leviathan objects. The amount of items to pick up, by its type is indicated at the beginning of the level.
There also exists the treasure chest, the map, the invisibility ball, the question mark, amongst others. It's important getting all the objects so to increase your powers, level up and acquire magic. You are going to fight against demons, so you will have to use their own elements and symbols in order to have a chance. You are a sorcerer after all.

*Inventory systemNot all the items collected go into the inventory, so to not flood it and making it hard to explore. So, everytime the same object is picked up, the amount of available uses is displayed in the top-left corner of the item, instead of being added twice. This doesn't apply to keys as they could be used multiple times in the same door of the same level. They don't have any sort of available uses limitation. There are 20 different types of keys. The first item refers to the Book, which will have the missing pages required to beat the game, reverting the conjuring. It has unlimited uses, you can see the book as many times as you want, you will see how the missing pages start appearing as long as you find them. If you know how to read Aramaic language it will have some interesting stuff to read, about magic. It could be an interesting research work by itself, trying to decipher the contents of this book. In fact we added "The Book" item as the highest reward, the last one of the Perks/Tiers, the Sorcerer Perk.


The book is a key element of the game, since it will allow you revert the conjuring that trapped you inside the sphere. To do so, you will need to find the missing pages. It's possible reading it, page by page through the inventory as explained above. It's written in Aramaic language, it contains drawing, symbols, reference tables, descriptions and diverse instructions for the exorcism to be made. The page number will be mentioned everytime you pick up a page so you can go check the Inventory and read it.
The book is a compilation of texts and fragments from an anonymous Grimoire from XVII Century. Which at the same time, is based in really ancient scriptures from XIV or XV centuries, supposedly attributed to a Monk, according to the legend.
*The Book - Graphics *We are working in the texts, diagrams, charts, illustrations and contents of the book at this moment.
When reaching the last level from the last World, it might be necessary revisiting earlier worlds/levels in case of having missing pages.

There exists 4 Magics in the game, that can be accessed through the Inventory. Each one can only have certain amount of uses. Magic 1 produces less damage than 4th, and therefore, less than 2nd. and 3rd. You have to use them with care, they are of limited usage. Ideally, you have to use them when the place is crowded by enemies, for example in Level 5.


The dashboard will be always visible, as soon as you obtain the first power-up. As you can see in the above picture, the dashboard shows the selected power-up, the available shootings percent, the damage level (+2 a +6), the damage factor (x2 a x6), amount of picked-up keys for the current level and the amount of pages you've picked up so far. Alt Key or Button Y in the Gamepad, will allow you alternate powers. We are working right now in an additional row in the dashboard that could display the other items (those referred above) and its quantities.

You will find many doors in the game, that will require a specific switch so to be opened. The grey doors can't be initially opened, contrary to blue and green doors. There are doors of other colors as well. A green switch doesn't mean that will open all the green doors in a level, but one. Oftenly, the door that gets opened by activating a switch, it's far from the switch. You will listen the sound of a heavy door that slides in the floor, as an indication.

 
Only blades have been implemented as a trap, so far, but there will be more, such as the lava holes and the nails. The blades open and close at different time intervals, so you will have to learn the specific timings of each one. These have been a serious problem for everyone that played this game. :)
 *Level 3 -Secret room 1The secret rooms are small areas you can access from different, hidden points in the maps. Did we really say hidden? Full of traps and enemies, they contain great rewards and items.
We are working in some special effects as well, as the fog, lightnings, rain, camera shake at certain events such as dying, amongst others. So when using magics, for example a rain of balls in fire, in case of using the Hathopnasael Magic, an avalanch of rocks in case of Msarahiel Magic, and others.

We've been working with several beta testers and collaborators along all of this time, and their help have been invaluable to fix bugs on time. Also youtubers and streamers, they've all put their 50 cents in order to report bugs and feedback to improve Spheres of Evil. If you want to help beta test the game in this final stage, you are more than welcomed to do it. You can download a demo of the game as detailed in the Download section, way down below and get in touch with us. We will need you make use of any video capturing software of your choice, so you can make footage of your gameplay so you can send it to us, detailing the exact minute/second where you found a bug.

During October and November and until reaching the PC/Windows Early Access version, we are working at:

More/new traps (i.e. lava holes, nails)
More enemies
Improving player feedback during shooting/attacks
Menu system
Visual effects (rain, fog, lighting)
Levels 6 to 10 (4 and 5 are already completed), it will be total 30 levels in the game
Gamepad/DPad support
Intro/Final scenes & level summary screens
Book browsing through the inventory
Optimization/Code refactoring
Others

We always listen to the feedback of our players and testers, as long as it's constructive criticism. Something we are working on at this very moment refers to the improvement of player feedback, adding more into that matter, specially during combat/shooting situations. i.e. we will be adding more enemies from earlier levels, with little defenses so you can kill them more easily. At the same time, it will add some extra difficulty as they are enemies, just a new type. Also, the current 6 types of enemies are extremely tough to die, we will lower this down a bit. Right now, you can generally kill them if you are leveled-up, something like +4 or x2, which is not that easy to get at first levels. Besides this, more visual effects and yet more player feedback, more camera shaking, more tension overall basically, rewarding the player a little more. More suggestions? You are open to come up with some ideas. Be involved.

Optimal Requirements:Windows 7/8.1/10 - 64 BitCore2Duo processor or superior4 GB RAM or moreVideo card with 512MB Video RAM or more

The game will be available for PC/Windows in October/November 2018 on Steam, Gamejolt, itch.io and other stores and soon after that, for Windows 10 and Xbox One (UWP version).
Depending on the success of the campaign, it will be ported for Nintendo Switch as well, hopefuly. Following that, Android and iOs versions are also planned.

We came up this long, after 2 years of development, with countless efforts and sacrifices, both personal and economic. I personally was making corporate-based Software and some Web design for businesses for about 2 decades, both as an employee and freelancing. Is not only until 2015 when I came up with the decision that I wanted to make a turn in the career and get back to videogames, something I was doing back in the 90s as a hobby, as a kid, which was always my passion. A change that has been insanely challenging, to say the least. First, because I had to continue working to be able to keep up with life and family expenses, making this game during nights/free time and weekends. Because I also had to also learn many new things. And because I had to invest own savings to outsource graphic design and other costs, for example two new machines.
Professionaly, I have over 2 decades in programming experience (I am not bragging about it, I am telling you where I come from). Personally, I am a dad of two wonderful kids, 2 and 4 years respectively, which they are adorable, but they also bring an insane amount of distraction, so I have to also take care of working when they were sleeping or not at home. This whole 2-year journey has been beyond stress to say the least (those who are dad can really know what I am talking about). I work from home, so as the previous designer and also Giordano, the guy I work with now. I lost count the last time I went to a doctor, for example. There are weeks I don't see the light of the sun. I suffer from anxiety attacks, so it's not easy. None of this project is easy, and the anxiety is just making it all worse some days/weeks.
A contract with the company I work for, for which I was hired to produce and maintain some corporate software, ended up my contract, so I have the need for this proyect to be economically successful, somewhat. I am not making Spheres of Evil to become rich, but to keep improving it, making new versions of it and to also continue making games and stablish ourselves as a small Game studio that is able to survive making games. To achieve this, we only need one thing: your help to help us complete this game in time, in little more than a month and a half. At least the Early Access version. I believe in this game, I believe in its potential. And so all the youtubers, streamers, and press that have been talking and believed always in it, through all these past months. But it's not enough, I need you believe in it as well.
Part of the fundings will be used to cover the rest of development costs as well as graphic design costs, to come up with the PC/Windows Early Access version in early November with 10 levels.
As a supporter, you will be able to come up with ideas to Spheres of Evil, new elements, and as far as possible and within the deadline we have, we could implement them and put your name in the credits. You can leave ideas in the Comments tab.
Reaching a minimum of $1500, PC/Windows Early Access version gets finished. By reaching $4000, the game goes from 10 levels to 30. It takes more than a month and a half, maybe 2, thinking/sketching them, both graphically and level-design wise, then integrating it into the game. That would be the 2nd. important goal to achieve.

October/November: PC/Windows Early Access version. Will be uploaded to Steam, Gamejolt, itch.io.

We would be doing the versions/ports for Nintendo Switch, Android and iOS after March in 2019, in case the campaign is succesful and the 4th Stretch Goal is reached. It's necessary buying the Nintendo Switch development kit and an iPad for this. These costs are already foreseen from $12500 onwards, as detailed in the Stretch Goals table, above.

It will be available in:Hopefuly in:

The big challenge would be not reaching out the initial $1500. It sounds like little money, but to be honest, we have $0 in our pockets now. We have to work in many different things we don't like to keep putting food on the table, pay the rent, and be there for our family, basically by means of freelance work. That money we ask will allow us work entirely, everyday during October and half of November in the game to hit Early Access statuss in Steam and other stores. Not reaching this 1st. goal, just this 1st. one, will put the whole project at risk, possibly get it cancelled. We will do our best to try to continue no matter what, but it could be delayed several months more, it would maybe not have even the desired 30 levels and there won't be maybe nothing else than a PC/Windows version. It's hard to know at this point. We trust you will like the game, that you will fully support it and that the project will get fully funded, for all platforms and every stretch goal covered.

story:
Background

We have developed N64 and PSX emulator for Xbox One. Through the previous work, we've mastered much knowledge on emulator development. To challenge ourselves with bigger projects, we pick up PS2 emulator as our next milestone. Another reason is that the performance of Xbox One X has reached a level which makes it possible to run a PS2 emulator with dynarec very well.

Challenge

We must build the PS2 emulator as an UWP app in order to run on Xbox One. The project will be based on PCSX2, since it's compatible with about 2600 games. The challenge part is that we must rewrite most of the code to translate the project from x32 ISA into x64 ISA, because only the x64 build of UWP app can run on Xbox One.

The project could be broken into several parts.

  • The new frontend.
  • The core.
  • The 64-bit dynamic recompiler.
  • Plugins including disk, graphics, sound, and input.
  • All 3rd party utilities.

The most challenging part is the 64-bit dynamic recompiler. We must redo the old 32-bit ISA emitter to create another 64-bit ISA emitter. It's very time consuming to write the x64 instruction emitter to create a new 64-bit dynarec. Superb skill is also required for the debug of dynarec to make sure it completely works.

The architecture of PS2 is very complicated compared to N64 and PSX, but we're confident we can handle them just as we do other emulators before.

Team

Such a big project can't be handled by a single person, so we will have a team of 3 C++ veteran to handle the job. In the development phase, we will assign the tasks among our team members so each of us could focus on their own part to speed up the development progress.

We will update the development report to our backers here periodically. You could give us advice on features. We will pick up and implement good ones in the app.

Fund

We set the goal as $100,000, since we must work full time for a year to complete the project.  Each developer of our team is very professional with better project opportunities. PS2 emulator is so complicated that it's impossible to be done alone or by newbie.

Timeline

Crowdfunding: 2018 Dec. ~ 2019 Feb.

Beta release date: 2019 Jul.

Official release date: 2019 Oct.

Patch upgrade: 2019 Oct. ~ 2020 Jan.

story:
Get your backpack ready!         

        After your busy and boring daily life, you finally decided to go on a vacation. This time, you've decided to go on a very long journey to the Hejau Archipelago, a beautiful place with a thousand stories.

        In this game, the player will travel from one island to another, to be able to move to the next island, the player needs to complete the main quest on the current island the player is currently on. The main quests will appear one after another. however, there will be some side quests that the player will discover if they interact with NPCs and/or objects in the game. Besides the quests, there are tons of extra hidden objects scattered around the game world, some quests point the player to some of them, the rest can be found in another way, either directly or through some event or clue.

Hidden objects

There are two types of hidden objects in this game, they are:

  • Quest objects. These are the objects that you need to find to complete certain quest.  
  • Extra objects. These objects are listed on the player's in-game journal, i name the section as "findings". there are three categories of "finding" that the player can find in the game, they are common findings, rare findings and special findings. Each category named base on their difficulties to find.

To sum it up...

The main objective of this game is to complete all the quests and find all the hidden objects including  the extra objects listed on the in-game journal (in the 'findings' section). It sounds easy, but I'll make sure it's not that easy to find ALL of those objects...

Currently, the game is optimized for PC, optimization for another platform may follow, Nintendo Switch is on the consideration.

 

 

Entertaining, informing, educating

It's not that easy to find a game that contains all that aspect above, and that is the purpose of this game. I do and i will do add more and more positive content into the game in terms of education and information aspect, all while making sure it still enjoyable.

For some examples, there is a quest to help a farmer cultivate some kind of tree he used to chop down for his needs. or some hidden objects that contain a piece of information about some kind of endangered animal species. Another quest warns the player to be aware of wild mushroom species, as some of them are poisonous while some are edible and tasty!

The player will also see some kind acts in the game. Let's make sure this game is safe for the kids!

 

The Allocation

If i reach my first goal I'm going to hire some talents to help me speed up the development time and to extend the subscription of my main softwares which are Autodesk 3ds max and Adobe CC. My 3ds max sub will expire in about two months.

Here is the breakdown:

  • Main softwares :   $ 2.115, that is $ 1.545/yr for 3ds max and $570/yr for adobe CC apps
  • Programmer : $ 1.400, est. I have met a programmer that i need to hire, this amount is for his salary for some fixed development point or duration. 
  • 2d and/or 3d artist: $ 1.200, i'm able to do both myself, but i need to hire talents for speeding up the process. This is for 1 month only, will extend if another goal reached.
  • Another $785 is for sound assets and maybe some 3d assets.

Yes, the budget i requested is not big, it's because i'm making sure everything is realistic, well-planned and more than just an imagination. I have planned a stretched goal tho...

 

Get involved!

Help me develop this game! Give me your idea, suggest me a story, a character design, an object to hide! Ask your kids, your brothers and sisters, even your parents, do they like to be 'inside' a game??

Some perks allow the backers to request a character to become an interactable NPC in the game! The backers can even request for his/her own story and quest! Or want some special hidden objects designed? You sure can!

Please go to the perk section for the detail...

 

 

The developer

       My name is Zakky, i'm a solo developer of this game. yes, i do it all myself, that's why i need your help. I choose Indiegogo because it can help me to get not just your financial support, but i also need a community that bonded with the game, a community with lots of ideas to help me make this game more interesting!

Thank you!

      I really hope this campaign to be successful, and also the game itself! Thank you for interested in my project, let's make this OUR project! Support "FIND" and let's step ahead!

Best regards,

Zet Digital

CAMPAIGN PROGRESSION

-110000$----------------------5th language translation: Chinese*LOCKED

-UP FROM HERE--------------FX improvement.*LOCKED

_________________________________________________________________________




Crisis Crunch is a cartoon style adventure where a bunch of workers are trying to sabotage their company, an underworld enterprise of evil. They have been cheated to sign a contract (that they didn’t even read) for a job in hell, losing their souls in the process. They can´t go back to the mortal realm if they don’t destroy their contracts, so together, they plan to bring down the corporation to reach its president: Lucas Feri, the current owner of their souls.

Crisis Crunch is an “in-formal complaint” about mass media,  crisis,  labor situation and  general stupidity of modern society, all combined with high doses of freak culture and audiovisual references.

Crisis Crunch forgets about inventory items and such mechanics, and gives you the opportunity to use the “powers” (let´s better say “inappropriate abilities”) of eight different characters such as: hiper-swiping, accountant analyzing, flashing dentition, super caffeine speed, “fetchbook” profiling and others.






This gang of losers and office fools, is our gang of losers. They are as fucked up by the system as we all were some time in our lives. They are a caricature, a cliché with a turn of the screw.

In Crisis Crunch we have a main character, Guy Guatamez, the eternal intern. To ruin the corporation he will assemble a powerful crew made by: an offhand slang secretary, a cheeky blind administrative with his infernal guide dog, a Colombian ex-revolutionary maid, a handsome marketing guy with a shining dentition, a Zen hag known as the guru psychologist of human resources, a bizarre freaky IT guy and a Chinese accountant who secretly dreams about conquering the world. All of them receive the guiding and counselling of a demoniac beverages machine in their crusade for freedom.


       


Imagine using an extra crunchy bag of crisps to demolish walls, solve puzzles by swiping the floor, use the powerful ears of a blind person to gossip around, intoxicate people with a cheap perfume, use your accountant vision to see unnoticed details, and other even more in-congruent abilities.

Characters will unlock their powers while the story unfolds and you have to decide how those powers could be used to solve the different puzzles and bizarre situations you will encounter. Why collecting stuff around if your characters have all they need?


        


Companions can also participate in the conversations of the main character with the different NPC, if you have the right companion with you when you are in a dialog he or she can intervene (by quickly clicking in the exclamation above his or her head) and the talking will have different conclusion.


         




They are evil, soooo evil! They invented selfies. They are responsible for all that is wrong in the world (of course, it is not human race´s fault!).

Malebolge Corp. is divided in eight Departments of Sin, leaded by their Departament Chiefs: from a lustful rapper, to a greedy banker, from a narcissistic bishop to an evil genius child who creates social platforms, from politicians to military tyrants. The cream of society is in charge of this horrible, horrible place.

This place is full of demons, creatures and zombies who work in their offices, only a 2% of the staff are humans (only because they deduct). Those humans are desperate people that are convinced to sign a contract for an eternal job by losing their souls in the process. Even when they die they will still work in the corporation as zombies.

That’s why our bunch is trying to get out of here and only you can help them.




We thought we have invented the term, but an internet search showed us we were wrong. Yes, electro-oldie is an existing term and yes, we want to use this word to define our core music.

This music is electronic music with the flavour of old TV series intros and retro games tonalities with a bit of surrealism.

Our musicians, Antonio Peña and Julián Rodriguez, great composers and music teachers, that have created OST´s for different films, had found a perfect breakeven between the retro junk and the electronics.

This is our main theme, which is always more dynamic than the other in game tracks, but all the OST in general is full of sutile stridencies combining electronic harmonies and retrogaming themes.





Cartoons, comics and retro videogames inspired us, and this is the result, bigheaded expressive characters with stickman bodies, non auto-smooth animations, speech balloon, a minimalistic interface and agile and asymmetrical designs in the scenarios.




  

  

  

  

   




Why shout when you can laugh? Uncensored talk is great, but uncensored laughs are better.

Let´s laugh about us, about social nonsense, about people in media, about politics, about any other human aspect. We (Crisis Crunch Team) are masochists, we like our characters to rant about us as well (they will do it several times trough the game, you will see), but we are afraid to tell you they will not stop there, we created a monster! (A bunch of them, in fact) they are no longer under our control they are thinking by themselves. But we all are thinking about ourselves ultimately, in this times we are living we must not stop having critical thinking, but we can have it with a smile.

That’s what Crisis Crunch wanted; it addresses social problems and then explodes in laughter. Crisis Crunch is meant to be an exhaust valve for daily frustration, and of course an evasion and a great gaming experience.



Our Main Goal in this campaign is get the PART 1 of the game funded. That includes:  the Prologue and Chapter 1 of the game.

The production will last about 5-7 months and we will release a free playable demo before PART 1 is finished. The game will be in Spanish and English languages.

The idea is to make a crowdfunding campaign for each of the three parts of the game, in total: a prologue and five chapters.

But all depends on our backers. If we have good support in this current campaign maybe we could obtain enough funds to complete also PART 2 and even PART 3 if we are lucky.

You can see in our Funding Barometer, in the section below, what quantities we need for funding each part of the game.

If we reach our main goal and we receive more funds than expected but they are not sufficient to achieve the extra goal of a new chapter, we will save this money for the production of that chapter anyway, and when we make the crowdfunding campaign for that part we will subtract that extra money you gave us in the previous campaign from the funding goal we establish for the next campaign. 

Even if we reach our goal, our Indiegogo profile will be active and you will be able to support us during the production of the parts achieved. Who knows!  Maybe, while we are working on it, you make possible that another part of the game could be developed as well.

This campaign profile will be closed before the last funded part is released. And we will open a new campaign to fund the parts which remains undone, if there are any left.

Also, the benefits we obtain for the sales of the firsts parts will be used for the next part and production until the complete game is finished.



Freedom.

Indiegogo treat you like an adult who knows what he wants, who can make his own decisions about what sell and how to introduce it to the public. And what is important, Indiegogo let the backers decide if a project it´s worthy of their interest, applying less project pre-selection or interfering in the team´s way of doing his will based in their best judgment.

That is why we chose Indiegogo for both our current projects.

Indiegogo works in the same ideological wavelength we do. Creators must be free to introduce their work at their own way and backers and players must be free to support or play the project that means something to them.

·  Because videogames are art, and art is abstraction, is relative.

·  Because videogames are experiences and experiences are something intimate and personal.

Standards could be something useful, but why not convert freedom of expression in a standard?

Funding

Finally, we decide to start a crowdfunding profile in order to fund this great idea, with this money we can access to the resources we need, and invest more personal time in the project.

Your support is essential for us; we want you to feel free to ask anything, that’s why we pretend to have a well attended social community. You are OUR backers!


We are not trying to create a community bigger than we can manage, always quality before quantity or size. To ensure that, we have Community Managing personnel and a team that dangerously enjoys sharing things and gossiping about the project.

Working in this kind of projects is a great experience but, of course, sometimes could be stressful and exhausting. Receiving your cheers, your commentaries or simply your hellos will make us remember why we are doing this, besides, we have a lot to do and a lot to learn and you have a lot to teach us, so we want to be sure you have the correct channels to do so.

A community is very useful. In a community there are always Trimmers (as we call them) people who share their knowledge and give you a lot of advices and suggestions and also, there are Tanglers, people who gives you hope and diffuses the news, people that connect us to others, making Crisis Crunch emerge from the shadows and step up into the digital world.

And of course this and the other spectrums of the cyber-life conforms The Players, people who love gaming, or maybe potential players waiting for the perfect occasion to be initiated in the interactive world, we work for you so…

Trimmers, Tanglers, Players…

Don´t hesitate! Talk to us! We need you! X)


Please, see tiers further explanation in the right column section of this profile.

Remember to specify the name of the chosen tier independently of the quantity donated. It is useful for us and avoid any mistakes.

Our campaign is in dollars but we are Europeans so we work with euros in our daily life. The quantities you can see in this graphics are a dollar translation of the original quantities in euros.

    Trim Tangle is a nexus of entrepreneurs and creative people who loves interactive entertainment, games and digital arts. There are several members in this collective and plenty of ideas and creative proposals arise from its people.

    Actually the core is divided in two different teams working in two simultaneous videogame projects (Crisis Crunch is one of these games), supporting each other when is needed. In this web site you can see our profiles. Besides the teams, there are other nexus members and contacts working in their own board games or pen and paper role play games or digital and artistic projects.

    We consider games a tool to transmit and express, a tool to connect to others, for us is the perfect channel to send a message, to generate an experience and, of course, a great way of entertainment. Videogames nurture from literature, cinema, arts, music and science to create something unique.

    Nevertheless, in this times we are facing, videogames (and other digital arts) must evolve, not being just a way of evasion but a way to learn, to understand the human world. Videogames must not been reclusive but connective.

    Adults have been cheated to avoid games, except those considered appropriate for their ages. With this we made a terrible mistake, this generation is starting to realize it.

    But that doesn’t apply to us, we believe in games as we believe in any kind of artistic expression, and we see both as what they are, a way of innovation, vindication and communication, part of the tangle that weave us together, because we are Trim Tangle.



             

    This is one of the teams of the Trim Tangle Nexus, the direct responsibles of the Crisis Crunch project:

                                        

         Diego Corzón

          Game Designer,    Interactive Writer, Characters,GUI Design and Animation.

                                  

    “World is changing, humanity is changing, games and videogames must be part of the change” this messianic deviant is our Game Designer, an idea breeding machine who always convince us to follow him in his weird experiments. He is one of the promoters of the Trim Tangle Nexus and is the only one in charge of the two videogames projects supported by Trim Tangle.

    Corzón give his back to a finished Laws Degree and then studied DGAC (Digital Graphic and Artistic Creation) learning about traditional and new techniques of illustration, design and animation. Not having enough, his delirium led him to other weird careers as Narrative Creation, Interactive Writing and Game Designing, his ultimate passion. Heavens knows how, he has published tales, articles and essays and has earned some prizes and nominations in poetry comic and writing minor competitions.

    Simultaneously to the both videogame projects (Crisis Crunch and Therefore), he is working in a Pen and Paper project, promoting a social collective and practicing as a mediator.

     Corzón loves games and videogames over all, in fact we think he lives in a perpetual videogame (¿Isla Piñata, maybe?), he uses literature, philosophy, art, comic, Theater and the entire audiovisual spectrum to shape his interactive and philosophical nonsense, and sometimes, just sometimes, some of them worked.


         David González

          Lead programmer, Web Programmer.

                                 

    You cannot escape from his eye; he sees every detail, perceives every change in your mood and localizes any error. This boy with analytic brain and poetic soul is our lead programmer, capable of thinking programming solutions while he is ashing his underpants or taking a beer.

    He is hyper responsible and thorough, he is our inside Trimmer and he doesn't like imperfection.

    Besides being a great opera singer and a daily philosopher, is a talented Computer Engineer well versed in web and mobile app development, and a hardcore gamer very fond of strategy, graphic adventures and turn-based RPG. Simultaneously to Crisis Crunch he is working in an engineering team of a Tech Start-up.

    If Corzón is the mother of Crisis Crunch he is the father, giving birth together the game idea, David never lets “his son” suffering of lack of attention and care, and always used his time quenching the project everlasting hunger of productivity .

    To David everything matter, all, even the little things of life and details have their importance (we told you he was a philosopher) that’s why he thinks inattentive behavior dishonored a great idea and the effort of a passionate team, and he will not allow that!


        “Hombre Fotolito"

         Graphic Designer and Fx Creator, Character Designer, Animatics.

                                        

    What would happened if you mixed the moods of John Wayne, the good weave of Shaggy from Scooby-Doo and the artistic perception of Andy Warhol? Easy you will get “Hombre Fotolito”. He is graphic and artistic creator, graphic animator, letterer, poster artist and printing expert and he is known in artistic circles by this name.

    He has no fear of proving new thing and is a trustful partner. If you ask him about help you out in a bizarre project he will look at you calmly he will take a sip of his Whisky Dry and he will say: When we start?

    As his secret identity: Daniel Gutierrez, he has studied DGAC (Digital Graphic and Artistic Creation), also Graphic Design and Typographic Creation, and has worked as designer in marketing and communication companies, design studios and printing enterprises. He loves graphic arts, audiovisuals and videogames.

    Paradoxically, his cowboy looks hide a sensible heart which despairs when see consumerist behavior and he tries to change this from the inside in his job, you could see a feeble shivering in his eyes when he is surrounded by “ capitalistic nonsense” (Sales, Black Fridays..). We love him anyway.


         Melvira

          Background Designer, Concept Artist.

                                         

    The beauty of her drawings has an easy explanation, her hands only canalizes the beauty of her heart. Melvira believes in what remains beyond the false glitter coverage of the mass media, in the charm of the easy and caring things.

    Sometime she uses art and eroticism as a way for people to claim the beauty of all human bodies. As she says: “everyone is beautiful in its own way”. But sorry folks! Not this time, this time she will use her art skills to help us create some laughs, a great way as any other to reclaim the best of us and accept the worst.

    She is a great illustrator and concept artist and she studied Artistic Designing and Illustration and has worked as a concept-artist, character and GUI designer in recently launched videogame projects as Grumpy Reaper form Drakhar Studios o Kambu Mistery island. Simultaneously to Crisis Crunch she is working as a tale illustrator for Blue Tale Company.

    Working alongside her is like enter in a Zen garden, sometimes she felt a little disheartened by the worst part of the world we live in but the Nexus always returns what it receives (and Melvira is always giving) so we constantly encourage her to continue inspiring people with her work, full of freedom of expression and universal acceptance .


         Julián Rodríguez & Antonio Peña

                              

     -Julián Rodríguez

     OST Composer and Musician.

    Julián knows classical harmonies and experimental ones combined could lead you to something never achieved before. He has expertise on that.

    You could see him magical appearing in any project where musical innovation is the main theme. And if this doesn´t satisfy his artistically hunger he will try to innovate and collaborate with any audiovisual and cultural show.

    He made the Original Soundtrack of a lot of movies as: “The enchanted Forest”, "DeProfundis", “Guts” and many others including animation and independent films (in some of them he teamed up with his actual creative companion Antonio Peña) and even made compositions for live theatre.

    He graduated in Composition and Orchestration, Piano and Musical Language and is president of “Colorsonoro”, a Spanish association for electronic music development and video art. He also teaches in the conservatory.

    Nobody trust more than Julián in the capacity of music to give, and even to guide, guide us into our feelings, guide us into a story, guide into to the future; for him composition and innovation must walk side by side.

    With his artistic associate Antonio Peñas both form a duo capable of tearing down any barriers of musical freedom of expression with their head held high.


    -Antonio Peña

    OST Composer and Musician

    Anything could lead to music and music could lead us to anything, and that is something Antonio Peñas realized long time ago. From modern music to the classics, from electro-acoustic to unplugged, he walk trough all the musical spectrum never making stops.

    He is composer, guitarist, pianist an jazz musician, and has created a Big Band and played with famous singers as Maite Da Costa, Julie Guravich, Cristal Méndez Queizán and others.

    He made the OST of both commercial and independent films as: "Dreams of a Summer Night”, “The Apostle” “Wrap up” and many others (some of them in company of his associate Julián Rodriguez). He also composes for experimental music labs and events while teaching in the conservatory.

    He is as versatile as sound itself and never loses the chance to show how music could flow through the gaps in the wall of our collective clichés and start to erode it. We believe that is what he saw in our Project: a chance to contribute in the creation of a good laugh-sledgehammer to make social status quo tremor a little without forgetting to have a good time.

    Antonio, as well as his partner Julián, are both “beyond-goers” as we call them, and they have a outlandish, funny and professional repertory ready to crash any self-arrogance Crisis Crunch could have.


         María Benítez Acosta

           Community Manager.

                                   


    Librarian during the day, Community Manager by night. Worlds of information and social networking have no secrets for her. Her vocation is to set up relations, to discover new pathways, to develop alliances. 

    Maria studied Library Science and she worked at the documentation centers of some law firms and public libraries. Discovering, afterwards, an unambiguous relation between her past and her future, she decided to study for Community Manager. Ever since, she didn't stop exploring and (why deny it?) playing with 2.0 web possibilities. 

    Currently she collaborates with a librarian web portal, coordinating sections and writing some posts about social media, books and libraries. She is also making her first steps in illustration, more specifically in the dark world of librarian fanzines. 

    Always restless, her hobbies are related with art, design and creation, going from digital to traditional (such as crochet or decorated cookies). Undoubtedly, this was the key to create such affinity with the rest of the Nexus (especially for the cookies). 

    Her motto is that everything must be perfectly written, connected, organized and classified, professional bias in its entire splendor. She will be in charge of dealing with hungry trolls in the virtual world and helping any curious people that approaches to our project.



    Things must change, we all know that. Sometimes addressing  problems with a caustic smile is a powerful tool. We think videogames must transmit, must be involved in human issues and that includes the social taboos: politics, religion and mass media. Games are not just entertainment they can serve for multiples human purposes as, for example, a vindicating tool.

    In all our games we want to send a message to  society, to people, because, without that, you can have a game, yeah maybe, but you don´t have a game experience. And experiences are what shape us.




    1. At the same time we are working in this project we are trying to survive XD, we have to earn money somehow so most of us have to spend hours in mid-time jobs and private design requests, funding would help us to dedicate to our project the time it deserves. Nobody wants a member of team leaving because he cannot afford to spend his time in the project. That would be sad because we all know this is what we really want to do, so it wouldn't be easy for this person to leave.

    2. We have to accept it, production peaks happens, but we are a very stubborn team, in fact all Trim Tangle Nexus is made of stubborn people (sorry pals, it´s true), we don’t give up so easily. Production issues have appeared and will appear but we handled them before and will handle them in the future. Of course, there are always be less delays if people could focus all their attention to the project and invest most of their time in its conclusion, again, funding will help us a lot with this fact.

    3. Our greatest nightmare is not to be in touch with you people! Videogame production could be a very “absorbent” job. But we cannot allow ourselves to be out of your reach, we have an excellent community manager and other outer allies who will help us to be constantly updating and sending you news about the project.

     We begged them to create a system which forces each one of us, in despite of the production work, to make a window to personally update some inside info and personally answer some of your comments from time to time. You are our Backers! (Did I already say that?)



    If you cannot donate, don’t worry friends! You can spread the word! Be our Tangler!, Be the one that connects us to the backers and players. Trough Indiegogo you can share our profile in Facebook, Twitter or Youtube, or you can send our web address to friends and family, our Facebook is hungry for new friends as well as the rest of our social media. 



    •  What platforms will this game be available on?

    Linux, Mac and Pc.  With enough funds: tablets for sure and maybe some consoles.


    •  Crisis Crunch would be purchased through Steam?

    We hope so, we are preparing ourselves for Steam Greenlight.


    •  Will it be sold in chapters?

    If funded it will be sold in three parts:

    First part (the main goal of the actual campaign): Playable Prologue and Chapter 1.

    Second part: Chapter 2 and Chapter 3.

    Third Part: Chapter 4 and Chapter 5.


    •  Will this game be available to Streamers and Youtubers?

    Yes and Yes


    •  Would be Crisis Crunch DRM free?

    Yes sir!


    •  Will be a physical box for the game once in the market?

    Due to the format of the game that could be a future possibility, but in this moment we are focused in digital distribution.


    •  Windows/Mac/Linux versions must be purchased separately?

    Nope.


    •  What languages will Crisis Crunch be available in?

    Spanish and English, but we can translate it to other languages if the requirements of our Funding Barometer are met.
