Crisis Crunch is a cartoon style adventure where a bunch of workers are trying to sabotage their company, an underworld enterprise of evil. They have been cheated to sign a contract (that they didn’t even read) for a job in hell, losing their souls in the process. They can´t go back to the mortal realm if they don’t destroy their contracts, so together, they plan to bring down the corporation to reach its president: Lucas Feri, the current owner of their souls.
Crisis Crunch is an “in-formal complaint” about mass media,  crisis,  labor situation and  general stupidity of modern society, all combined with high doses of freak culture and audiovisual references.
Crisis Crunch forgets about inventory items and such mechanics, and gives you the opportunity to use the “powers” (let´s better say “inappropriate abilities”) of eight different characters such as: hiper-swiping, accountant analyzing, flashing dentition, super caffeine speed, “fetchbook” profiling and others.












This gang of losers and office fools, is our gang of
losers. They are as fucked up by the system as we all were some time in our
lives. They are a caricature, a cliché with a turn of the screw.
In Crisis Crunch
we have a main character, Guy
 Guatamez, the eternal intern. To
ruin the corporation he will assemble a powerful crew made by: an offhand slang
secretary, a cheeky blind administrative with his infernal guide dog, a Colombian
ex-revolutionary maid, a handsome marketing guy with a shining dentition, a Zen
hag known as the guru psychologist of human resources, a bizarre freaky IT guy
and a Chinese accountant who secretly dreams about conquering the world. All of
them receive the guiding and counselling of a demoniac beverages machine in
their crusade for freedom.


       

Imagine using an extra crunchy bag of crisps to
demolish walls, solve puzzles by swiping the floor, use the powerful ears of a
blind person to gossip around, intoxicate people with a cheap perfume, use your
accountant vision to see unnoticed details, and other even more in-congruent
abilities.
Characters will unlock their powers while the story unfolds
and you have to decide how those powers could be used to solve the different
puzzles and bizarre situations you will encounter. Why collecting stuff around
if your characters have all they need?


        

Companions can also participate in the conversations
of the main character with the different NPC, if you have the right companion
with you when you are in a dialog he or she can intervene (by quickly clicking in
the exclamation above his or her head) and the talking will have different
conclusion.


         





They are evil, soooo evil! They invented selfies. They are responsible for all that is wrong in the world (of course, it is not human race´s fault!). 
Malebolge Corp. is divided in eight Departments of Sin,
leaded by their Departament Chiefs: from a lustful rapper, to a greedy banker,
from a narcissistic bishop to an evil genius child who creates social
platforms, from politicians to military tyrants. The cream of society is in
charge of this horrible, horrible place.
This place is full of demons, creatures and zombies
who work in their offices, only a 2% of the staff are humans (only because they
deduct). Those humans are desperate people that are convinced to sign a
contract for an eternal job by losing their souls in the process. Even when
they die they will still work in the corporation as zombies.
That’s why our bunch is trying to get out of here and
only you can help them.






We thought we have invented the term, but an internet search
showed us we were wrong. Yes, electro-oldie is an existing term and yes, we
want to use this word to define our core music.
This music is electronic music with the flavour of old
TV series intros and retro games tonalities with a bit of surrealism.
Our musicians, Antonio
Peña and Julián Rodriguez,
great composers and music teachers, that have created OST´s for different films,
had found a perfect breakeven between the retro junk and the electronics. 
This is our main theme, which is always more dynamic
than the other in game tracks, but all the OST in general is full of sutile stridencies
combining electronic harmonies and retrogaming themes.







Cartoons, comics and retro videogames inspired us, and
this is the result, bigheaded expressive characters with stickman bodies, non
auto-smooth animations, speech balloon, a minimalistic interface and agile and
asymmetrical designs in the scenarios. 






  

  

  

  

   




Why shout when you can laugh? Uncensored talk is
great, but uncensored laughs are better.
Let´s laugh about us, about social nonsense, about
people in media, about politics, about any other human aspect. We (Crisis Crunch Team) are masochists, we
like our characters to rant about us as well (they will do it several times
trough the game, you will see), but we are afraid to tell you they will not
stop there, we created a monster! (A bunch of them, in fact) they are no longer
under our control they are thinking by themselves. But we all are thinking
about ourselves ultimately, in this times we are living we must not stop having
critical thinking, but we can have it with a smile.
That’s what Crisis
Crunch wanted; it addresses social problems and then explodes in laughter. Crisis Crunch is meant to be an exhaust
valve for daily frustration, and of course an evasion and a great gaming
experience.

A
red trading card of one of the stars of the Hellebrities
Collection based on the Backer.



IMPORTANT: 
When the last part of the game will going to released, we will make a public announcement and the auctioned rewards winners will be settled. Those contributions made after this announcement will have no access to auctioned rewards because we will need time to personalize this rewards according to the backer in order for them to have their contribution prizes in time for the launch of the complete game.
In case of having various persons with the same amount of contributions, the reward will be for those who supported us first (considering the date of the donation).


Rewards aclarations:
Hellebrities Trading cards: The most famous collection in the Underworld, Hellebrities represents the sour and
cream of the Hell, the stars of the infernal mass media and high class
The trading cards are hidden in the game scenarios and
you have to found all of them, to unlock some extras in the main menu.
With some auctioned rewards you can have a Hellebrity based in you, we will contact
you in order to ask for some information and some silly answers to some even
sillier questions in order to create your Hellebrity.
If you win the golden or silver auctioned reward we will also create a multiple
choice dialogue with this information.
Also we will give you some tips of where to find your
trading card in the game.
Note: All the Hellebrities
trading cards are interactive content.







You can deduce from this budget that all
team members and collaborators of Team Crunch are passionate for indie projects,
in fact, they have been working until this moment just for passion (that means:
unpaid) and after we have the funding, they are going to work receiving a very
low compensation, normally, less than a half (even a third) of the salary standards
related to their professions. 

Our campaign is in dollars but we are Europeans
so we work with euros in our daily life. The quantities you can see in this
graphics are a dollar translation of the original quantities in euros.








From 110.000 USD we will use the money to support other
aspects of the productions, as game events, press appearances, social
management, upgrades... 





  




Trim Tangle is a nexus of entrepreneurs and creative people who loves
interactive entertainment, games and digital arts. There are several members in
this collective and plenty of ideas and creative proposals arise from its
people.
Actually the core is divided in
two different teams working in two simultaneous videogame projects (Crisis Crunch is one of these games), supporting
each other when is needed. In this web site you can see our profiles. Besides
the teams, there are other nexus members and contacts working in their own
board games or pen and paper role play games or digital and artistic projects.
We consider games a tool to transmit and
express, a tool to connect to others, for us is the perfect channel to send a
message, to generate an experience and, of course, a great way of entertainment.
Videogames nurture from literature, cinema, arts, music and science to create
something unique.
Nevertheless, in this times we are
facing, videogames (and other digital arts) must evolve, not being just a way
of evasion but a way to learn, to understand the human world. Videogames must
not been reclusive but connective.
Adults have been cheated to avoid games,
except those considered appropriate for their ages. With this we made a
terrible mistake, this generation is starting to realize it.
But that doesn’t apply to us, we believe
in games as we believe in any kind of artistic expression, and we see both as
what they are, a way of innovation, vindication and communication, part of the
tangle that weave us together, because we are Trim Tangle.


         
This is one of the teams of the Trim Tangle Nexus, the direct responsibles
of the Crisis Crunch project:
                                    
     Diego Corzón
      Game Designer,    Interactive Writer, Characters,GUI Design and Animation.
                              
“World is changing, humanity is changing, games and
videogames must be part of the change” this messianic deviant is our Game
Designer, an idea breeding machine who always convince us to follow him in his
weird experiments. He is one of the promoters of the Trim Tangle Nexus and is the only one in charge of the two videogames projects supported by Trim
Tangle.
Corzón give his back to a finished Laws Degree and
then studied DGAC (Digital Graphic and Artistic Creation) learning about
traditional and new techniques of illustration, design and animation. Not
having enough, his delirium led him to other weird careers as Narrative
Creation, Interactive Writing and Game Designing, his ultimate passion. Heavens
knows how, he has published tales, articles and essays and has earned some
prizes and nominations in poetry comic and writing minor competitions.
Simultaneously to the both videogame projects (Crisis Crunch and Therefore), he is working in a Pen and Paper project, promoting a
social collective and practicing as a mediator.
 Corzón loves
games and videogames over all, in fact we think he lives in a perpetual
videogame (¿Isla Piñata, maybe?), he uses literature, philosophy, art, comic, Theater and the entire audiovisual spectrum to shape his interactive and
philosophical nonsense, and sometimes, just sometimes, some of them worked.


     David González
      Lead programmer, Web Programmer.
                             
You cannot escape from his eye;
he sees every detail, perceives every change in your mood and localizes any
error. This boy with analytic brain and poetic soul is our lead programmer,
capable of thinking programming solutions while he is ashing his underpants or
taking a beer.
He is hyper responsible and
thorough, he is our inside Trimmer and he doesn't like imperfection. 
Besides being a great opera singer and a daily
philosopher, is a talented Computer Engineer well versed in web and mobile app development, and a hardcore gamer very fond of strategy, graphic adventures
and turn-based RPG. Simultaneously to Crisis
Crunch he is working in an engineering team of a Tech Start-up.
If Corzón is the mother of Crisis Crunch he is the father, giving
birth together the game idea, David never lets “his son” suffering of lack of
attention and care, and always used his time quenching the project everlasting
hunger of productivity .
To David everything matter,
all, even the little things of life and details have their importance (we told
you he was a philosopher) that’s why he thinks inattentive behavior dishonored
a great idea and the effort of a passionate team, and he will not allow that!

    “Hombre Fotolito"
     Graphic Designer and Fx Creator, Character
Designer, Animatics.

                                    
What would happened if you mixed the moods of John
Wayne, the good weave of Shaggy from Scooby-Doo and the artistic perception of
Andy Warhol? Easy you will get “Hombre Fotolito”. He is graphic and artistic
creator, graphic animator, letterer, poster artist and printing expert and he
is known in artistic circles by this name.
He has no fear of proving new thing and is a trustful
partner. If you ask him about help you out in a bizarre project he will look at
you calmly he will take a sip of his Whisky Dry and he will say: When we start?
As his secret identity: Daniel Gutierrez, he has studied DGAC (Digital Graphic and Artistic
Creation), also Graphic Design and Typographic Creation, and has worked as
designer in marketing and communication companies, design studios and printing enterprises.
He loves graphic arts, audiovisuals and videogames.
Paradoxically, his cowboy looks hide a sensible heart
which despairs when see consumerist behavior and he tries to change this from
the inside in his job, you could see a feeble shivering in his eyes when he is
surrounded by “ capitalistic nonsense” (Sales, Black Fridays..). We love him
anyway.

     Melvira
      Background Designer, Concept Artist.

                                     
The beauty of her drawings has an easy explanation,
her hands only canalizes the beauty of her heart. Melvira believes in what
remains beyond the false glitter coverage of the mass media, in the charm of
the easy and caring things. 
Sometime she uses art and eroticism as a way for
people to claim the beauty of all human bodies. As she says: “everyone is
beautiful in its own way”. But sorry folks! Not this time, this time she will
use her art skills to help us create some laughs, a great way as any other to reclaim
the best of us and accept the worst.
She is a great illustrator and concept artist and she studied
Artistic Designing and Illustration and has worked as a concept-artist,
character and GUI designer in recently launched videogame projects as Grumpy Reaper form Drakhar Studios o Kambu Mistery
island. Simultaneously to Crisis
Crunch she is working as a tale illustrator for Blue Tale Company.
Working alongside her is like enter in a Zen garden,
sometimes she felt a little disheartened by the worst part of the world we live
in but the Nexus always returns what it receives (and Melvira is always giving)
so we constantly encourage her to continue inspiring people with her work, full
of freedom of expression and universal acceptance . 

     Julián Rodríguez & Antonio Peña
                          
 -Julián Rodríguez


 OST Composer and Musician.




Julián knows classical
harmonies and experimental ones combined could lead you to something never
achieved before. He has expertise on that.
You could see him
magical appearing in any project where musical innovation is the main theme.
And if this doesn´t satisfy his artistically hunger he will try to innovate and
collaborate with any audiovisual and cultural show. 
He made the Original Soundtrack
of a lot of movies as: “The enchanted Forest”,
"DeProfundis", “Guts” and many
others including animation and independent films (in some of them he teamed up
with his actual creative companion Antonio Peña) and even made compositions for live theatre.

He graduated in
Composition and Orchestration, Piano and Musical Language and is president of “Colorsonoro”, a Spanish association for electronic
music development and video art. He also teaches in the conservatory.
Nobody trust more than
Julián in the capacity of music to give, and even to guide, guide us into our feelings,
guide us into a story, guide into to the future; for him composition and
innovation must walk side by side.





With his artistic
associate Antonio
 Peñas both form a duo capable of
tearing down any barriers of musical freedom of expression with their head held
high.


-Antonio Peña
OST Composer and Musician
Anything could lead to
music and music could lead us to anything, and that is something Antonio Peñas
realized long time ago. From modern music to the classics, from electro-acoustic
to unplugged, he walk trough all the musical spectrum never making stops.
He is
composer, guitarist, pianist an jazz musician, and has created a Big Band and
played with famous singers as Maite Da Costa,
Julie Guravich, Cristal Méndez Queizán and
others.
He made the OST of both
commercial and independent films as: "Dreams of a Summer Night”, “The
Apostle” “Wrap up” and many others (some of them in company of his associate Julián Rodriguez).
He also composes for experimental music labs and events while teaching in the
conservatory.
He is as versatile as sound
itself and never loses the chance to show how music could flow through the gaps
in the wall of our collective clichés and start to erode it. We believe that is
what he saw in our Project: a chance to contribute in the creation of a good
laugh-sledgehammer to make social status quo
tremor a little without forgetting to have a good time.
Antonio, as well as his
partner Julián, are both “beyond-goers” as we call them, and they have a outlandish,
funny and professional repertory ready to crash any self-arrogance Crisis Crunch could have.

     María Benítez
Acosta
       Community Manager.

                               


Librarian during the day, Community Manager by night. Worlds of information and
social networking have no secrets for her. Her vocation is to set up
relations, to discover new pathways, to develop alliances. 
Maria studied Library
Science and she worked at the documentation centers of some law
firms and public libraries. Discovering, afterwards, an
unambiguous relation between her past and her future, she decided to study for Community
Manager. Ever since, she didn't stop exploring and (why deny it?) playing with
2.0 web possibilities. 
Currently she collaborates with a librarian web
portal, coordinating sections and writing some posts about social media,
books and libraries. She is also making her first steps in illustration, more
specifically in the dark world of librarian fanzines. 
Always restless, her hobbies are related with art,
design and creation, going from digital to traditional (such as crochet or
decorated cookies). Undoubtedly, this was the key to create such affinity with
the rest of the Nexus (especially for the cookies). 
Her motto is that everything must be perfectly
written, connected, organized and classified, professional bias in its entire splendor.
She will be in charge of dealing with hungry trolls in the virtual
world and helping any curious people that approaches to our project.



Things must change, we all know that. Sometimes addressing  problems with a caustic smile is a powerful tool. We think videogames must
transmit, must be involved in human issues and that includes the social taboos:
politics, religion and mass media. Games are not just entertainment they can
serve for multiples human purposes as, for example, a vindicating tool.
In all our games we want to send a message to  society,
to people, because, without that, you can have a game, yeah maybe, but you
don´t have a game experience. And experiences are what shape us.




1. At the same time we are working in this project we
are trying to survive XD, we have to earn money somehow so most of us have to
spend hours in mid-time jobs and private design requests, funding would help us
to dedicate to our project the time it deserves. Nobody wants a member of team
leaving because he cannot afford to spend his time in the project. That would
be sad because we all know this is what we really want to do, so it wouldn't be
easy for this person to leave.
2. We have to accept it, production peaks happens, but
we are a very stubborn team, in fact all Trim
Tangle Nexus is made of stubborn people (sorry pals, it´s true), we don’t
give up so easily. Production issues have appeared and will appear but we
handled them before and will handle them in the future. Of course, there are
always be less delays if people could focus all their attention to the project
and invest most of their time in its conclusion, again, funding will help us a
lot with this fact.
3. Our greatest nightmare is not to be in touch with
you people! Videogame production could be a very “absorbent” job. But we cannot
allow ourselves to be out of your reach, we have an excellent community manager
and other outer allies who will help us to be constantly updating and sending
you news about the project.
 We begged them
to create a system which forces each one of us, in despite of the production
work, to make a window to personally update some inside info and personally
answer some of your comments from time to time. You are our Backers! (Did I
already say that?)







If you cannot donate, don’t worry friends! You can spread
the word! Be our Tangler!, Be the one that connects us to the backers and
players. Trough Indiegogo you can share our profile in Facebook, Twitter or Youtube, or you can send our web address to friends and family, our Facebook is
hungry for new friends as well as the rest of our social media. 






•  What platforms will this game be
available on?
Linux, Mac and Pc.  With enough funds: tablets for sure and maybe some consoles.

•  Crisis Crunch would be purchased
through Steam?
We hope so, we are preparing ourselves for Steam Greenlight.

•  Will it be sold in chapters?
If funded it will be sold in three parts:
First part (the main goal of the actual campaign): Playable Prologue and Chapter 1.
Second part: Chapter 2 and Chapter 3.
Third Part: Chapter 4 and Chapter 5.

•  Will this game be available to
Streamers and Youtubers?
Yes and Yes

•  Would be Crisis Crunch DRM free?
Yes sir!

•  Will be a physical box for the game
once in the market?
Due to the format of the game
that could be a future possibility, but in this moment we are focused in
digital distribution.

•  Windows/Mac/Linux versions must be
purchased separately?
Nope.

•   What languages will Crisis Crunch be
available in?
Spanish and English, but we
can translate it to other languages if the requirements of our Funding
Barometer are met.

story:
This game will by available for Windows (or for 1,7 Mil € for XBO and PS 4 too).

Facebook | Twitter | Google | Tumblr | Stumbleupon | Flickr | Website

Obelisc Studio and our game designers Andy Fink and Mateusz Polak are excited to bring you a new role-playing game for the PC (and maybe for XBO and PS4).

Legacy of Magic aims to recapture the magic, imagination, depth and nostalgia of classic RPG's that we enjoyed making - and playing. At Obelisc we have the people responsible for many of those classic games and we want to bring these games back. That’s why we’re here - we need your help to make it reality!




Legacy of Magic will take the central hero, memorable companions and the epic exploration of Centura World included intense and epic combats and dungeons and tie it all together with the emotional writing and mature thematic exploration of this World.

Combat uses a tactical real-time with pause system - positioning your party and coordinating attacks and abilities is one of the keys to success. The world map is dotted with unique locations and wilderness ripe for exploration and questing. You’ll create your own character and collect companions along the way – taking him or her not just through this story, but, with your continued support, through future adventures. You will engage in dialogues that are deep, and offer many choices to determine the fate of you and your party. …and you'll experience a story that explores mature themes and presents you with complex, difficult choices to shape how your story plays out.

We are excited at this chance to create something new, yet reminiscent of those great games and we want you to be a part of it as well. 

Game pictures:


We are an independent video game developer specializing in role-playing games.  We were founded in 2014 by two game developer veterans: Andrzej Fink and Mateusz Polak. At Obelisc Studio we have created great softwares along with dozens of other talented artists, programmers, and designers.

Together we have been developing computer role-playing games for a very long time, and to this day there is still nothing we love making and playing more than RPGs.



We have wanted to go back to our gaming roots and create an epic PC role-playing game adventure for years. But, it's been almost impossible to get funding through traditional methods for a game like this. The great thing about Indiegogo is that we can go directly to the people who love to play RPGs as much as we love to make them. Plus, we don’t have to make compromises with a publisher. We make the development decisions, we market the game, and we don't have to answer to anyone but you – our fans.

Our relationship with you can be even closer with Indiegogo. We can be more transparent with development and give you an inside look to what goes on day-to-day with the programmers, artists, and designers of Legacy of Magic. We want to give you a behind the scenes look at the game's development, and we have fun stuff planned like developer blogs, web broadcasts, dev chats, and much, much more.


We need to raise $1.1 million to fund an experienced team to do this right. We are asking for more than a lot of the other Indiegogo projects and that’s because we are not only making a game, we are creating a whole new world. That means a new RPG system, entirely new art, new characters and animation and whole lot of lore and dialogue (in English, German, Russian and Polish). We’ve also designed the game to have a flexible budget and scope, so if we reach our target budget goal, we have a list great stuff we can add into the mix through stretch goals. And, additional money we raise will go straight into the game to add new levels, companions, NPCs, features, and even entirely new parts of the world which will add hours and hours to the adventure.

Looking to customize your reward tier a bit?  Add the following on to your pledge using the Manage Pledge button at the top of the Legacy of Magic Indiegogo site.

Note: Digital Add-Ons require base pledge to be at the $20 tier and above. Physical Add-Ons, such as T-Shirts, need the base pledge to be at a physical tier level ($65, $100, $140, and $250+) to cover the shipping and handling fee.

Digital Add-Ons (Require $20 tier and above):

·  Digital Download of Expansion Pack +$20 (included in tiers $165 and above)

·  Digital Strategy Guide +$7 (included in tiers $80 and above)

·  Early Access Beta Key +$25 (included in tiers $110 and above)

·  Extra Digital Download of the Game +$25

·  Extra Three Digital Downloads of the Game +$60

·  And moreee...

Physical Add-Ons (Require Physical Tier: $65, $100, $140, and $250+):

·  Audio CD Soundtrack +$20

·  Legacy of Magic Mouse Pad +$15 (included in physical above tiers $140 and above)

·  White Legacy of Magic T-Shirt +$25 (included in physical above tiers $100 and above)

·  or white Obelisc T-Shirt +$25


For T-shirt add-ons, we will ask for the size that you want at the end of the Indiegogo campaign in a survey that will be sent to you in e-mail.

Need a bit more help on how to work with add-ons? Contact us by e-mail or by Twitter and Facebook.



This product is proudly participating in Brian Fargo's Kicking it Forward program, where 5% of this project's profit will be used as pledges for other Kickstarter or Indiegogo projects!

FAQ

- How will i get my digital copy of the Game?

Once the Kickstarter ends, every backer will receive a survey asking them what platform and distribution network they would like. We now proudly support both GOG and Steam, so if you prefer DRM-free, you can choose the GOG option, and if you like Steam's integration, including achievements, and possibly cloud saves, you'll be able to choose that as well.

If you buy additional copies as add-ons, you'll be able to tell us which one you want per key.

- What languages will LEGACY of MAGIC be in?

The initial release will be in English, French, German, Spanish, Russian, and Polish. We are also looking for ways of translating the game for our fans all over the rest of the world. As we have more information and our funding increases, we’ll make sure to keep everyone update on what languages will be coming with Project Eternity.

- What about other Platforms?

LEGACY of MAGIC supports Windows PC (€ 1,100,000 EUR)

XBO, PS4 = (€ 1,700,000 EUR)

Xbox 360, PS3 = (€ 2,300,000 EUR)

- Can I use PayPal?

Yes! PayPal support is available via the LEGACY of MAGIC web page at http://obelisc.de/paypal. Don't worry if you missed paying for international shipping - we'll handle this later through our website. At that point you will be able to pay for shipping or any other related charges.

- What file formats will the Digital Download of the Soundtrack be available in?

We are going to be offering both MP3 and FLAC formats for the soundtrack when it becomes available for download.

- What are the system requirements for LEGACY of MAGIC

It's too early in development to give hardware requirements. Our target is to run on better machines and to support a wide variety of hardware. We will be announcing the system requirements at a later date so stay tuned for an announcement down the road.

- What ist he difference between the Strategy Guide and the Collector’s Book?

Strategy Guide = Tips and Tricks on how to play the game. Collector's Book = Art, Concepts, Making Of/Behind the Scenes, Monster Info, additional lore, and info on companions/characters

PayPal support is available via the LEGACY of MAGIC web page at http://obelisc.de/paypal. Don't worry if
you missed paying for international shipping - we'll handle this later through
our website. At that point you will be able to pay for shipping or any other
related charges.
- What file formats will the Digital
Download of the Soundtrack be available in?
We are
going to be offering both MP3 and FLAC formats for the soundtrack when it
becomes available for download.
- What are the system requirements for
LEGACY of MAGIC
It's
too early in development to give hardware requirements. Our target is to run on
better machines and to support a wide variety of hardware. We will be announcing
the system requirements at a later date so stay tuned for an announcement down
the road.
- What ist he difference between the Strategy Guide and the Collector’s Book?
Strategy
Guide = Tips and Tricks on how to play the game. Collector's Book = Art,
Concepts, Making Of/Behind the Scenes, Monster Info, additional lore, and info
on companions/characters

story:
Funding Total 480.000 $

Download free application in Play market or App store!

MyCheburashka App - created to meet new people and love.

Modern alternative to dating sites. Everyone is tired of the typical dating sites, and we offer you a completely new format!

The application will be available to everyone. At any point on the globe, you'll find the company of friends.

App will be released in English, German, Spanish, Russian and Kazakh. Subsequently, there will be more languages.

The application is very simple and straightforward to use.

We make a simple sign up (name/user name, age, photo).

A profile can be connected to VK, Instagram, Facebook etc., if needed. After registration is completed, we are transferred to a map where icons show users having made their requests.

To make a request, one should press on special icon in the left menu.

Then we are transferred to Select Page

  • Café, cinema and dominos (Coffee, cinema, theatre, dinner)
  • Have fun (I mean have a drink). Sub-sections (night clubs, private party, city drive (any vehicle? yes/no) rolling stones (bowling/billiards).
  • Healthy Lifestyle (Gym and fitness, by wheels (bike), on foot (city walk).
  • Hullabaloo! (your variants, nature, paintball, snowboard).

Next step will be choose time & place.  

That's all, your offer is ready to use! Everybody in the world can see it.

Now you know how to make offers, lets look how to see on the map categories of applications which in you are interested. Because of a big number of users who  make offers, you will not see anything.

In filter menu you may choose with who you want to meet. It may be man or women, 20 or 40 years old, and you may choose date also.

We know that all people in our world can not live without communication. So we add in our application chat. You may write to who you want.

In the future we will improve this function.

 

Here you may see the majority of our categories. This is just “Active recreation” :

We hope, that you will find real friends with MyCheburashka!



 

Our plans:

 

  • Page 1 – beautiful animation – Cheburashka comes in and says, ‘Let’s go and find some friends!’, and START button (the very first time when downloading the web-site).
  • Remove bottom GO BACK EVERYWHERE. GO BACK throughout the Application via swipe from left to right.
  • Likes – on the right, under the photo.
  • Add Photo – put it the first square to My Photos.
  • In paid version, there should be a figure of Cheburashka a user can dress up for money and the like (think about where and how to do that).
  • To leave a like, a user is to double click the photo or click a HEART one time.

And this is just a part of our plans.

Where the money will go?

story:
Hello everyone!

My name is Roar and i study Software at DTU in Denmark. 
This project is a non-mandatory project which already is going great! The conversion from the old platforms regards to storylines and features are all coming together. 
Since I am a student i don't have a lot of free time, so if you fund this project i can afford to put all my efforts into this project instead of another non-practical redundant student job. 
Helping me with this project will earn you the rights to use the game for free as a thanks for supporting my passion! 

I wish to gather the equivalence of 500$, just enough for food and livings as i will not have time for a job in the meantime. 
In case that the goal is not completely reaches and the 3D game will not cover all the loved old storylines, the game will still be available with the remaining storylines. 
If you are fond of the old pokemon series, i highly recommend you being a part of this campaign, as you will gain the experience of reliving them in a whole new way, is if you were catching the real pokemons yourself. 


One possible risk of this campaign is the CopyRight issues with using the old storylines. This is an issue which is already being taken care of, by modifying minor parts of the progress, but still keeping the major and important aspects as we remember and love. 


If you wish to help this campaign grow but can't contribute please spread the word and i hope it all becomes possible! Thank you for your time.

story:
How Smart Toybox Works

 

Smart Toybox is the first connected toy box that turns cleaning up toys into a fun game.

After the playtime, you can start the clean-up game. The toy box will start singing and calling kids to feed it with toys. When the toy ends up in the box, it will "chew" it or "slurp" it, say „nom nom nom“, or play some other funny sound. If the toy box is overturned, it will giggle or scream.

You can use our preset sound theme, or define your own sounds. New sounds are easily recorded, tweaked (change sound effects) and transferred to the toy box using 1-click touch in the Smart Toybox's mobile application. Record your voice, cartoon or “cute-ify” it and send it to the toy box, than watch for your child's reaction. Multi language or language neutral themes are supported!

Mobile App

 

Smart Toybox app (for iOS and Android) extends gameplay to the virtual world and allows kids and parents to be creative using simple touch controls. At the same time, it enhances gameplay with physical box and keeps Smart Toybox exciting for a long time. With mobile app, you can:

  • download and share sounds with friends,
  • easily record new funny sounds,
  • 1-click to send sounds to Smart Toybox,
  • fully customize toy box's settings.

Smart Toybox in the News!

 

Stretched Goals

 

 

€100,000 - Multibox - Smart Toyboxes work together creating pleasant audio from one "personality" instead of cacophony of individual boxes. Multiple toy boxes can play additional educational and competitive games, such as learning what is left and what is right, throwing the ball and many more, for both single and multiple children.

€150,000 - Create your own game - If we meet this goal, we will upgrade our mobile application with tool to create your own games for Smart Toybox that is fun and easy to use. This way children and even grownups will easily learn core programming concepts, such as logic, building structure, event handling, etc.

What do we need money for?

We have created Smart Toybox prototype and demo mobile app, and tested it in all sorts of conditions for hundreds of hours, in kindergartens and in the lab. We've listened to your feedback about features, and integrated them into hardware design for the final product.

Now it's time for the last step – manufacturing – and this is where we need your help. We need to cover costs of tooling, procurement of components and setting up the first production batch.

Timeline

 

Meet the Team

 

Our team was founded from top experts in software industry, who lead many successful projects, such as TomTom Bandit Action Camera, Smith Micro's CheckIt Diagnostics and more. You can learn more about our team here.

Nebojša Sumrak, Cofounder & CEO
Dad and creative innovator with 20+ years of experience in SW and management
MSc in IT Management
@nsumrak

 

Jelena Petra Marković, Cofounder & CTO
SW engineer with 10 years of professional experience
MSc in Mathematics and Computer Science
@gfa_petra

 

Vladimir Perić, Cofounder & COO
Software engineer with over 12 years of experience
MSc in Structural Engineering
@perovlad

 

On top of Smart Toybox's full-time team, we partnered with top designers, engineers, and industry experts. If you would like to work with Smart Toybox, contact us at jobs@smarttoybox.com.

Specifications

Kid's age group: 1 - 7 years
Toy box: collapsible
Dimensions: 33cm × 33cm × 45cm (13" x 13" x 17.5") *
Power: 4 AA batteries (rechargeable or alkaline)

Hardware
 

Connectivity: 2.4 GHz WiFi (802.11 b/g/n)
WiFi modes: station, AP, or offline
WiFi Security: depending on the local network settings (WPA2-PSK/AES recommended)
Mobile platforms: iOS, Android
Audio: built-in speaker
Sensors: accelerometer, weight sensors

* might slightly change in manufacturing process

Spread our Story

 

Even if you can't contribute, we ask for your help in raising awareness. We're grateful to you for sharing this on social media with the Indiegogo sharing tools below or emailing the page to someone you feel could benefit from Smart Toybox.

Website: smarttoybox.com
Twitter: twitter.com/smart_toybox
Facebook: facebook.com/smarttoybox

story:
Short Summary

Created by Syntek Industries LLC, Glendale/Los Angeles CA, USA.

Syntek Industries LLC is an indie game company that was launched in 2016 however the inspiration that created the company and the ideas behind the game have long existed.

Some of the principals that the game and company are based on are:

  • Gaming can be productive, how do we achieve that? One way is donating 5-15% of the fully released games profits to nonprofits organizations. Another way is allowing our players to take each other money whenever they defeat an enemy.
  • Players in select states, countries and provinces can play competitively to earn credits which are exchangeable for real money paid out in USD.
  • Play casually for fun if you just want some excitement, and a good time.
  • Games shouldn't force you to buy their latest DLC every few months, or make the game unplayable without the latest content pack. ALL of our maps and future content is and will always be free to those players who have already purchased the game.
  • Weapon skin crates, explosives, special grenades, and daily deals in the item shop will not all be free, however they can mostly be purchased with CM credits which regenerate with time daily. You also have a chance of finding items in every game you play. Which gives players who do not like buying items lots of chances of getting that gear that they are seeking without spending any real money.

 

By now if you're interested in getting involved please know you are getting involved with a shift in gaming. By voting with your dollars you allow us to create and set up a slightly brighter future of gaming that we all want to see.

Map Updates



Black Friday




Bunker Battle Area 15

 

 

Cabin Fever


 

 

                                       Commerce Park

 

 

Dollar Store

 

 

Excelsior

 

 

Expedite

 

 

Free Parking

 

 

 

Station 69

 

Work Space

 

 

GAMEPLAY TRAILER COMING SOON!

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • As stated our game company is a small one, we just gained a programming partner, and we've had our great lawyer at Wolk & Levine, .
    • Funds generated here will go toward finishing and launching the game as well as a marketing budget for the game.
      • By getting involved you will receive digital copies of the game, future updated DLC, and the eternal unwavering support from a Dev team who always has the player experience in mind.
      • Only the full version of the game will support competitive play for real money. Players who chose to play competitively must live in territories that allow skill based gaming, more information will be released on the competitive page of our website.
  • Help us finish and launch our game so we can start changing not only the gaming community but real life communities around the world too.

The Impact

Blood Bank has been working under the hood and on paper for about 8 years now, that being said it has been a long way from concept to implementation. Blood Bank on the back-end is almost done and ready to release for Alpha/Beta/Full release.

We need to go full time and to wrap up everything and finally come full circle. We need to set up some of our servers, pay our programmers to get through the final coding hurdles and to do some marketing since we're fully indie and DRM free. No publisher, no third party application that you need to run it.

When the full game comes out, players who are eligible have a variety of cash out methods, deposit to bank accounts, or credit/debit cards, or sign up for our very own branded re-loadable visa debit card.

 

 

 

Cheaters..

With the premise of our game being based around making money, many of you must be wondering how we'll protect our players from cheaters and hackers. We're proud to announce that once we're authorize, we will be using in game detection and auto ban methods.

Realistically, every game has hackers. We will have a few in game policies to ensure that hackers have a VERY hard time getting through the cracks.

Here are a few of our anti-hack policies:

  1. If you are reported by other players for hacking multiple times within a week then your account is temporarily suspended until an admin can ensure that you are not hacking.
  2. You cannot withdraw your funds while you have pending hacker reports.
  3.  If you are caught hacking, your account will be permanently banned, and we will attempt to redistribute your credits to the players that they came from.
  4. These policies, coupled with our auto detection, and back-end logging technology will hopefully make it more expensive than profitable to hack. These measures will ensure that everyone has a fair, and fun time playing!

Risks & Challenges

As a game that promises so much you would expect tons of hurdles to overcome otherwise you would think someone would of done it before. These obstacles could be in the form of:

  • Legality in different states, and countries. * Handled by our amazing lawyer linked above.
  • Cheaters and abuse * Handled by our policies, auto detection methods, and a dynamic way of thinking.
  • Servers and back end logging * Handled by Playfab & Exit Games.
  • Awareness - Being super indie our hardest obstacle is simply getting the game in front of our consumers, you the player basis. It takes money or people sharing our game to receive the attention it needs.  We don't work through a publisher or a group of greedy people who scheme at the top to pinch every penny at the expense of the player experience.
  • Being Indie - A few years ago, we debuted our idea and a trailer on Steam Greenlight, we quickly rose to the top of the Greenlight program, becoming a top 20 rated  game out of 2200 others on the Greenlight program. After a few weeks we were rejected due incompatibility, they didn't like the fact that we allow players to withdraw their RM credits back out of the game and into their real wallets. It has been a struggle bringing this to market, and public attention; this campaign is to help create awareness about what we want to finish and release into market. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our website, this campaign, or just tell your favorite friend about how the game works.
  • Watch our Youtube videos and share them on social media.
  • Like our facebook page, and send us a message; tell us how you feel about the game.
  • Get involved with our free giveaways on our website, you could win the game for free.

 

 

For more information on competitive play please visit our games website here, BloodBank.gg.

 

*Please note that competitive play won't be added until the full game is released.*

And that's all there is to it; Thank You for reading and getting involved.

story:
I asked my lovely niece to draw my favorite game

                                                             About Game: 

I've got a plan to create an anti-stress online browser game, as well as a game version for smartphones and tablets. In many Japanese companies one can find specialized rooms, where employees may de-stress themselves. And I would like to move such an anti-stress room to the Internet. For every person could de-stress himself with this game. 
The game will allow any person to de-stress himself or herself. But primarily it will de-stress office workers because there is always too much tension and stress at work. Using my game people will have a chance to reduce tension and relax, come back to their normal state of mind and get back to work doing it in a calm way and forgetting about their unpleasant talk to a boss. 

                                                                Idea: 

The idea of this game came to my mind, when I bought an anti-stress stuffed toy to my lovely niece. Seeing her positive reaction, that volume of unbelievable delight and the way how she treated this toy, I came up with an idea to create such a game. 
                                             About One Japanese Tradition: 
Large Japanese corporations have special rooms of psychological relaxation. Employees de-stress themselves by throwing darts into their boss' portrait and kicking a dummy portraying him. These rooms even include specialized "yelling vases", where you can pour out all your negative emotions. 


                                                      Learn More About Game: 

A player will have a chance to submit photos and select from a number of special tools. A free account will have the following tools: 

1.throw a snowball, 

2.cake, 

3.tomatoes, 

4.berries 

Premium account users will have the following tools: 

1.Boxing gloves, 

2.a chance to paint a photo, 

3.paintball, 

4.darts

I know how the game should look like. The only thing left is to make this come true. I've already got a team of specialists, who will execute this plan. 
                                                        
                                             
                                            How My Game Differs from Others: 

My game differs, for example, from that one, where a player needs to destroy a broken computer, in one thing: here a player's anger will be addressed not to a subject, but towards a person, who has offended, brought you down or caused stress and tension. story:
Download the demo for your platform:

 

Corporation Infinity invented the QMRD - Quantum Matter Reproduction Device. After the leakage of the device from the Corporation lab it fell into the hands of ordinary people and began to spread very quickly. 

In a short time almost everyone on Earth had the QMRD. People cloned everything that came under their hands: money, food, energy and even themselves. Very soon, the world plunged into chaos. Trying to fix it the main character heads to the center of the Corporation. 

Too much read? Watch Jacksepticeye playing the game

The World Of Infinity Inc. is chock-full of deadly traps, and only cloning can help the main hero to survive. To solve various puzzles the player will need to switch between his clones, cooperate and control them to help each other. 

Many clones have to sacrifice themselves so the main hero could continue his way to the center of the Infinity Corporation.

TRAPS

Having noticed anything dangerous it's better to play safe and create a clone.

In the world of Infinity Inc. there are a lot of traps, lasers, presses, freeze guns, and much more.

 

PUZZLES

Not all the clones will survive solving deadly puzzles, but don't feel sorry for them after all, that is what they were created for!

They can interact with the environment: shut off the force field, destroy lasers, and support each other.

GREENLIT!

Make sure your Quantum Matter Reproduction Device is charged before you pull the trigger! Otherwise you may get errors while cloning

 

The art in the game is quite diverse and each location is unique in it's own way. I can make the art more interesting and juicy with your help.

You will learn the story from different characters and sources: radio, TV, etc. Examples:

Train Driver: https://soundcloud.com/george-kobyakov/train-driver/s-QAc8C

Loudspeaker: https://soundcloud.com/george-kobyakov/infinity-inc-loudspeaker/s-g5xF6

 I need the money to complete the project at the appropriate level of quality.

I set goals in order to add or improve really important aspects of the game, nothing more. But if you have something to offer then be sure to write in the comments and we'll discuss it!

Check out the perks in the sidebar to see what you get a certain item for.

Be sure to visit the website and subscribe to blog updates. I like to share the details of the development with the community. The more grows your number the more often I write.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/TheShpufa

Website: http://www.theshpufa.com/

I have been working on the game for over a year and a lot has already been done. The game has a playable demo, but do not forget that it is not final. The release is scheduled for fall 2017.

The game has been Greenlit, thanks everyone for your votes!

The only thing I want after a year of development is to make it even more interesting and high-quality game. 

I put all of my effort but I need help to complete the game. IndieGoGo is an excellent tool for the indie developer with no budget or publisher.

Your contribution will REALLY help to complete the game and make it really cool.

We are George and Helena Kobyakov, developers from Ukraine, now living in Turkey. Since 2012, we worked on flash games and have released more than 10 games amongst which the most well-known are Acorn Story, How Dare You, The Ultimate Clicker Squad, and Infinity Inc.

Excellent gamers' feedback and interesting setting of Infinity Inc. inspired us to make this game even better. Recently our daughter was born, therefore, I develop the game alone, but my wife supports me and is a constant talkpartner on some gamedesign theme :)

Friends, thank you for your interest in this project! We would be grateful for any support.

 If you are not able to contribute - just share the information about our project on the Internet, it would be a huge help for us! And, of course, take care of your clones! 

Links:

- Official page

- Developer's twitter

- Steam Greenlight

story:
Monkey See Monkey Do



      We all have habits we would like to change. For me, it's sugar. For other people it might be soft drinks, tobacco or fried foods, to name a few. Even though we know that changing these habits is in our best interest, it can be hard to do. This game is aimed to help us live a healthier life using science. 

      My name is Jordan. I am currently starting my PhD in cognitive neuroscience. But before I begin the mind-numbing tedium of pushing out scientific journal articles, I wanted to make something that was actually useful to people. This game is that something. 

How it works


      The idea is simple. When we see something we get pleasure from, we want it. For me, when I walk down a super market isle and see a candy bar, I know I will get pleasure from eating it, and so I tend to want it. This game allows us to practice dissociating the stimulus from reward; essentially it is practice at ignoring the object of habit. This is where the game gets the name 'Mizaru' from; Mizaru is the name of the 'see no evil' monkey. 

    Though the idea may seem almost too simple, it has some backing in science. There are several studies demonstrating that inhibiting (stopping) a response to pictures of unhealthy food, while responding to healthy food, can affect open eating choices (see for example Veloing, Aarts & Stroebe, 2013 and Houben & Jansen, 2011). 

      When I initially read these studies, I thought they were pretty neat, but very limited. It seemed unlikely that people would sit down and push a button for half an hour before they go out to eat. So my idea is to make this into an accessible smart phone app, which can be played a few minutes at a time, and overtime help us live a healthier life. Further, I have extended the boundaries of what this app will target. The current list of habits targeted include: 
Tobacco

Marijuana

Sugary foods

Fried foods 

Alcohol 

Soft drinks 


      I have also included three further categories which fall under a slightly different area: 
Inactivity (being lazy)

Snakes

Spiders


     There are two types of games I have included in the program so far. Firstly I have made a game sort of like Fruit Ninja:

    


      In this game, you basically cut the good food, while avoiding the bad food.    
 
      And secondly I have made a game like Wac-a-Mole:

 
       In this game, construction workers pop up from man holes holding or throwing different items and you have to use your jack hammer to destroy the healthy items. This game is also a little trickier, in the final level (of 5) of difficulty, the color of the hats sometimes lies to you. Though this seems like a cheap trick, it makes the process of inhibition more difficult, and may mean stronger transfer to everyday life. 

      On that note, I have also added control of the speed with which the items appear, and the rate of occurrence of the bad items. Generally, the faster the items appear and disappear, the quicker you have to react and the more difficult it is to stop a (prepotent or readied) response. Further, the more rarely the bad items occur, the higher the response prepotency (readiness) and again, the more difficult the response is to stop. These are elements of the game I wish for feedback on to guild further scientific investigations. 

      In addition to these two games, I will also make a third game, however I am planning to leave that up to a vote as to what it will actually be. I have a few ideas, but I thought I would let the community put forward some ideas before putting them to the vote. More details will follow later as this campaign progresses. 

Why Indiegogo


      There are three reasons why I have set up this project on Indiegogo. Firstly, I am no game designer. I have the basic game structure, and the physics work well, but I want the game to be something that people really want to play. If people won't play it, then there is no point in making the game. So I wish to use the funding from this project to: 

Help optimize the game for smart phones
Extend the games parameters, including further images for each category
Get help from a designer to make the game look and play better
Make music for the game

      Secondly, I think crowdfunding is the best way to spread awareness about this game. Right now, the internet is awash with games, so the odds of finding this specific game is very low. And if no one finds the game, then, again, there is no point in making it.  

      Tied to this is the third reason for using Indiegogo for funding this game, and is the real reason I am making this game. I would like to use feedback from players of this game to see which categories, under which types of games and in what conditions, helped them the most. This will guild further research into the area. For example, if it turns out practicing ignoring spiders makes people less afraid when they see a spider, then I can follow up with this in the lab, using objective measures of fear to see how people will respond after playing these types of games. So really, I want people to have an app that allows them to change their habits. I want it to be the best game it can be. And I want your help to guild that process. 

Risks & Challenges

      Most of the risk in this project is in terms of time. As we head into the holiday season, work that is outsourced to other people may slow down. Having said that, the beta game should be delivered on time. 


      Secondly, it is worth noting that, though there has been studies done on this topic, the field is still rather young. It is possible that the above studies were 'lucky' to find an effect, and perhaps this game, in this format, will do nothing. This is especially true for the extra three categories mentioned above; food, smoking and marijuana are all things people enjoy, while spiders etc. are not. So perhaps these categories will be of no help at all. 


      However, I would prefer it if you think of your contribution, and feedback, as helping direct further research, rather than a complete product in itself. In this way, if only one person gives feedback, and this helps guild future investigations in even the smallest way, the campaign will have been a success. 


      This campaign is an all-or-nothing type of funding deal, so if the target isn't reached, no worries, the money will be refunded to the backers. 


Other Ways You Can Help

     If you like science like I do, or know someone who has been trying to change a habit, let them know about this game! I really want to see this help people, and the more players there are, the better able I will be able to guild future research. So make some noise! I think this game is a cool idea, if you do too, but don't want to contribute, no problem, but let people know about it!


Thanks everyone for your support.
